original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: sarba tantra sya ni d'a na ma h'a gu hya shri sampu ta tantra r'a dza n'a ma t'i k'a ratna m'a la n'a ma /
analyzed: sarba tantra sya ni d'a na ma h'a gu hya shri sampu ta tantra r'a dza n'a ma t'i k'a ratna m'a la n'a ma /
translated: Sarvatantra-syanidanam-mahaguhyashri-samputatantra-rajanama-tika-ratnamalan nama.

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi dang gsang chen dpal kun du kha sbyor zhes bya ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rgya cher bshad pa rin chen phreng ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi dang gsang chen dpal kun du kha sbyor zhes bya ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po'i rgya cher bshad pa rin chen phreng ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The Commentary on the King of Tantras Called the Glorious Union of All Buddhas, the Basis of All Tantras, the Great Secret, Called the Garland of Jewels.

original: dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Vajra Dakini.

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid can //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid can //
translated: The one with the nature of method and wisdom,🔽The nondual perfect enjoyment,

original: gnyis med rdzogs longs spyod pa dang // drag po 'jigs byed 'dul mdzad pa //
analyzed: gnyis med rdzogs longs spyod pa dang // drag po 'jigs byed 'dul mdzad pa //
translated: The one who tames the fierce and frightening,

original: spyi bos btud la kha sbyor bshad //
analyzed: spyi bos btud la kha sbyor bshad //
translated: I bow my head and explain the union.

original: brjod bya rgyu yi don yin la //
analyzed: brjod bya rgyu yi don yin la //
translated: The subject matter is the meaning of the cause,

original: rtogs pa dgos pa yin par bshad //
analyzed: rtogs pa dgos pa yin par bshad //
translated: And realization is explained as the purpose.

original: snod bcud thams cad bde chen du rtogs pa mthar thug ste /
analyzed: snod bcud thams cad bde chen du rtogs pa mthar thug ste /
translated: The ultimate realization is the entire world and its beings as great bliss.

original: 'brel pa shugs las rtogs par 'dod //
analyzed: 'brel pa shugs las rtogs par 'dod //
translated: The connection is understood implicitly.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don ni /
translated: The concise meaning is as follows:

original: gleng gzhi dang / rgyu dang / rjes su yi rang bas bstod pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: gleng gzhi dang / rgyu dang / rjes su yi rang bas bstod pa gsum yin la /
translated: The introduction, the cause, and the praise by rejoicing.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gleng gzhi bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba nas gsungs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gleng gzhi bstan to //
translated: The passage from Thus have I heard up to spoken teaches the introduction.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ston pas gleng bslang ba dang / 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu zhes bya ba nas nyan par 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'khor gyis gleng bslang ba bstan to //🔽bka' @2a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas 'dzum pa mdzad do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ston pas gleng bslang ba dang / 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu zhes bya ba nas nyan par 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis 'khor gyis gleng bslang ba bstan to // bka' @2a * //
translated: The passage from Then up to he smiled teaches the introduction by the teacher, and the passage from Immediately after he smiled up to we wish to hear teaches the introduction by the retinue.

original: stsal to zhes bya ba nas yon tan gyi 'byung gnas legs so legs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis skabs dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: stsal to zhes bya ba nas yon tan gyi 'byung gnas legs so legs so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis skabs dbye ba bstan to //
translated: The passage from He said up to the source of good qualities, excellent, excellent! teaches the opportunity.

original: rgyud kyi mtshan bshad pa dang bzhi yin la /🔽rdo rje snying po la sogs pa nas /🔽dbang bskur nyid kyis mtshon byed do //
analyzed: rgyud kyi mtshan bshad pa dang bzhi yin la / rdo rje snying po la sogs pa nas / dbang bskur nyid kyis mtshon byed do //
translated: The explanation of the name of the tantra, and the fourth is the explanation of the name.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mtshan bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mtshan bstan to //
translated: The passage from vajra essence up to the one to be illustrated by the empowerment teaches the name.

original: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab bdag nyid rgyud //
translated: The tantra of the nature of method and wisdom.

original: ces bya ba nas le'u dang po'i rab tu byed pa bzhi dang le'u lnga'i rab tu byed pa lnga las brtse ba'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis zab pa'i rdzogs rim bsgom pa bstan to //🔽de la thabs dang shes rab kyi rgyud nas /🔽ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: ces bya ba nas le'u dang po'i rab tu byed pa bzhi dang le'u lnga'i rab tu byed pa lnga las brtse ba'i tshul gyis bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis zab pa'i rdzogs rim bsgom pa bstan to // de la thabs dang shes rab kyi rgyud nas / ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: From Thus up to the end of the first chapter, and from The four chapters of the first chapter up to One should meditate with the method of love in the five chapters of the fifth chapter, the profound completion stage meditation is taught.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis las gsum gyi thun mong gi shes bya bstan to //🔽sngon du mtshan nyid bstan pa bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba nas /🔽mya ngan las 'das dpa' bo yin //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar gyis grol ba'i lam bstan pa dang / ma dang sring mo nyid dang ni //🔽zhes bya ba nas /🔽nor bu 'dzin sogs lam gyi rigs //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis las gsum gyi thun mong gi shes bya bstan to // sngon du mtshan nyid bstan pa bzhin // zhes bya ba nas / mya ngan las 'das dpa' bo yin // zhes bya ba'i bar gyis grol ba'i lam bstan pa dang / ma dang sring mo nyid dang ni // zhes bya ba nas / nor bu 'dzin sogs lam gyi rigs //
translated: Among those, from In the tantras of method and wisdom up to One should accomplish as one wishes, the common knowledge of the three actions is taught.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis chags pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar gyis chags pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: From First, as taught in the characteristics up to The hero of nirvana, the path of liberation is taught, and from Mother and sisterhood up to The family of the path of Manidhara and so forth teaches the path of passion.

original: sgom pa po med ces bya ba nas bsam gtan bde brjod ces bya ba'i bar gyis rang lhag pa'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: sgom pa po med ces bya ba nas bsam gtan bde brjod ces bya ba'i bar gyis rang lhag pa'i lam bstan to //
translated: The passage from “There is no meditator” up to “The bliss of concentration” teaches the path of the self-empowerment.

original: rab tu byed pa gnyis pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi sems rtsa ba'i 'khor lo snang ba dang bcas pa bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gnyis pas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi sems rtsa ba'i 'khor lo snang ba dang bcas pa bstan to //
translated: The second chapter teaches the root wheel of the mind of enlightenment with the light of the factors of enlightenment.

original: rab tu byed pa gsum pas bde @2b mchog dang mnyam sbyor gyi gleng gzhi bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gsum pas bde @2b mchog dang mnyam sbyor gyi gleng gzhi bstan to //
translated: The third chapter teaches the nidāna of the Cakrasaṃvara and the Sampuṭa.

original: rab tu byed pa bzhi pas gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa'i gleng gzhi rgyas par bstan pa dang / le'u gnyis pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po las chu dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes gsum gyi dbang bskur ba bstan pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bzhi pas gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa'i gleng gzhi rgyas par bstan pa dang / le'u gnyis pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po las chu dang gsang ba dang shes rab ye shes gsum gyi dbang bskur ba bstan pa dang /
translated: The fourth chapter teaches the extensive nidāna of the Guhyasamāja and so forth, and the first chapter of the second part teaches the abhiṣeka of the three: the water, the secret, and the prajñā-jñāna.

original: rab tu byed pa gnyis pas bzhi pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zab pa'i rdzogs rim bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gnyis pas bzhi pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i zab pa'i rdzogs rim bstan to //
translated: The second chapter teaches the profound completion stage of the inconceivable fourth.

original: le'u gnyis pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa nas le'u bzhi pa'i rab tu byed pa bzhi dang drug gis bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pa nas le'u bzhi pa'i rab tu byed pa bzhi dang drug gis bskyed pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: The third chapter-section of chapter two through the fourth and sixth chapter-sections of chapter four teach the creation stage.

original: de la dang pos ni he ru ka du ma bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni he ru ka du ma bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: Among them, the first teaches the meditation of many Herukas.

original: gnyis pas ni sgrol ma 'byung ba'i rgyud kyi lha mo du ma bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni sgrol ma 'byung ba'i rgyud kyi lha mo du ma bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The second teaches the meditation of many goddesses of the Tārā-tantra.

original: gsum pas ni phyag rgya drug gi bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: gsum pas ni phyag rgya drug gi bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The third teaches the meditation of the six seals.

original: bzhi pas ni rdo rje gdan bzhi'i ye shes mkha' 'gro bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni rdo rje gdan bzhi'i ye shes mkha' 'gro bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The fourth teaches the meditation of the Jñānadākinī of the Vajracatuḥpīṭha.

original: lnga pas ni bdag med ma bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: lnga pas ni bdag med ma bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The fifth teaches the meditation of Nairātmya.

original: drug pas ni de nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud dang mthun pa'i bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: drug pas ni de nyid bsdus pa'i rgyud dang mthun pa'i bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: The sixth teaches the meditation in accordance with the Tattvasamgraha-tantra.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i rab tu byed pa bzhi dang / le'u lnga pa'i rab tu byed pa gnyis kas bskyed rdzogs gnyis brten par byed pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i rab tu byed pa bzhi dang / le'u lnga pa'i rab tu byed pa gnyis kas bskyed rdzogs gnyis brten par byed pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor lo bstan to //
translated: Both the fourth chapter-section of chapter four and the two chapter-sections of chapter five teach the gaṇacakra that supports the two, creation and completion.

original: de la dang pos yi ge brda'i mtshan nyid dang gnyis pas dbang bskur ba'i lha mo'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la dang pos yi ge brda'i mtshan nyid dang gnyis pas dbang bskur ba'i lha mo'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The first [chapter] teaches the characteristics of the symbolic script, and the second teaches the characteristics of the goddesses who confer initiation.

original: gsum pas dpa' bo dang bka' nod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bzhi pas de rnams kyi yan lag gi brda'i mtshan nyid dang / lnga pas tshogs 'khor gyi gnas kyi mtshan nyid dang / drug pas snying gar 'khor lo bsgom pa nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: gsum pas dpa' bo dang bka' nod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bzhi pas de rnams kyi yan lag gi brda'i mtshan nyid dang / lnga pas tshogs 'khor gyi gnas kyi mtshan nyid dang / drug pas snying gar 'khor lo bsgom pa nas tshogs kyi 'khor lo bya ba bstan to //
translated: The third [chapter] teaches the characteristics of the heroes and the messengers, the fourth teaches the characteristics of the symbolic script of their limbs, the fifth teaches the characteristics of the place of the ganacakra, and the sixth teaches the performance of the ganacakra rite from the meditation on the wheel in the heart.

original: le'u lnga pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pas /
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'i rab tu byed pa gsum pas /
translated: The third part of the fifth chapter

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ldang ba'i rnal 'byor dang / bzhi pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ldang ba'i rnal 'byor bstan to //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ldang ba'i rnal 'byor dang / bzhi pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ldang ba'i rnal 'byor bstan to //
translated: teaches the yoga of rising from the creation stage, and the fourth [teaches] the yoga of rising from the completion stage.

original: le'u drug pa'i rab tu byed pa dang pos bde mchog gi gleng gzhi bstan cing dga' ba'i rdo rje'i lus kyi skye ba shes byar bstan pa dang / gnyis pas thig le bsgom pa dang / gsum pas rtsa bsgom pa dang / bzhi pas drod dang byang chub kyi sems bsdam pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u drug pa'i rab tu byed pa dang pos bde mchog gi gleng gzhi bstan cing dga' ba'i rdo rje'i lus kyi skye ba shes byar bstan pa dang / gnyis pas thig le bsgom pa dang / gsum pas rtsa bsgom pa dang / bzhi pas drod dang byang chub kyi sems bsdam pa bstan to //
translated: The first part of the sixth chapter teaches the nidana of Heruka and shows the body of Hevajra to be the knower. The second part teaches the meditation on the bindu, the third part teaches the meditation on the channels, and the fourth part teaches the binding of the heat and bodhicitta.

original: de ltar le'u drug gi rab tu byed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis mchog gi dngos grub bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar le'u drug gi rab tu byed pa nyi shu rtsa bzhis mchog gi dngos grub bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the twenty-four parts of the six chapters teach the means of achieving the supreme siddhi.

original: le'u bdun pa'i rab tu byed pa bzhis 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bdun pa'i rab tu byed pa bzhis 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub bsgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The four parts of the seventh chapter teach the means of achieving the mundane siddhis.

original: de la dang pos ni bcud kyis len dang tantra'i tshogs bstan to //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni bcud kyis len dang tantra'i tshogs bstan to //
translated: Among them, the first part teaches the collection of rasas and tantras.

original: @3a * // gnyis pas ni sbyin sreg mdor bstan pa dang / gsum pas sngags du ma bstan pa dang / bzhi pas sbyin sreg rgyas par bstan pa yantra'i tshogs rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: @3a * // gnyis pas ni sbyin sreg mdor bstan pa dang / gsum pas sngags du ma bstan pa dang / bzhi pas sbyin sreg rgyas par bstan pa yantra'i tshogs rgyas par bstan to //
translated: The second part teaches the brief explanation of homa, the third part teaches the many mantras, and the fourth part teaches the extensive explanation of homa and the extensive explanation of the collection of tantras.

original: le'u brgyad pa dang le'u dgu pa'i rab tu byed pa gnyis kyis bsgrub pa'i yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: le'u brgyad pa dang le'u dgu pa'i rab tu byed pa gnyis kyis bsgrub pa'i yan lag bstan to //
translated: The eighth and ninth chapters teach the branches of practice.

original: de la dang pos rdo rje dril bu'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis pas bzlas pa'i phreng ba'i mtshan nyid dang / gsum pas 'chi 'pho'i mtshan nyid dang / bzhi pas phrin las bzhi'i mtshan nyid dang / lnga pas snod ldan bsgom pa'i spyod pa dang /
analyzed: de la dang pos rdo rje dril bu'i mtshan nyid dang / gnyis pas bzlas pa'i phreng ba'i mtshan nyid dang / gsum pas 'chi 'pho'i mtshan nyid dang / bzhi pas phrin las bzhi'i mtshan nyid dang / lnga pas snod ldan bsgom pa'i spyod pa dang /
translated: Among them, the first teaches the characteristics of the vajra and bell, the second teaches the characteristics of the rosary for recitation, the third teaches the characteristics of death and transference, the fourth teaches the characteristics of the four activities, the fifth teaches the conduct of meditation for the worthy vessel,

original: drug pas gtor ma'i spyod pa dang / bdun pas bris sku glegs bam bri ba dang / brgyad pas mchod pa'i kun spyod bstan to //
analyzed: drug pas gtor ma'i spyod pa dang / bdun pas bris sku glegs bam bri ba dang / brgyad pas mchod pa'i kun spyod bstan to //
translated: the sixth teaches the conduct of bali offerings, the seventh teaches drawing the painted image and writing the books, and the eighth teaches the conduct of worship.

original: le'u bcu pa'i dang pos ni rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i rgyud bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bcu pa'i dang pos ni rnal 'byor dang / rnal 'byor ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rgyu'i rgyud bstan to //
translated: The first part of the tenth chapter teaches the causal continuum endowed with the characteristics of yoga and yoginī.

original: lhag ma gsum gyis ni 'bras bu'i rgyud bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum gyis ni 'bras bu'i rgyud bstan to //
translated: The remaining three teach the resultant continuum.

original: de la dang pos ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub dang / gnyis pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dang / gsum pas ni sngags kyi theg pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i bza' ba bstan to //
analyzed: de la dang pos ni 'jig rten gyi dngos grub dang / gnyis pas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub dang / gsum pas ni sngags kyi theg pa'i thun mong ma yin pa'i bza' ba bstan to //
translated: The first of these shows the mundane powers, the second shows the supramundane powers, and the third shows the uncommon food of the Mantra Vehicle.

original: mtshams sbyor ba ni le'u bcu las mchod pa dang / gleng slong ba bstan nas gsol ba gdab pa dang de nas zhes bya ba'i tshig bcus mtshams sbyor ba bstan to ;
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba ni le'u bcu las mchod pa dang / gleng slong ba bstan nas gsol ba gdab pa dang de nas zhes bya ba'i tshig bcus mtshams sbyor ba bstan to ;
translated: The connection is shown in the ten chapters after the worship and the introduction, by the ten words beginning with “then.”

original: zhus pa dang lan ni rdo rje snying pos rab tu byed pa bzhi bcu zhus pa las bka' stsal pa bzhi bcus gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa dang lan ni rdo rje snying pos rab tu byed pa bzhi bcu zhus pa las bka' stsal pa bzhi bcus gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: The questions and answers are the forty questions asked by Vajragarbha, and the forty answers given by the Bhagavān.

original: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the subsidiary topics will be explained.

original: kun rdzob btags pa'i gleng gzhi'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pas lcang lo can gyi pho phrang du bla gos lnga brgya gdan du bting nas lcang lo can du lag na rdo rje la /
analyzed: kun rdzob btags pa'i gleng gzhi'i dbang du byas nas byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pas lcang lo can gyi pho phrang du bla gos lnga brgya gdan du bting nas lcang lo can du lag na rdo rje la /
translated: From the perspective of the conventional, nominal nidāna, the bodhisattvas Samantabhadra and so on spread five hundred Dharma robes as a seat in the courtyard of Vaijayanta and asked Vajrapāṇi in Vaijayanta.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i mdo //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i mdo //
translated: The Sutra of the Turning of the Wheel of Dharma.

original: rdo rje 'chang bas ji skad gsungs //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang bas ji skad gsungs //
translated: What was said by Vajradhara?

original: shes rab sras po khyod smros shig / phyag na rdo rje khyod smros shig / ces gsol ba btab pa'i rjes la /
analyzed: shes rab sras po khyod smros shig / phyag na rdo rje khyod smros shig / ces gsol ba btab pa'i rjes la /
translated: Speak, you who are the son of wisdom, speak, you who are Vajrapāṇi!

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum gyis sdud pa po'i gleng slong ba bstan te 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rgyud le'u bcu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gsum gyis sdud pa po'i gleng slong ba bstan te 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rgyud le'u bcu pa'o //
translated: After this supplication, the three phrases beginning with Thus have I heard teach the introduction of the compiler. Thus have I heard and so forth is the ten chapters of the tantra that will be explained below.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni na ta ku be ra'i sras /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni na ta ku be ra'i sras /
translated: I refers to the son of Nāgārjuna,

original: lag bzang dang rdo rje sde'i yab sa bcu'i dbang phyug sdud pa po'o //
analyzed: lag bzang dang rdo rje sde'i yab sa bcu'i dbang phyug sdud pa po'o //
translated: the compiler, Subāhu, the father of Vajrasena, the lord of the tenth stage.

original: thos pa ni 'khor btang nas @3b sam sprul pa 'am brgyud pa ma yin par dngos su thos pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni 'khor btang nas @3b sam sprul pa 'am brgyud pa ma yin par dngos su thos pa'o //
translated: Heard means that after the retinue was dismissed, he heard it directly, not through emanation or lineage.

original: tshig phyi ma'i dus kyi tshig dang sbyar na lan 'ga' na ni thos pas thos pa mang ba'am /
analyzed: tshig phyi ma'i dus kyi tshig dang sbyar na lan 'ga' na ni thos pas thos pa mang ba'am /
translated: Once is connected with the later phrase, meaning that he heard it many times.

original: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pas skad cig ma gcig la rgyud kyi don mtha' dag rtogs pas bdag nyid tshad ma'i skyes bu yin par ston to ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pas skad cig ma gcig la rgyud kyi don mtha' dag rtogs pas bdag nyid tshad ma'i skyes bu yin par ston to ;
translated: Since he was blessed by the Buddha, he was a person of authority, because he realized the entire meaning of the tantra in a single instant.

original: / dus nam gyi tshe zhe na dus gcig na zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i dus kyi thog mar ro //
analyzed: / dus nam gyi tshe zhe na dus gcig na zhes bya ba rtsod pa'i dus kyi thog mar ro //
translated: At what time? At one time, at the beginning of the age of conflict.

original: su las she na bcom ldan 'das ni ston pa po dang 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: su las she na bcom ldan 'das ni ston pa po dang 'bras bu ste /
translated: From whom? The Bhagavān is the teacher and the result.

original: he ru ka bdud bzhi bcom pa'o //
analyzed: he ru ka bdud bzhi bcom pa'o //
translated: Heruka is the conqueror of the four māras.

original: gnas gang du zhe na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la bzhugs pa'o ;
analyzed: gnas gang du zhe na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la bzhugs pa'o ;
translated: In what place? He resides in the bhaga of the Vajra Queen, the body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

original: / de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyogs bcu dang dus gsum dang gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: / de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyogs bcu dang dus gsum dang gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
translated: There, the tathāgatas are the mind and mental factors of the nondual three times and ten directions.

original: de bzhin nyid gzhan la ston pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gzhan la ston pa'o //
translated: Suchness is the teacher.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni me long lta bu'i rnam pa sku dang / so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa gsung dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rnam pa thugs dang / gsung gi chos nyid 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs ni me long lta bu'i rnam pa sku dang / so sor rtog pa'i rnam pa gsung dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rnam pa thugs dang / gsung gi chos nyid 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin ni rdo rje ste /
translated: The nature of the luminous clarity of the reality of speech is the vajra.

original: ye shes de'i gzung ba'i rnam pa'i cha ni shes rab ste btsun mo'o //
analyzed: ye shes de'i gzung ba'i rnam pa'i cha ni shes rab ste btsun mo'o //
translated: The aspect of the apprehended object of that pristine consciousness is prajña, the queen.

original: de'i bha ga ni 'dzam bu'i gling gru gsum pa rgyal po aindra bh'u ti la sogs pa 'dod chags can 'dul ba la sogs pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de'i bha ga ni 'dzam bu'i gling gru gsum pa rgyal po aindra bh'u ti la sogs pa 'dod chags can 'dul ba la sogs pa'i ched du'o //
translated: Her bhaga is the triangular Jambudvipa, for the purpose of taming passionate beings such as King Indrabhuti.

original: bzhugs pa ni gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pas chos 'chad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bzhugs pa ni gzugs kyi rnam par rtog pas chos 'chad pa'i phyir te /
translated: She resides there in order to explain the dharma with the concepts of form.

original: de skad du yang mnyam sbyor las /
analyzed: de skad du yang mnyam sbyor las /
translated: Thus, it says in the Samputa:

original: rtog pa med pa'i chos rnams las //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i chos rnams las //
translated: From the nonconceptual dharmas,🔽the dharma is explained for the benefit of sentient beings,

original: sems can don du chos bstan dang // brag ca yi ni sgra 'dra la //
analyzed: sems can don du chos bstan dang // brag ca yi ni sgra 'dra la //
translated: like the sound of an echo.

original: chos kyi tshig tu 'di 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyi tshig tu 'di 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the word of the dharma.

original: gang dang lhan cig tu zhe na rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang ste /
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig tu zhe na rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang ste /
translated: With whom? With eight hundred million lords of yoga.

original: rdo rje snying po la sogs pa sa bcu'i dbang phyug sha stag gis yongs su bskor zhing dbus su chud pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po la sogs pa sa bcu'i dbang phyug sha stag gis yongs su bskor zhing dbus su chud pa'o //
translated: Surrounded and filled in the middle by only lords of the tenth stage, such as Vajra Heart.

original: ci zhig mdzad cing zhe na 'dzum pa mdzad cing ste /
analyzed: ci zhig mdzad cing zhe na 'dzum pa mdzad cing ste /
translated: What did he do? He smiled.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul las dang po pa la ston pas na ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul las dang po pa la ston pas na ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: Since he teaches the domain of activity of the buddhas and bodhisattvas to beginners, it is amazing.

original: don dam pa'i gleng gzhi ni zab pa dang ma zab pa gnyis las /🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' sa yi snying po la sogs pas 'di skad bdag gis thos pa ste sprul pa'i sku mthong ba'i mtshon byed kyis mtshon bya ma 'ongs pa'i gang zag la rtsa ba'i 'khor lo bsgom par gyis shig @4a * //
analyzed: don dam pa'i gleng gzhi ni zab pa dang ma zab pa gnyis las / de la byang chub sems dpa' sa yi snying po la sogs pas 'di skad bdag gis thos pa ste sprul pa'i sku mthong ba'i mtshon byed kyis mtshon bya ma 'ongs pa'i gang zag la rtsa ba'i 'khor lo bsgom par gyis shig @4a * //
translated: The ultimate nidāna is both profound and not profound.

original: ces bya bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya bar ston pa yin no //
translated: There, the bodhisattvas Kṣhitigarbha and so on say, “Thus have I heard,” indicating that the nirmāṇakāya is seen. The meaning of the text is that the fundamental wheel should be meditated on by future persons.

original: de la dus ni dga' ba bzhi'i dus so //
analyzed: de la dus ni dga' ba bzhi'i dus so //
translated: The time is the time of the four joys.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni lus dang yid bde ba zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni lus dang yid bde ba zhi gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The Bhagavān is the samādhi of the bliss of body and mind, śamatha.

original: gnas ni lus ngag yid gsum bde ba ro gcig pa'i btsun mo'i bha ga'o //
analyzed: gnas ni lus ngag yid gsum bde ba ro gcig pa'i btsun mo'i bha ga'o //
translated: The place is the bhaga of the queen, the bliss of the body, speech, and mind, the single taste.

original: 'khor ni lus kyi 'khor lo bzhi rtsa'i yan lag dang bcas bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni lus kyi 'khor lo bzhi rtsa'i yan lag dang bcas bcas pa'o //
translated: The retinue is the four cakras of the body and the branches of the nāḍīs.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'i dbus kyi snying po'i rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i la gzigs nas 'khor lo bzhi bde bas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje'i dbus kyi snying po'i rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i la gzigs nas 'khor lo bzhi bde bas khyab pa'o //
translated: The smile is the pervasion of the four cakras with bliss by looking at the avadhūti nāḍī, the essence in the middle of the secret vajra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi sprul pa'i sku'i mtshon byed las mtshon bya rlung gi 'khor lo bsgom pa rtogs te dus ni rlung gnyis 'gog pa'i dus so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi sprul pa'i sku'i mtshon byed las mtshon bya rlung gi 'khor lo bsgom pa rtogs te dus ni rlung gnyis 'gog pa'i dus so //
translated: The time of the realization of the meditation on the vāyu cakra, the object indicated by the emanation of Avalokiteśvara Bodhisattva, is the time of the cessation of the two vāyus.

original: ston pa ni rlung dbus ma la brten nas bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin skyes nas so //
analyzed: ston pa ni rlung dbus ma la brten nas bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin skyes nas so //
translated: The teacher is the arising of the samādhi of bliss based on the central nāḍī.

original: gnas ni sku gsung thugs kyi rtsa gsum ro gcig pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ni sku gsung thugs kyi rtsa gsum ro gcig pa ste /
translated: The place is the single taste of the three nāḍīs of body, speech, and mind.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is the emanation cakra.

original: 'khor lo ni dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'o //
translated: The wheel is the twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths.

original: rdo rje snying pos gzigs nas 'dzum pa mdzad pa ni rtsa aa wa dh'u t'ir rlung la brten nas bde ba bskyed pas na 'dzum pa mdzad pa'o /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos gzigs nas 'dzum pa mdzad pa ni rtsa aa wa dh'u t'ir rlung la brten nas bde ba bskyed pas na 'dzum pa mdzad pa'o /
translated: The smile is the generation of bliss based on the wind in the central channel, the avadhūtī.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku'i mtshon byed las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal gyi sprul pa'i sku'i mtshon byed las /
translated: The emanation body of Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva, is the symbol.

original: mtshon bya sems kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa rtogs te /
analyzed: mtshon bya sems kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa rtogs te /
translated: The mind wheel is the object symbolized.

original: dus ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dus ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus so //
translated: The time is the inconceivable time.

original: ston pa ni mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ston pa ni mi rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The teacher is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: gnas ni sku gsung thugs ro gcig pa'i chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: gnas ni sku gsung thugs ro gcig pa'i chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The place is the dharmadhātu, the single taste of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'khor ni gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ni gnyis su med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
translated: The retinue is the mind and mental factors that are not two.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad pa ni rang gi sems 'od gsal ba glo bur gyi dri ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad pa ni rang gi sems 'od gsal ba glo bur gyi dri ma dag pa'o //
translated: The smile is the purification of the adventitious stains in one’s clear-light mind.

original: rdo rje snying po la gzigs shing 'dzum pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po la gzigs shing 'dzum pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: The one who smiles is Vajragarbha.

original: dngos su gtso bos gleng bslang ba bstan pas shugs las 'khor dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos su gtso bos gleng bslang ba bstan pas shugs las 'khor dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the actual introduction is taught by the principal one, the teaching of the Dharma together with the retinue is implicitly taught.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus, it is said:🔽The maṇḍala is called the bhaga,🔽the maṇḍala is called the body,

original: dkyil 'khor bha ga zhes bya dang // dkyil 'khor lus zhes bya ba dang // dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings su bshad //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bha ga zhes bya dang // dkyil 'khor lus zhes bya ba dang // dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings su bshad //
translated: and the maṇḍala is explained as the dharmadhātu.

original: dbyangs dang sngags dang chos bdag nyid //
analyzed: dbyangs dang sngags dang chos bdag nyid //
translated: The nature of the mantra is the nature of the Dharma.

original: ces gsungs pas /
analyzed: ces gsungs pas /
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: gnyis ni mi zab pa yin la gcig ni don dam pa las zab pa'i gleng gzhi bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis ni mi zab pa yin la gcig ni don dam pa las zab pa'i gleng gzhi bstan to //
translated: Of those two, one is not profound, and one is the introduction to the ultimate, which is more profound than the profound.

original: da ni 'khor gyis gleng slong ba bstan te /
analyzed: da ni 'khor gyis gleng slong ba bstan te /
translated: Now, the introduction by the retinue is taught.

original: 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: 'dzum pa mdzad ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la'o //
translated: The moment he smiled means immediately.

original: chos nyan pa'i spyod lam brtul nas stan las langs nas /
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i spyod lam brtul nas stan las langs nas /
translated: Having changed the conduct of listening to the Dharma, he rose from his seat.

original: rgyud dgu'i don zhu ba'i phyir bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas @4b pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa sngon du song ba'i phyir yan lag gis thal mo sbyar ba byas shing spyi bo sa la btud nas so
analyzed: rgyud dgu'i don zhu ba'i phyir bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas @4b pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te phyag 'tshal ba'i mchod pa sngon du song ba'i phyir yan lag gis thal mo sbyar ba byas shing spyi bo sa la btud nas so
translated: In order to request the meaning of the nine tantras, having thrown the upper robe over one shoulder, having placed the right knee on the ground, having made obeisance with prostrations, having joined the palms together, having bowed the head to the ground,

original: // 'di skad ston zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: // 'di skad ston zhes bya ba ni sdud pa'i tshig go //
translated: this is taught is the summarizing phrase.

original: zhu ba'i don ni rgyud thams cad nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhu ba'i don ni rgyud thams cad nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the request is to be expressed from all the tantras.

original: gleng gzhi ni rgyud 'byung ba'i tshogs pa ste ston par rtsom pas ni rjod byed do //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni rgyud 'byung ba'i tshogs pa ste ston par rtsom pas ni rjod byed do //
translated: The nidana is the assembly from which the tantra arises. The expression is the beginning of the teaching.

original: de yang / 'chad pa po yi byed pa'i yul //
analyzed: de yang / 'chad pa po yi byed pa'i yul //
translated: And that is also explained: The object of the one who explains,

original: don gang rab tu gsal blo la //
analyzed: don gang rab tu gsal blo la //
translated: the meaning that is clear to the mind,

original: de la sgra ni tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: de la sgra ni tshad ma nyid //
translated: the sound is the valid cognition

original: ces bshad do //
analyzed: ces bshad do //
translated: of that.

original: gsang chen ni khams gsum pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis kyis ma rtogs pa skal ba dang mi ldan pa rnams rtogs pa dang ; de skad du yang /
analyzed: gsang chen ni khams gsum pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis kyis ma rtogs pa skal ba dang mi ldan pa rnams rtogs pa dang ; de skad du yang /
translated: The great secret is not realized by the two kinds of those in the three realms and nirvana, and it is realized by those who are fortunate. And that is also said:

original: rnam pa sna tshogs skal bzang po //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs skal bzang po //
translated: The various good fortunes,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs bde mchog gis //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs bde mchog gis //
translated: The various supreme bliss,

original: 'dul ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa //🔽sems can khams ni rab tu sgrub /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa // sems can khams ni rab tu sgrub /
translated: The various kinds of training,

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Are accomplished in the realm of sentient beings.

original: kun du kha sbyor ni rgyud dgu'i thabs dang shes rab mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kun du kha sbyor ni rgyud dgu'i thabs dang shes rab mnyam par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The union of all is the union of the method and wisdom of the nine tantras.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As is said:

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa yi //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa yi //
translated: The method of the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs ni snying rje'i bdag nyid de //
analyzed: thabs ni snying rje'i bdag nyid de //
translated: Is the nature of compassion.

original: de bas snying rje chen po thabs //
analyzed: de bas snying rje chen po thabs //
translated: Therefore, the method of great compassion

original: shes rab pha rol phyin gsal ba //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin gsal ba //
translated: Is the clarity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnal 'byor thams cad bde ba yi //
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad bde ba yi //
translated: All yogas are blissful,

original: rjes su sbyor bar mchod byed cing //
analyzed: rjes su sbyor bar mchod byed cing //
translated: And the union is worship.

original: kun du myong bar byed pas na //
analyzed: kun du myong bar byed pas na //
translated: Since all is experienced,

original: gnyis su sbyor ba tshe 'dir 'grub //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gnyis su sbyor ba tshe 'dir 'grub //🔽ces gsungs so //
translated: The union is accomplished in this life.

original: mtshan nyid ni yul dang yul can gyi stong pa nyid dang dbang gsum pa dang bzhi pas rtogs nas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi chos nyid mtshon par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni yul dang yul can gyi stong pa nyid dang dbang gsum pa dang bzhi pas rtogs nas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi chos nyid mtshon par bya ste /
translated: The definition is that having realized the emptiness of object and subject by means of the third and fourth initiations, one should indicate the reality of all things, moving and unmoving.

original: mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid de ye shes kyi dbang phyug snang ba med pa ji lta ba dang / snang ba dang bcas pa ji snyed pa'i sdebs la ma 'ongs pa'i gang zag gi don du nyan par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid de ye shes kyi dbang phyug snang ba med pa ji lta ba dang / snang ba dang bcas pa ji snyed pa'i sdebs la ma 'ongs pa'i gang zag gi don du nyan par 'tshal lo //
translated: Since it is indicated, it is the definition. The lord of wisdom, who is without appearance, as he is, and with appearance, as much as there is, has promised to teach it for the benefit of future persons.

original: de'i don ni zhal gyis bzhes pa skabs dbye ba ni bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni zhal gyis bzhes pa skabs dbye ba ni bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of that is the promise to explain, which is indicated by the words “Excellent!”

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: “Amazing!” refers to the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: spyod pa ni mi rnams kyis don du dri bas na ngo mtshar ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni mi rnams kyis don du dri bas na ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: “Conduct” is the request for the meaning by humans, so it is amazing.

original: rgyu'i rgyud dri bas na brtse bas legs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud dri bas na brtse bas legs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Excellent!” is the request for the cause continuum.

original: thabs kyi rgyud 'dri bas na byang chub sems dpa' legs so sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud 'dri bas na byang chub sems dpa' legs so sbyin pa'o //
translated: Since he asks about the method tantra, he is the bodhisattva Excellent Gift.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud 'dri bas na yon tan gyi 'byung gnas legs so legs so sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud 'dri bas na yon tan gyi 'byung gnas legs so legs so sbyin pa'o //
translated: Since he asks about the result tantra, he is the Excellent Gift of the Source of Good Qualities.

original: legs so legs so lan @5a * //
analyzed: legs so legs so lan @5a * //
translated: Excellent! Excellent!

original: gnyis ston pa ni brjod bya dang rjod byed gnyis sam /
analyzed: gnyis ston pa ni brjod bya dang rjod byed gnyis sam /
translated: The teacher shows this twice.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa sems can gyis myong bas na legs so legs so zhes dris pas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa sems can gyis myong bas na legs so legs so zhes dris pas so //
translated: Since the Buddha's transcendent state is experienced by sentient beings, he asks, Excellent! Excellent!

original: skabs dbye ba bstan nas rdo rje snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cus skabs phye bas thog mar dga' bas rab tu 'dzum pa dang / rab tu gsal ba'i mig phye nas /🔽tha mar dga' bas yang dang yang du phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: skabs dbye ba bstan nas rdo rje snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cus skabs phye bas thog mar dga' bas rab tu 'dzum pa dang / rab tu gsal ba'i mig phye nas / tha mar dga' bas yang dang yang du phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: After showing the opportunity, the eighty million bodhisattvas, such as Vajra Garbha, opened the opportunity, and at the beginning, with joy, they smiled and opened their very clear eyes.

original: sems can thams cad bdag dang gzhan brje ba byas nas rang gi the tshom zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag dang gzhan brje ba byas nas rang gi the tshom zhus pa yin no //
translated: At the end, with joy, they again and again made prostrations, and after exchanging self and other for all sentient beings, they asked their own questions.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams ni brjod bya ci yin zhes zhus pa dang / rjod byed gleng gzhi ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa dang / de rnams kyi rgyu'i rgyud 'di ni gang la gsang ba gsungs zhes bya ba dang / thabs kyi rgyud kun du kha sbyor gyi ming ni ci yin zhes zhus pa dang 'bras bu'i rgyud de'i mtshan nyid ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams ni brjod bya ci yin zhes zhus pa dang / rjod byed gleng gzhi ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa dang / de rnams kyi rgyu'i rgyud 'di ni gang la gsang ba gsungs zhes bya ba dang / thabs kyi rgyud kun du kha sbyor gyi ming ni ci yin zhes zhus pa dang 'bras bu'i rgyud de'i mtshan nyid ji ltar lags zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: The tantras such as the Guhyasamaja are the subject matter, the nidana of the expression is asked about, the cause of those is asked about, the name of the method tantra is asked about, and the characteristics of the result tantra are asked about.

original: rgyud thams cad na gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa dgu'i brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad na gsang ba 'dus pa la sogs pa dgu'i brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The subject matter of all tantras is the nine, such as the Guhyasamaja.

original: de rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni phun sum tshogs pa bzhi'i tshogs pa las rjod byed kyi rgyud 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gleng gzhi ni phun sum tshogs pa bzhi'i tshogs pa las rjod byed kyi rgyud 'byung ba'o //
translated: The nidana of those is the arising of the tantra of expression from the assembly of the four perfections.

original: gsang ba'i khams gsum gyi bdag po dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir gsang ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i khams gsum gyi bdag po dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pas rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir gsang ba'o //
translated: The secret is the lord of the three realms, because it is difficult for sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and so on to realize.

original: kun du kha sbyor ni thabs shes rab rgyu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: kun du kha sbyor ni thabs shes rab rgyu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The union is the nature of the cause, method and wisdom.

original: kun du kha sbyor de las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: kun du kha sbyor de las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin ni mtshon par byed do //
translated: The samādhi that arises from the union is the indicator.

original: de las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin rgod pa brten pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin mtshon par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dbang bzhi pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad bde ba chen po'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin rgod pa brten pa dang / g-yo ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin mtshon par bya ba'i mtshan nyid dbang bzhi pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad bde ba chen po'i byed pa'o //
translated: The samādhi that arises from that is the nature of the support, movement and entity. The samādhi of the fourth empowerment, which has the characteristic of being indicated, is the agent of great bliss.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: sems la rnam gnas rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: sems la rnam gnas rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi/nī who abides in the mind

original: mya ngan 'das pa mi ston to //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa mi ston to //
translated: does not show nirvāṇa.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: And:

original: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: gcig gi stong nyid gang yin pa //
translated: The emptiness of one

original: de ni kun gyi stong nyid yin //
analyzed: de ni kun gyi stong nyid yin //
translated: is the emptiness of all.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dbang bzhi pa sems kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas dbang bzhi pa sems kyi de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this reasoning, if the suchness of the mind of the fourth empowerment is known, the suchness of all phenomena will be known.

original: des ni 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: That explains the definition of the result tantra.

original: yang na 'di'i bshad pa'i rgyud ma yin pas rtsa ba'i rgyud dgu ston te /
analyzed: yang na 'di'i bshad pa'i rgyud ma yin pas rtsa ba'i rgyud dgu ston te /
translated: Or else, because it is not an explanatory tantra of this, it teaches the nine root tantras.

original: rgyud thams cad dang gleng gzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad dang gleng gzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All tantras and the nidana are as before.

original: kun du kha sbyor zhes bya ba'i sgras ni @5b stong pa nyid dang sgyu ma ro gcig pa zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje sems dpa' la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kun du kha sbyor zhes bya ba'i sgras ni @5b stong pa nyid dang sgyu ma ro gcig pa zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje sems dpa' la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The term “fully joined” means that Vajrasattva, whose nature is the union of emptiness and illusion of one taste, is the one who teaches.🔽This is also the secret, and the worship is the mandala of the deity and so on, which are indicated by the characteristics of the empowerment, and the wheel of the imagined creation stage, which is the instruction for selecting the mantra and so on, and the wheel of the dependent perfection stage, which is not profound, are indicated by the characteristics of the fourth empowerment, which is the nature of great bliss.

original: gsang ba yang 'di nyid yin la dbang bskur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon pas mchod par bya ba dkyil 'khor dang / lha la sogs pa dang sngags btu ba'i man ngag la sogs ba bskyed pa'i rim pa kun brtags kyi 'khor lo dang / mi zab pa'i rdzogs rim gzhan dbang zhig gi 'khor lo rnams dbang bzhi pa'i mtshon byed kyis bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin mtshon pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsang ba yang 'di nyid yin la dbang bskur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon pas mchod par bya ba dkyil 'khor dang / lha la sogs pa dang sngags btu ba'i man ngag la sogs ba bskyed pa'i rim pa kun brtags kyi 'khor lo dang / mi zab pa'i rdzogs rim gzhan dbang zhig gi 'khor lo rnams dbang bzhi pa'i mtshon byed kyis bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin mtshon pa ni 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the result.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: dngul chu gser du snang ba zhes bya ba la srang gcig gis lcags srang stong gser srang stong sgrub par byed do zhes gsungs pa dang / chos kyi snying po sems kyi gsang shes na //
analyzed: dngul chu gser du snang ba zhes bya ba la srang gcig gis lcags srang stong gser srang stong sgrub par byed do zhes gsungs pa dang / chos kyi snying po sems kyi gsang shes na //
translated: If you know the secret of mind,

original: 'gro rnams kun yang de bzhin gshegs //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gro rnams kun yang de bzhin gshegs // zhes gsungs so //
translated: all beings are also thus gone.

original: de ltar na yang rgyud dgu'i bshad pa'i rgyud yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang rgyud dgu'i bshad pa'i rgyud yin la /
translated: Thus, it is an explanatory tantra of the nine tantras.

original: gleng gzhi dgu dang / gsang ba dgu dang / kha sbyor dgu dang / mtshon byed ting nge 'dzin dgus mtshon bya snod bcud thams cad bde bar go ba'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi dgu dang / gsang ba dgu dang / kha sbyor dgu dang / mtshon byed ting nge 'dzin dgus mtshon bya snod bcud thams cad bde bar go ba'o //
translated: It is the basis of all tantras, the basis of all methods, the basis of all mandalas, the basis of all deities, the basis of all mudras, the basis of all mantras, the basis of all samadhis, the basis of all activities, and the basis of all attainments.

original: yang na 'dir ni rang dga'i rgyud yin pas rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi thabs thams cad kyi don 'di gnyis gcig dang bsnyams nas zung du 'jug pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' ni kha sbyor yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'dir ni rang dga'i rgyud yin pas rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi thabs thams cad kyi don 'di gnyis gcig dang bsnyams nas zung du 'jug pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' ni kha sbyor yin la /
translated: Or, since this is a tantra of one’s own inclination, the basis of all tantras, the basis of all methods, and the basis of all mandalas are combined into one, and the union of Vajrasattva is the union.

original: de dbang bzhi bskur ba'i mtshon byed mtshan nyid kyis bskyed rdzogs thams cad bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dbang bzhi bskur ba'i mtshon byed mtshan nyid kyis bskyed rdzogs thams cad bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du shes pa'o //
translated: That is the symbolic indication of the conferral of the four empowerments, and one should understand that all of creation and completion have the nature of great bliss.

original: de ltar mtshan bshad nas da ni rgyud bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan bshad nas da ni rgyud bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having explained the title, now the tantra will be explained.

original: gang zag gsum gyi shes bya'i thun mong gi zabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rgyud de /
analyzed: gang zag gsum gyi shes bya'i thun mong gi zabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid rgyud de /
translated: The tantra is the nature of the knowledge of the three persons, the common object of knowledge.

original: rdo rje 'chang gis bshad kyis byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cu la nyon cig ces bod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gis bshad kyis byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cu la nyon cig ces bod pa'o //
translated: Vajradhara said, Listen, O assembly of a billion bodhisattvas!

original: yang na 'di ni rang dga'i rgyud yin pas /
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rang dga'i rgyud yin pas /
translated: Alternatively, since this is a tantra of one's own inclination,🔽having first contemplated the nature of emptiness, one should wash away the taints of embodied beings.

original: de la dang po stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsams nas lus can rnams kyi dri ma bkru bar bya'o zhes mdor bstan nas de ni rgyas par bshad pa /
analyzed: de la dang po stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsams nas lus can rnams kyi dri ma bkru bar bya'o zhes mdor bstan nas de ni rgyas par bshad pa /
translated: Having explained that in brief, now the extensive explanation:

original: yul drug stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: yul drug stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du mnyam pa'o //
translated: The six objects are equal in the nature of emptiness.

original: de la rdo rje snying po 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la rdo rje snying po 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: With regard to that, Vajra Heart said the following:

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul drug las /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul drug las /
translated: From the six objects, such as form,

original: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i mig la sogs pa dbang po drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug stong zhing med pas na dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ri bong gi rva bzhin du skye @6a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye ba'i mig la sogs pa dbang po drug dang / gzugs la sogs pa yul drug stong zhing med pas na dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug ri bong gi rva bzhin du skye @6a * //
translated: The six sense faculties such as the eye, which are the source of the arising of consciousness, and the six objects such as form, are empty and nonexistent, so the six consciousnesses that observe them are like the horns of a rabbit.

original: bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes zhus pa yin no //
translated: They do not arise.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni 'dzin pa med pas dpyad du med la gzung bya med pas shes bya ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pas gtan la phab pa'i rtog ges brtag par dka' ba dang / gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs shing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni zung du 'jug pa ji lta ba'i lam de nyid yin pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ni 'dzin pa med pas dpyad du med la gzung bya med pas shes bya ma yin zhing rjes su dpag pas gtan la phab pa'i rtog ges brtag par dka' ba dang / gzung 'dzin gnyis spangs shing gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni zung du 'jug pa ji lta ba'i lam de nyid yin pas /
translated: The Bhagavān replied, “Since there is no apprehender, it is not an object of analysis. Since there is no object of apprehension, it is not an object of knowledge. Since it is difficult to investigate with the conceptual mind that determines it through inference, and since it is the wisdom of nonduality that abandons the duality of apprehender and apprehended, it is the path of union itself.

original: ri bong gi rva ltar med pa'am rnam par bcad pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva ltar med pa'am rnam par bcad pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not just a mere negation or nonexistence like the horns of a rabbit.

original: des na rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi 'di ni gnyis su med pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rgyud thams cad kyi gleng gzhi 'di ni gnyis su med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this introduction to all tantras is nondual.”

original: de'i gsang ba'i don rgyas par bshad pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi yul zung du 'jug pa'i gsang ba chen po ni nam mkha' lta bur chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gsang ba'i don rgyas par bshad pa ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi yul zung du 'jug pa'i gsang ba chen po ni nam mkha' lta bur chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The extensive explanation of the secret meaning of that is as follows: The great secret of the union of the object of the buddhas of the three times is the equality of all phenomena, like space.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i mun pa dang ldan pas nyan thos kyis mi shes la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i mun pa dang ldan pas nyan thos kyis mi shes la /
translated: Since it is endowed with the darkness of the afflictive obscurations, it is not known by the śrāvakas.

original: phyogs gcig gi bag chags kyis dkris pas /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gi bag chags kyis dkris pas /
translated: Since it is wrapped in the latent tendencies of one aspect,

original: rang sangs rgyas su sprul cing skyed pas ni mi shes so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su sprul cing skyed pas ni mi shes so //
translated: it is not known by the nirmāṇakāya buddhas who emanate and are born as pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag kun gyis zhes pas ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum pas mi shes so //
analyzed: de dag kun gyis zhes pas ni tshangs pa la sogs pa'i khams gsum pas mi shes so //
translated: Since it is said that “all of them” do not know it, it is not known by Brahmā and so on, the beings of the three realms.

original: rgyu des na gsang chen sangs rgyas spyod yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na gsang chen sangs rgyas spyod yul zhes bya'o //
translated: For that reason, it is called “the great secret, the domain of the buddhas.”

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de rnams kyis mi shes na ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de rnams kyis mi shes na ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: If it is not known by those śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, why is it taught?

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying ba rnams sgrol ba'i bsam pas dbang bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon nas sgrol bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying ba rnams sgrol ba'i bsam pas dbang bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon nas sgrol bar byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva, with the intention of liberating those who are drowning in the ocean of cyclic existence, liberates them by means of the characteristics of the four initiations.

original: de la mtshon bya ni snod bcud thams cad do //
analyzed: de la mtshon bya ni snod bcud thams cad do //
translated: Therein, the object of indication is the entire world and its contents.

original: mtshon byed ni dbang bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon byed ni dbang bzhi pa'o //
translated: The indicator is the fourth initiation.

original: mtshan nyid ni zung du 'jug pa'i bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni zung du 'jug pa'i bde ba chen po'o //
translated: The characteristic is the great bliss of union.

original: mtshon byed de yang gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshon byed de yang gnyis te /
translated: That indicator is also twofold:

original: dga' ba gsum bsam gtan gyi bde ba dang / bde ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: dga' ba gsum bsam gtan gyi bde ba dang / bde ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi ye shes so //
translated: the bliss of the three joys and the meditative concentration, and the pristine awareness whose nature is the bliss of emptiness.

original: ye shes kyi snod bcud kyi rang bzhin shes bya stong pa'i rang bzhin du bltas la zhes bya ba stong par shes nas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi snod bcud kyi rang bzhin shes bya stong pa'i rang bzhin du bltas la zhes bya ba stong par shes nas /
translated: Having seen the nature of the world and its contents, which is the object of pristine awareness, as the nature of emptiness,

original: ma dag pa'i rang bzhin 'gro ba rigs drug bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i rang bzhin 'gro ba rigs drug bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know the nature of the impure world and its contents, the six classes of living beings, as the nature of great bliss.

original: skye ba stong phrag du ma ru //
analyzed: skye ba stong phrag du ma ru //
translated: In many thousands of lives🔽the yogi who has realized

original: rdzogs par rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: rdzogs par rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: the great bliss of the fourth initiation

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga mar gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba snga mar gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: This is non-duality in a previous birth.

original: don la goms par byas pas //
analyzed: don la goms par byas pas //
translated: By becoming familiar with the meaning,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i sku gsum gyi go 'phang du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i sku gsum gyi go 'phang du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will go to the state of the three bodies as one wishes.

original: de ltar na gang zag gsum gyi thun mong gi gsang chen kha sbyor gyi mtshan nyid bshad nas da ni @6b grol lam pa'i shes bya bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag gsum gyi thun mong gi gsang chen kha sbyor gyi mtshan nyid bshad nas da ni @6b grol lam pa'i shes bya bstan par bya ste /
translated: Thus, having explained the characteristics of the great secret common to the three persons, now, the object of knowledge of the path of liberation will be explained.

original: sngar bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyi stong pa shes rab kyis yang dag par dran par byas nas lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang bha ga'i dkyil 'khor dang chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor dang gsum gyi nang du lus
analyzed: sngar bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa bzhin du chos thams cad kyi stong pa shes rab kyis yang dag par dran par byas nas lus kyi dkyil 'khor dang bha ga'i dkyil 'khor dang chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor dang gsum gyi nang du lus
translated: Just as the characteristics of emptiness were previously taught by the Bhagavān, having correctly remembered the emptiness of all phenomena with wisdom, the body maṇḍala, the bhaga maṇḍala, and the maṇḍala of the dharmadhātu—

original: kyi dkyil 'khor gyi zhing la ye shes kyi rgyu rnam shes bde ba'i sa bon gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi dkyil 'khor gyi zhing la ye shes kyi rgyu rnam shes bde ba'i sa bon gdab par bya'o //
translated: within those three, the body maṇḍala, the field, is the place where the seed of the consciousness of the cause of gnosis, the seed of bliss, is planted.

original: de ltar grol lam pa'i mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar grol lam pa'i mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the path of liberation in brief,

original: da ni shin tu mdzes pa'i rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i chu shing gi snying po ltar drang ba /
analyzed: da ni shin tu mdzes pa'i rtsa aa wa dh'u t'i chu shing gi snying po ltar drang ba /
translated: Now, the mind of atoms that arises from the nāḍī that is very beautiful, straight like the core of a plantain tree,

original: til gyi mar me ltar gsal ba /
analyzed: til gyi mar me ltar gsal ba /
translated: clear like a sesame oil lamp,

original: padma'i skud pa ltar phra ba /
analyzed: padma'i skud pa ltar phra ba /
translated: subtle like a lotus fiber,

original: rgya skyegs kyi me tog ltar dmar ba'i rtsa las byung ba'i rdul phran gyi sems de rgyud kyi rim pa rtsa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: rgya skyegs kyi me tog ltar dmar ba'i rtsa las byung ba'i rdul phran gyi sems de rgyud kyi rim pa rtsa'i rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: and red like a lac flower is the explanation of the nature of the nāḍīs, the stages of the tantra.

original: dri med shel dang mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis sems 'od gsal ba'i rnam par snang ba snying gar gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le bstan to //
analyzed: dri med shel dang mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis kyis sems 'od gsal ba'i rnam par snang ba snying gar gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le bstan to //
translated: The two verses beginning “Like a stainless crystal” explain the bindu of bodhicitta located in the heart, the appearance of the clear-light mind.

original: de'i dbus na gnas pa'i lha zhes pa ni rtsa dbus ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i dbus na gnas pa'i lha zhes pa ni rtsa dbus ma yin la /
translated: The “god in the middle” is the central nāḍī.

original: dbus na gnas pa'i lha ni nam mkha'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: dbus na gnas pa'i lha ni nam mkha'i rlung ngo //
translated: The “god in the middle” is the vāyu of space.

original: mi gsal ba ni bems po yin la /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni bems po yin la /
translated: “Unclear” means “insentient.”

original: gsal ba ni shes pas myong ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni shes pas myong ba'o //
translated: “Clear” means “experienced by consciousness.”

original: cha phye ba ni mi shigs pa'i rlung /
analyzed: cha phye ba ni mi shigs pa'i rlung /
translated: “Partitioned” is the indestructible vāyu.

original: mig btsums phyed kyi tshad du sdod pa thig le'i gzugs can rtog pa med pa'i yid kyis myong ba'o //
analyzed: mig btsums phyed kyi tshad du sdod pa thig le'i gzugs can rtog pa med pa'i yid kyis myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of the mind without discursive thought is the form of the bindu that abides for half the time of a closed and open eye.

original: de ltar tshigs bcad gnyis kyis nam mkha'i rlung bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs bcad gnyis kyis nam mkha'i rlung bstan nas /
translated: As such, after the two verses explain the vāyu of space,

original: tshigs bcad gnyis kyis bde ba'i gnas kyi tshad bstan pa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: tshigs bcad gnyis kyis bde ba'i gnas kyi tshad bstan pa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: the two verses that explain the measure of the place of bliss are the bodhicitta.🔽The place of the bodhicitta is in the center of the heart.🔽The measure of the bodhicitta is the six sense gates of the objects and sense organs.🔽The bodhicitta is without discursive thought.

original: gzi brjid chen po'i 'od dang ldan pa snying ga'i dbus na yul dang dbang po drug gi mtha' yin pa rtog pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po'i 'od dang ldan pa snying ga'i dbus na yul dang dbang po drug gi mtha' yin pa rtog pa med pa yin la /
translated: The bodhicitta is endowed with the light of great splendor.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the nine orifices.

original: de'i bu ga dgu'i mtha' las mi 'da' ba rkang pa nas spyi gtsug gi mthar thug pa 'am /
analyzed: de'i bu ga dgu'i mtha' las mi 'da' ba rkang pa nas spyi gtsug gi mthar thug pa 'am /
translated: The bodhicitta is the end of the crown and the feet.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the two toes and the two eyes.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the two eyes and the two ears.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the two ears and the nose.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the two nostrils and the mouth.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the two shoulders and the two arms.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the two elbows and the two wrists.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the two knees and the two feet.

original: yang na rkang pa'i sor mo gnyis dang / spyi bo smin mtshams nas bcal ba sor dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dbus na aa wa dh'u t'i'i skud pa gcig tu gnas pa'am /
analyzed: yang na rkang pa'i sor mo gnyis dang / spyi bo smin mtshams nas bcal ba sor dgu'i bdag nyid kyi dbus na aa wa dh'u t'i'i skud pa gcig tu gnas pa'am /
translated: The bodhicitta is the end of the two toes and the crown.🔽The bodhicitta is the end of the two eyes and the forehead.

original: yang na lte ba'i khung nas mar sor dgu'i mthar aa wa dh'u t'i'i rtse mor gnas pa yang sor gnyis kyi mthar tshangs pa'i bu ga'i mthar gnas kyang zer ro //
analyzed: yang na lte ba'i khung nas mar sor dgu'i mthar aa wa dh'u t'i'i rtse mor gnas pa yang sor gnyis kyi mthar tshangs pa'i bu ga'i mthar gnas kyang zer ro //
translated: Alternately, it is said that it is located at the tip of the avadhūti, nine fingerbreadths below the navel, and at the end of two fingerbreadths, it is located at the end of the brahma aperture.

original: de ltar rtsa dang rlung byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyud kyi rim pa bstan nas /🔽rlung me'i drod can sngags kyi rim pa ni skud pa gcig la brten te lte ba'i dbus na logs la sor bdun gyi tshad kyi drod gnas kyang bde @7a * //
analyzed: de ltar rtsa dang rlung byang chub kyi sems kyi rgyud kyi rim pa bstan nas / rlung me'i drod can sngags kyi rim pa ni skud pa gcig la brten te lte ba'i dbus na logs la sor bdun gyi tshad kyi drod gnas kyang bde @7a * //
translated: Having explained the stages of the nāḍīs, vāyus, and bodhicitta,🔽the stage of the mantra of the vāyu of the fire of heat is as follows:

original: ba mi skye bas 'byung ba lnga'i tshad dang ldan pa'i cha lnga pa mthe bo'i ri mo lta bu'am /
analyzed: ba mi skye bas 'byung ba lnga'i tshad dang ldan pa'i cha lnga pa mthe bo'i ri mo lta bu'am /
translated: The heat of the fire of the vāyu of the stage of the mantra is located in the center of the navel, seven fingerbreadths from the side, but since bliss does not arise, it is the five parts that possess the measure of the five elements, like the lines of the palm of the hand.

original: klu'i dbang po lta bu klu dbang 'khyil pa der de rab tu rgyas shing 'phel bar byas nas /
analyzed: klu'i dbang po lta bu klu dbang 'khyil pa der de rab tu rgyas shing 'phel bar byas nas /
translated: Like the king of the nāgas, the nāga king’s coil, having expanded and increased there,

original: ye shes kyi rim pa snying ga'i byang chub sems kyi cha phye nas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rim pa snying ga'i byang chub sems kyi cha phye nas /
translated: the stage of gnosis is divided into the part of bodhicitta in the heart.

original: lte ba rdo rje'i dbus su byung ba na byang chub kyi sems skye pa'i gnas me'i dkyil 'khor ae gru gsum gyi dbus su byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le phab pas ni khu ba'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: lte ba rdo rje'i dbus su byung ba na byang chub kyi sems skye pa'i gnas me'i dkyil 'khor ae gru gsum gyi dbus su byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le phab pas ni khu ba'i dngos po ste /
translated: When it arises in the center of the vajra, it is the seat of the generation of the bodhicitta. In the center of the triangular fire mandala of the e vowel, the bindu of bodhicitta descends, which is the substance of semen.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: ae yi cha byad bzang po gang //
analyzed: ae yi cha byad bzang po gang //
translated: The excellent form of the e vowel

original: dbus su wam gyis rnam par brgyan //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbus su wam gyis rnam par brgyan // zhes gsungs so //
translated: is in the center, adorned with the vam.

original: de rim gyis 'phel nas sgo dgu'i mthar thug par gnas so ;
analyzed: de rim gyis 'phel nas sgo dgu'i mthar thug par gnas so ;
translated: That gradually increases and remains at the end of the nine orifices.

original: /'phel bar gyur pas dga' bral du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: /'phel bar gyur pas dga' bral du ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it increases, why does it not become free of joy?

original: 'khrul 'khor gyis bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor gyis bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is blocked by the yantras.

original: de du yod ce na /
analyzed: de du yod ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: yi ge'i 'khrul 'khor dang / lus kyi 'khrul 'khor dang / sman gyi 'khrul 'khor dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'khrul 'khor ro //
analyzed: yi ge'i 'khrul 'khor dang / lus kyi 'khrul 'khor dang / sman gyi 'khrul 'khor dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi 'khrul 'khor ro //
translated: The yantras of the syllables, the yantras of the body, the yantras of medicine, and the yantras of samādhi.

original: 'dir gang gis bkag ce na /
analyzed: 'dir gang gis bkag ce na /
translated: What blocks it here?

original: yi ge'i 'khrul 'khor gyis te /🔽de la steng du me'i sa bon te /
analyzed: yi ge'i 'khrul 'khor gyis te / de la steng du me'i sa bon te /
translated: The yantras of the syllables.

original: drag mo'i sa bon kshum ngo //
analyzed: drag mo'i sa bon kshum ngo //
translated: The seed of fire above is the seed of Caṇḍālī, kṣuṃ.

original: sa'i sa bon ni gtum mo'i yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: sa'i sa bon ni gtum mo'i yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: The seed of earth is the syllable hūṃ of Caṇḍālī.

original: gtum mo'i sa bon ni rdzogs pa'i yi ge yum mo //
analyzed: gtum mo'i sa bon ni rdzogs pa'i yi ge yum mo //
translated: The seed of Caṇḍālī is the syllable yaṃ of the mother.

original: chu'i sa bon ni mkha' 'gro ma'i sa bon sum mo //🔽gti mug gi sa bon ni seng ge ma'i yi ge smram ngo //
analyzed: chu'i sa bon ni mkha' 'gro ma'i sa bon sum mo // gti mug gi sa bon ni seng ge ma'i yi ge smram ngo //
translated: The seed of water is the syllable suṃ of the ḍākinī.🔽The seed of delusion is the syllable smṛṃ of the lion-faced one.

original: zhe sdang gi sa bon ni stag mo'i yi ge hmryum ngo //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi sa bon ni stag mo'i yi ge hmryum ngo //
translated: The seed of hatred is the syllable hriṃ of the tiger-faced one.

original: snying ga'i phyogs su bskyod pa'i sa bon ce spyad ma'i yi ge ymryum ngo //
analyzed: snying ga'i phyogs su bskyod pa'i sa bon ce spyad ma'i yi ge ymryum ngo //
translated: The seed of shaking in the heart region is the syllable kṣmriṃ of the sow-faced one.

original: phyugs kyi sa bon ni 'ug pa'i yi ge kshmryum ngo //
analyzed: phyugs kyi sa bon ni 'ug pa'i yi ge kshmryum ngo //
translated: The seed of the animal is the syllable kṣmriṃ of the owl-faced one.

original: brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba'i 'gro ba thams cad khyab pa yin no //
analyzed: brtan pa dang ni g-yo ba'i 'gro ba thams cad khyab pa yin no //
translated: It pervades all moving and unmoving beings.

original: zhi gnas kyi bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi snod bcud bde bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi snod bcud bde bar snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of the world as bliss is the vessel for the bliss of the concentration of śamatha.

original: de 'ba' zhig tu snang ngam zhe na /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig tu snang ngam zhe na /
translated: Does it appear as that alone?

original: tshangs sogs lha dang lha min bcas //
analyzed: tshangs sogs lha dang lha min bcas //
translated: Brahmā and so on, gods and demigods.

original: zhes bya bas 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams btang snyoms kyi bde ba la brten nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams btang snyoms kyi bde ba la brten nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The gods of the desire realm arise in dependence on the bliss of equanimity.

original: de mi g-yo ba'i lam bsam gtan gyi bde ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ram zhe na /🔽gom pa gcig gis mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: de mi g-yo ba'i lam bsam gtan gyi bde ba 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ram zhe na / gom pa gcig gis mya ngan 'das //
translated: Is that path of non-wavering only the bliss of concentration?🔽One step is nirvana.🔽One step is samsara.🔽By that very thing one is bound.

original: gom pa gcig gis 'khor ba yin //🔽de nyid kyis ni 'ching 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gom pa gcig gis 'khor ba yin // de nyid kyis ni 'ching 'gyur zhing //
translated: By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.

original: de nyid kyis ni grol bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'i rim pas ji srid lus la gnas kyi bar las dang las min des byed ces bya ba ni sems rang rig glo bur gyi dri ma dang bcas tsam na bde ba rtog pa med pa ma skyes pa'i tshe las dang las ma yin pa'i nyon
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni grol bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba'i rim pas ji srid lus la gnas kyi bar las dang las min des byed ces bya ba ni sems rang rig glo bur gyi dri ma dang bcas tsam na bde ba rtog pa med pa ma skyes pa'i tshe las dang las ma yin pa'i nyon
translated: By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.

original: mongs pa @7b des byed cing dge ba dang mi dge ba'i dbang gis mtho ris dang ngan song skyed par byed do //
analyzed: mongs pa @7b des byed cing dge ba dang mi dge ba'i dbang gis mtho ris dang ngan song skyed par byed do //

analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gcig po des ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gsungs pa yin no //
