translated: By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.🔽By that very thing one is bound.🔽By that very thing one is liberated.

original: mnyam par sbyor ba ni phyag rgya bzhi dang ngo //
analyzed: mnyam par sbyor ba ni phyag rgya bzhi dang ngo //
translated: The union is with the four seals.

original: sbyor ba bsgoms pa ni mngon sum gyi sems rang bzhin brgyad cu'i rtog pa dang bral ba bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba bsgoms pa ni mngon sum gyi sems rang bzhin brgyad cu'i rtog pa dang bral ba bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of the union is the cultivation of the mind of clear light free from the eighty natural concepts.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa'i lus zhig nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa'i lus zhig nas /
translated: When the body of concepts is destroyed,

original: bde ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gzugs brnyan lta bu'i gzugs su bdag byin gyis rlob pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bde ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gzugs brnyan lta bu'i gzugs su bdag byin gyis rlob pa de'i tshe /
translated: one should bless oneself into the form of the image of the nature of the bliss of emptiness.

original: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob nas brtan pa dang / g-yo ba thams cad stong pa nyid du shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob nas brtan pa dang / g-yo ba thams cad stong pa nyid du shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, having attained the first stage, the Joyous, one will know that all that is stable and moving is emptiness.

original: de ltar 'gog pa dang lam bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'gog pa dang lam bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught cessation and the path,

original: 'bras bu bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu bshad pa ni /
translated: he explains the result:

original: de yi kha dog shes par bya //
analyzed: de yi kha dog shes par bya //
translated: One should know its color.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba la rnam snang gis rgyas btab nas yul gyi stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba la rnam snang gis rgyas btab nas yul gyi stong pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: Having sealed the elements with Vairochana, one should know the emptiness of the object.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni sems mi bskyod pas rgyas btab nas nam mkha' lta bu stong pa bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni sems mi bskyod pas rgyas btab nas nam mkha' lta bu stong pa bsgoms pa'o //
translated: Like space, one should meditate on the emptiness like space, having sealed the mind with Akshobhya.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgoms nas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the inconceivable clear light,

original: rdo rje sems dpas rgyas btab nas zung du 'jug pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpas rgyas btab nas zung du 'jug pa shes pa'o //
translated: one should know the union sealed by Vajrasattva.

original: des na de ltar ngo shes pa'i sems de nyid nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas mi gos shing shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de ltar ngo shes pa'i sems de nyid nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas mi gos shing shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the mind that recognizes in this way is not sullied by the afflictive obstructions and abandons the stains of the obstructions to omniscience.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As is said:

original: gong bu'i gzugs ni 'das gyur nas //
analyzed: gong bu'i gzugs ni 'das gyur nas //
translated: Having passed beyond the form of a lump,

original: dngos po med pa'i sems nyid bsgoms //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i sems nyid bsgoms //
translated: meditate on the mind itself, which is not an entity.

original: sems nyid rtag par mi bya ste //
analyzed: sems nyid rtag par mi bya ste //
translated: Do not make the mind itself permanent,

original: de yang bsam gyis mi khyab bsam //
analyzed: de yang bsam gyis mi khyab bsam //
translated: and also do not conceive of it as inconceivable.

original: sems la rnam gnas rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: sems la rnam gnas rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The yogi/nī who abides in the mind

original: mya ngan 'das pa mi ston to //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa mi ston to // zhes gsungs so //
translated: does not show nirvana.

original: de ltar grol ba'i lam bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar grol ba'i lam bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the path of liberation in this way,

original: da ni chags pa'i lam bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni chags pa'i lam bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the path of passion will be explained.

original: de lam ni rdo rje slob dpon dang dus mnyam du dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: de lam ni rdo rje slob dpon dang dus mnyam du dbang thob pa'o //
translated: The path is the attainment of initiation simultaneously with the vajra master.

original: srid mo ni rang dang dus mnyam du dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: srid mo ni rang dang dus mnyam du dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The sister is the initiation conferred simultaneously with oneself.

original: bu mo ni rang gis dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: bu mo ni rang gis dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The girl is one who initiates herself.

original: gnyen mo ni rang gi slob mas dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen mo ni rang gi slob mas dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The friend is one who is initiated by her own disciple.

original: de bzhi ni sngags skyes yin la /
analyzed: de bzhi ni sngags skyes yin la /
translated: These four are mantra-born.

original: bram ze mo la sogs pa bzhi ni gnas la sogs pa las skyes pa 'jig rten du grags pa yin no //
analyzed: bram ze mo la sogs pa bzhi ni gnas la sogs pa las skyes pa 'jig rten du grags pa yin no //
translated: The four beginning with the brahmin woman are known in the world as born from the womb, etc.

original: gar mkhan ma la sogs pa bzhi ni zhing skyes kyi bye brag rigs tha mar gyur pa bdud rtsi dang dpa' bo rnam pa lnga rnams zas su 'dod pas rnam @8a * //
analyzed: gar mkhan ma la sogs pa bzhi ni zhing skyes kyi bye brag rigs tha mar gyur pa bdud rtsi dang dpa' bo rnam pa lnga rnams zas su 'dod pas rnam @8a * //
translated: The four beginning with the dancer are born in the field, a special type of family, who desire the five ambrosias and heroes as food.

original: rtog goms pas rnam rtog chung ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog goms pas rnam rtog chung ba yin te /
translated: They have little discursive thought because they are accustomed to discursive thought.

original: de ltar ba su tra gcig dbye ba bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar ba su tra gcig dbye ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the one verse on the classification of the girl,

original: da ni thabs kyi khyad par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni thabs kyi khyad par bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the special method should be explained.

original: shes rab thabs kyi cho ga yis //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi cho ga yis //
translated: By the rite of wisdom and method,

original: de nyid rigs pas mchod bya zhing //
analyzed: de nyid rigs pas mchod bya zhing //
translated: one should worship reality with reasoning.

original: zhes pa ni rtog pa med pa'i dga' ba bzhi pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtog pa med pa'i dga' ba bzhi pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: This is the nature of the fourth joy, which is free from discursive thought.

original: ci nas tshor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ci nas tshor bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not feel it in any way.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'i gnas su gsang thub cing dam tshig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'i gnas su gsang thub cing dam tshig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the place of division, where one is able to keep the secret and has the commitments.

original: rab tu 'bad de bya ba ni bsnyen bsgrub ngang ldan pas sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'bad de bya ba ni bsnyen bsgrub ngang ldan pas sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: One should practice with great effort, training with the practice of approach and accomplishment.

original: ma gsang sbrul dang chom rkun dang // sa la spyod pas sdug bsngal spyod //
analyzed: ma gsang sbrul dang chom rkun dang // sa la spyod pas sdug bsngal spyod //
translated: If one does not keep the secret, one will experience suffering from snakes, robbers, and those who live on the earth.

original: ces pa ni ma spyad pa'i nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: ces pa ni ma spyad pa'i nyes dmigs so //
translated: This is the danger of not practicing.

original: de ltar thabs kyi khyad par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar thabs kyi khyad par bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the differences in the method,

original: da ni phyag rgya'i dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya'i dbye ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: now, the divisions of the consort will be explained.

original: sngags skyes ma la sogs pa bzhi la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs sam /
analyzed: sngags skyes ma la sogs pa bzhi la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rigs sam /
translated: The four, the mantra-born, and so on, are of the nature of the five families of the tathāgatas or the one hundred families.

original: rigs brgya'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i dbye ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs brgya'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'i dbye ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the divisions.

original: de yang / dag byed dbang gi lha mo dang // dpa' bo'i lha mo bkas bsgos skyes //
analyzed: de yang / dag byed dbang gi lha mo dang // dpa' bo'i lha mo bkas bsgos skyes //
translated: Furthermore, the goddesses of the empowerment of purification, the heroines, and the goddesses of the command are born from the command.

original: zhes bya ba'i man ngag nas sems 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gnyis rigs dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i man ngag nas sems 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gnyis rigs dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: The two branches of mind-control and so on are in accordance with the family.

original: rgyu'i tshogs pa gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i tshogs pa gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the same causal collection.

original: de la bram ze ni mdal  nas skyes pa dang / rigs kyis bskyed pa dang gnyis dang ldan pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bram ze ni mdal  nas skyes pa dang / rigs kyis bskyed pa dang gnyis dang ldan pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The brahmin is distinguished as having two types: born from the womb and born from the caste.

original: rgyal rigs ni rgyal srid dang ldan pa'i bu mo'o //🔽rje'u'i rigs ni glang po che skyong ba'i rigs yin pas rje'u rigs kyi khyad par yin no //🔽zhi ba la sogs pa byed na dmangs rigs kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: rgyal rigs ni rgyal srid dang ldan pa'i bu mo'o // rje'u'i rigs ni glang po che skyong ba'i rigs yin pas rje'u rigs kyi khyad par yin no // zhi ba la sogs pa byed na dmangs rigs kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: The kshatriya is the daughter of a king.🔽The vaishya is distinguished as the caste of elephant keepers.🔽The shudra is distinguished as the caste of butchers.

original: dmangs rigs shan pa mo dag ni nya pa dang shan pa dang lham mkhan la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i rigs so //
analyzed: dmangs rigs shan pa mo dag ni nya pa dang shan pa dang lham mkhan la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i rigs so //
translated: The shudra is the caste of butchers, fishermen, and so on.

original: lhag ma'i rigs bzhi ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ma gtogs pa bzhi dang mthun par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i rigs bzhi ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs ma gtogs pa bzhi dang mthun par shes par bya'o //
translated: The four remaining castes should be understood as corresponding to the four lineages except for the Tathagata lineage.

original: lo'i tshigs ma la sogs pa'i dbye ba mtha' yas pa yod kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs ni mdor bsdus nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: lo'i tshigs ma la sogs pa'i dbye ba mtha' yas pa yod kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rigs ni mdor bsdus nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: Although there are infinite divisions of the family, such as the family of the year, etc., the families of the Tathagatas are described in brief.

original: de ltar dbye ba brjod nas de'i 'thad pa bstan pa ni /🔽de bzhin du ni slar song nas //
analyzed: de ltar dbye ba brjod nas de'i 'thad pa bstan pa ni / de bzhin du ni slar song nas //
translated: Having thus described the divisions, the author teaches their validity:🔽In the same way, having gone forth,

original: de bzhin dpal ldan slar 'ong ma //🔽shes rab 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi lta ba bzhin du rang gis rtogs shing /
analyzed: de bzhin dpal ldan slar 'ong ma // shes rab 'di ni zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi lta ba bzhin du rang gis rtogs shing /
translated: the glorious one returns again.

original: gzhan la ston pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan la ston pa ni /
translated: This wisdom, etc. means that, having realized it by oneself, as does the view of the characteristics, one teaches it to others.🔽The family is called wisdom, because it is the realization of emptiness.

original: rigs 'di shes rab stong pa nyid rtogs pa 'di la @8b de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rigs 'di shes rab stong pa nyid rtogs pa 'di la @8b de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The one who has gone forth is called a Tathagata, because he has gone to suchness.

original: de mkhas pa chen po dzny'a na pa'i zhal nas /
analyzed: de mkhas pa chen po dzny'a na pa'i zhal nas /
translated: The great scholar Jnanapada says:

original: de bzhin nyid rang gis mkhyen nas slar byon nas nyid kyis gzigs pa'i lam du gzung ba ni rnal 'byor gyis mngon sum rig pa 'dis bud med rnams la shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rang gis mkhyen nas slar byon nas nyid kyis gzigs pa'i lam du gzung ba ni rnal 'byor gyis mngon sum rig pa 'dis bud med rnams la shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: Having realized suchness by oneself, one returns again and takes hold of the path that one has seen by oneself. This wisdom of the yoginis is called wisdom.

original: snga ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang mtshan nyid mthun pas bud med la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang mtshan nyid mthun pas bud med la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: The former is called a Tathagata because she is similar to a Tathagata.

original: phyi ma ni de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen nas bud med rnams shes rab rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma ni de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen nas bud med rnams shes rab rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The latter is a woman who is known by the Tathagata and is taught to be a woman of wisdom.

original: phung po khams dang dbang po dang yul dang ye shes la dbye bas rigs brgya yin no //
analyzed: phung po khams dang dbang po dang yul dang ye shes la dbye bas rigs brgya yin no //
translated: The families are one hundred, divided into aggregates, elements, faculties, objects, and gnoses.

original: mdor bsdu na lnga dang gsum gyi rang bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na lnga dang gsum gyi rang bzhin du bstan to //
translated: In brief, they are taught to be of five and three natures.

original: yang na bye brag phung po lnga dang 'byung ba lnga las rigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na bye brag phung po lnga dang 'byung ba lnga las rigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, in particular, the families are the five aggregates and the five elements.

original: rdo rje thugs ma dang / padma gsung dang / rin po che yon tan dang / 'khor lo nor bu can sgra dang tshogs kyi sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin pa las kyi rigs bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje thugs ma dang / padma gsung dang / rin po che yon tan dang / 'khor lo nor bu can sgra dang tshogs kyi sna tshogs rdo rje 'dzin pa las kyi rigs bsdu ba'o //
translated: The vajra family is the aggregate of gnosis and the element of space; the lotus family is the aggregate of discrimination and the element of water; the jewel family is the aggregate of appreciation and the element of fire; the wheel family is the aggregate of configuration and the element of wind; and the family of various activities is the aggregate of consciousness and the element of earth.

original: de ltar chags pa'i lam bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar chags pa'i lam bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the path of passion,

original: de nas rang lhag par gnas pa'i lam bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rang lhag par gnas pa'i lam bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the path of one's own consecration should be explained.

original: sgom pa po med ces pa ni 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sgom pa po med ces pa ni 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase no meditator means being free from grasping.

original: bsgom bya med ces pa ni gzung bya dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom bya med ces pa ni gzung bya dang bral ba'o //
translated: The phrase no object of meditation means being free from objects of grasping.

original: sngags med ces bya ba ni bcos ma'i bzlas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sngags med ces bya ba ni bcos ma'i bzlas pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase no mantra means no contrived recitation.

original: lha yang med ces pa ni bcos ma'i lha spangs pa'o //
analyzed: lha yang med ces pa ni bcos ma'i lha spangs pa'o //
translated: The phrase no deity means abandoning contrived deities.

original: 'o na lha bsgom pa dang sngags bzlas pa la sogs pa ji ltar bya zhe na spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'o na lha bsgom pa dang sngags bzlas pa la sogs pa ji ltar bya zhe na spros pa med pa'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Well, how does one meditate on the deity, recite the mantra, and so on? The phrase the nature of nonelaboration is stated.

original: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin bsgom mo //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on the nature of clear light.

original: de ltar mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having thus presented the brief explanation,🔽the extensive explanation is as follows.

original: rgyas par bshad pa ni spros pa dang bral ba de nyid rigs lnga'i rang bzhin dang / tshangs pa la sogs par snang ba chos kyi dbyings de kho na rtogs pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa ni spros pa dang bral ba de nyid rigs lnga'i rang bzhin dang / tshangs pa la sogs par snang ba chos kyi dbyings de kho na rtogs pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: That very freedom from elaboration is the nature of the five buddha families, and the appearance as Brahmā and so on is the dharmadhātu itself, which arises from the realization of thatness.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar brjod ce na /
translated: Why is it said to be so?

original: gnas gyur pa ye shes lnga la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lngar brjod pa las 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pas tshangs pa dang stong pa nyid la 'jug pas khyab 'jug dang / rtag tu zag pa med pa'i bde ba yin pas zhi ba ste /🔽kun du thams cad bdag nyid bzhugs //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ye shes lnga la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lngar brjod pa las 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pas tshangs pa dang stong pa nyid la 'jug pas khyab 'jug dang / rtag tu zag pa med pa'i bde ba yin pas zhi ba ste / kun du thams cad bdag nyid bzhugs //
translated: The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.

original: sa bcu gcig pa'i bde ba dam pa zung du 'jug pa'i de kho na nyid mthar phyin nas rtogs shing khong du chud pa las sangs rgyas lnga zhes bya'o //🔽glo bur gyi @9a * //
analyzed: sa bcu gcig pa'i bde ba dam pa zung du 'jug pa'i de kho na nyid mthar phyin nas rtogs shing khong du chud pa las sangs rgyas lnga zhes bya'o // glo bur gyi @9a * //
translated: The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.

original: dri ma'i lus las dri ma med pa'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i lha zhes bya'o //🔽de la mtshan gyi bye brag ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dri ma'i lus las dri ma med pa'i rang bzhin du 'byung ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i lha zhes bya'o // de la mtshan gyi bye brag ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.

original: skal ba drug dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms pas na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skal ba drug dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa 'joms pas na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates.🔽The five aggregates are the five buddhas because they are the five gnoses that are the transformation of the five aggregates

original: gdul bya 'dod chags can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gdul bya 'dod chags can rnams kyi'o //
translated: [This is] for the disciples who are passionate.

original: ma dang sring mo bu mo rnams shes rab kyang brdar btags la tshos mkhan dang gar mkhan dang g-yung mo zhes kyang brdar brjod la /
analyzed: ma dang sring mo bu mo rnams shes rab kyang brdar btags la tshos mkhan dang gar mkhan dang g-yung mo zhes kyang brdar brjod la /
translated: Mother, sister, and daughter are also designated as wisdom, and also called weaver, dancer, and prostitute.

original: rnam snang chen po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas thams cad la khyab pa 'am /
analyzed: rnam snang chen po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur bas thams cad la khyab pa 'am /
translated: Since [they] become the nature of Mahāvairocana, [they] pervade everything.

original: gnyis su med pa'i don gcig la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa'i tshul gyis brdar 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i don gcig la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pa'i tshul gyis brdar 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: Or, in the manner of the one hundred and eight names of the perfection of wisdom, [they] are designated in the single meaning of non-duality.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis nyams su blangs na 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs na ngag gi brjod pa thams cad bzlas pa dang / rkang pa 'gro ba dkyil 'khor dang / lag pa bskyod pa phyag rgya dang / sems kyis gang bsams pa thams cad bsam gtan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis nyams su blangs na 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs na ngag gi brjod pa thams cad bzlas pa dang / rkang pa 'gro ba dkyil 'khor dang / lag pa bskyod pa phyag rgya dang / sems kyis gang bsams pa thams cad bsam gtan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of clear light is realized when practiced by the yogis, all verbal expressions are recitation, walking with the feet is the maṇḍala, moving the hands is mudrā, and whatever is thought by the mind is meditation.

original: chags dang sdang ba la sogs dang // lus kyi g-yo 'gul la sogs dang // ngag gis ji snyed brjod pa rnams //
analyzed: chags dang sdang ba la sogs dang // lus kyi g-yo 'gul la sogs dang // ngag gis ji snyed brjod pa rnams //
translated: and all that is expressed by speech,

original: chos nyid ci bzhin mthong nas ni //
analyzed: chos nyid ci bzhin mthong nas ni //
translated: when seen as reality just as it is,

original: thams cad bde ba chen por 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad bde ba chen por 'gyur //
translated: all of that becomes great bliss.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de ltar rang lhag par gnas pa'i lam bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang lhag par gnas pa'i lam bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the path of the natural state,

original: de ji ltar rtogs pa'i thabs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ji ltar rtogs pa'i thabs bstan pa ni /
translated: the method of realizing it is taught.

original: pha las thob pa'i bde ba gang //
analyzed: pha las thob pa'i bde ba gang //
translated: The bliss obtained from the father

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on is stated.

original: bla ma las dbang bskur ba'i dus su bde ba rtogs pa med pa myong nas bde ba'i rgyun rnams rnal 'byor pa rang gi dga' ba gsum las lus dang sems mngon sum du longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma las dbang bskur ba'i dus su bde ba rtogs pa med pa myong nas bde ba'i rgyun rnams rnal 'byor pa rang gi dga' ba gsum las lus dang sems mngon sum du longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: Having experienced the bliss that is not realized at the time of receiving empowerment from the guru, the yogi should enjoy the stream of bliss with his own three joys, directly experiencing body and mind.

original: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: chu'i bde ba gang yin pa de rang bzhin brgyad cus 'gags shing 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis bde ba chen po de la bsam gtan gyi bde ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chu'i bde ba gang yin pa de rang bzhin brgyad cus 'gags shing 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyis bde ba chen po de la bsam gtan gyi bde ba zhes brjod do //
translated: That bliss of water is blocked by the eighty natural instincts, and that great bliss of the nature of clear light is called the bliss of concentration.

original: de nyid ni mngon sum gyis lam gyi zag bcas dang zag med kyi bde ba rgyu tshogs pa las byung ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid ni mngon sum gyis lam gyi zag bcas dang zag med kyi bde ba rgyu tshogs pa las byung ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: That itself is the path of direct perception, and the bliss of the contaminated and uncontaminated arises from the collection of causes.

original: brtag pa dang po'i rab tu byed pa dang po'o /
analyzed: brtag pa dang po'i rab tu byed pa dang po'o /
translated: This is the first chapter of the first part of the treatise.

original: // / de ltar de kho na nyid bsgom pa'i rab tu byed pa bshad nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar de kho na nyid bsgom pa'i rab tu byed pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the treatise on the meditation of reality,

original: da ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ro mnyam par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ro mnyam par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the equality of samsara and nirvana,

original: dkyil 'khor rnams kyang gnyis su med pa'i byang chub kyi @9b sems kyi rang bzhin yin par bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnams kyang gnyis su med pa'i byang chub kyi @9b sems kyi rang bzhin yin par bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: it is explained that the mandalas are also the nature of nondual bodhicitta.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gsungs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gsungs te /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are taught.

original: de la byed pa la nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu'i sas bsdus pa dang / gnas pa las gyur pa 'bras bu mi slob pa'i sas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la byed pa la nye bar gnas pa'i rgyu'i sas bsdus pa dang / gnas pa las gyur pa 'bras bu mi slob pa'i sas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The first is included in the causal stage of abiding in the process of becoming, and the second is included in the resultant stage of no more learning.

original: de la gsang sngags kyi theg pa ni sgyu ma lta bu dang stong pa 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du cig car bsgoms pa yin te /
analyzed: de la gsang sngags kyi theg pa ni sgyu ma lta bu dang stong pa 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin du cig car bsgoms pa yin te /
translated: In the mantra vehicle, one meditates on the illusion-like and the empty clear light simultaneously.

original: sgyu ma lta bu sum cu rtsa bdun ni thabs /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu sum cu rtsa bdun ni thabs /
translated: The thirty-seven aspects of illusion-like are the method.

original: stong pa nyid sum cu rtsa bdun ni shes rab /
analyzed: stong pa nyid sum cu rtsa bdun ni shes rab /
translated: The thirty-seven aspects of emptiness are the wisdom.🔽The thirty-seven aspects of union are the great bliss.

original: zung du 'jug pa sum cu rtsa bdun ni bde ba chen po yin no zhes thos bsam gyis shes par byas nas phyag rgya bzhi la brten nas yul shes rab kyi stong pa nyid dang / yul can thabs kyi stong pa nyid mngon sum du shes par byas nas bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa sum cu rtsa bdun ni bde ba chen po yin no zhes thos bsam gyis shes par byas nas phyag rgya bzhi la brten nas yul shes rab kyi stong pa nyid dang / yul can thabs kyi stong pa nyid mngon sum du shes par byas nas bsgom pa yin no //
translated: Having understood this through learning and reflection, one meditates on the basis of the four seals, directly understanding the emptiness of the object, the wisdom, and the emptiness of the subject, the method.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos yin la yul can shes rab kyi rnam pa ni stong pa nyid du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos yin la yul can shes rab kyi rnam pa ni stong pa nyid du byed pa yin no //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena. The aspect of the subject, wisdom, is emptiness.

original: sngags kyi theg pa ni lus dang tshor ba dang / sems kyi chos ni bskyed rim pas lha mo bzhi bsgom pa dang / rdzogs rim la rtsa bzhi bsgoms nas /
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa ni lus dang tshor ba dang / sems kyi chos ni bskyed rim pas lha mo bzhi bsgom pa dang / rdzogs rim la rtsa bzhi bsgoms nas /
translated: In the mantra vehicle, the body, feelings, mind, and phenomena are the four goddesses that are cultivated in the creation stage and the four channels that are cultivated in the completion stage.

original: de la yul stong pa nyid dang / yul can sgyu ma lta bur ro gcig par bsgom pa na /🔽chu'i zla ba'am /
analyzed: de la yul stong pa nyid dang / yul can sgyu ma lta bur ro gcig par bsgom pa na / chu'i zla ba'am /
translated: When one meditates on the object, emptiness, and the subject, which is like an illusion, as being of one taste,🔽it is like the moon in the water🔽or a mirage.

original: smig rgyu lta bur sems kyis rnam pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bur sems kyis rnam pa byed pa yin no //
translated: The mind creates the aspect.

original: de'i dgos pa ni lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / sred pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / chos su rmongs pa spong ba'i phyir bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa ni lus kyi gnas ngan len dang / sred pa dang / bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / chos su rmongs pa spong ba'i phyir bsgom pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of that meditation is to abandon the negative tendencies of the body, craving, grasping at a self, and confusion about phenomena.

original: de bzhin du shes rab brtson 'grus kyi grogs dang bcas pas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab brtson 'grus kyi grogs dang bcas pas nyon mongs pa ma skyes pa mi skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams spong ba'i phyir sbyor ba la /
translated: Likewise, with the aid of wisdom and effort, one generates the will to apply oneself in order to prevent the non-arising of the passions that have not yet arisen and to eliminate those that have already arisen.

original: 'dun pa bskyed cing dngos gzhi la 'bad de rjes la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed cing dngos gzhi la 'bad de rjes la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One exerts oneself in the main practice with effort and afterwards one applies effort.

original: de ltar sems rab tu 'dzin cing ma 'ongs pa la sems dbang du smon to //
analyzed: de ltar sems rab tu 'dzin cing ma 'ongs pa la sems dbang du smon to //
translated: Thus, one fully grasps the mind and one wishes to control the mind in the future.

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / bskyed pa 'phel ba'i phyir byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa dang / bskyed pa 'phel ba'i phyir byed pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, one acts in order to generate virtuous qualities that have not yet arisen and to increase those that have already arisen.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi grogs dang ldan pas 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang dpyod pa dang / sems dang / ting nge 'dzin bzhi la re res kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi grogs dang ldan pas 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang dpyod pa dang / sems dang / ting nge 'dzin bzhi la re res kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis /
translated: In this regard, the bases of supernatural power are the four: will, effort, mind, and investigation, which are endowed with the aid of meditative concentration.

original: le lo dang / brjed pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / 'du byed dang / 'du mi byed de /
analyzed: le lo dang / brjed pa dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa dang / 'du byed dang / 'du mi byed de /
translated: Each of them has an adverse element: laziness, forgetfulness, laxity and excitedness, application, and non-application.

original: nyes pa lnga po spong pa yin no //🔽de la le lo'i gnyen po ni @10a * //
analyzed: nyes pa lnga po spong pa yin no // de la le lo'i gnyen po ni @10a * //
translated: These five faults are abandoned.

original: gnas bdun pa dang / gnas pa brtson 'grus dang rgyu dad pa dang / 'bras bu shin tu sbyangs pa bzhi dang / dran pa dang lngas brjed ngas pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas bdun pa dang / gnas pa brtson 'grus dang rgyu dad pa dang / 'bras bu shin tu sbyangs pa bzhi dang / dran pa dang lngas brjed ngas pa spong ba yin no //
translated: Among them, the antidote to laziness is the four: the seven bases, the basis of effort, faith as the cause, and pliancy as the result, and mindfulness as the fifth.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa ni shes bzhin gyis spong ngo //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa ni shes bzhin gyis spong ngo //
translated: Drowsiness and excitement are abandoned by introspection.

original: 'du mi byed pa ni sems pas spong ngo //
analyzed: 'du mi byed pa ni sems pas spong ngo //
translated: Non-application is abandoned by intention.

original: 'du byed drags pa ni btang snyoms kyis spong ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed drags pa ni btang snyoms kyis spong ngo //
translated: Excessive application is abandoned by equanimity.

original: de la dbang po rnams ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs nas rang gi rigs 'dra bskyed pa la dbang ba'i phyir dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po rnams ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs nas rang gi rigs 'dra bskyed pa la dbang ba'i phyir dbang po'o //
translated: Among them, the faculties are faculties because they have power over the abandonment of the opposing side and the generation of their own class.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir stobs so //
translated: They are powers because they are not overwhelmed by the opposing side.

original: de la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la rang bzhin gyi yan lag ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi yan lag bdun la rang bzhin gyi yan lag ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, the seven factors of enlightenment have the nature of the factor of discrimination of phenomena.

original: gnas pa'i yan lag ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i yan lag ni dran pa'o //
translated: The basis of the factor is mindfulness.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ni brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ni brtson 'grus so //
translated: The limb of definite release is vigor.

original: dga' ba ni phan yon yin lag go //
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon yin lag go //
translated: Joy is the limb of benefit.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag go //
translated: Calmness, concentration, and equanimity are the limbs of nonaffliction.

original: gzhi'i yan lag dang / gnas pa'i yan lag dang / ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: gzhi'i yan lag dang / gnas pa'i yan lag dang / ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag go //
translated: The limbs of the path are of three kinds: limbs of support, limbs of going, and limbs of steering.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad la yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad la yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ni lta ba'o //
translated: In the eightfold noble path, right view is the limb of delimitation.

original: go bar byed pa'i yan lag ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i yan lag ni rtog pa'o //
translated: Right thought is the limb of understanding.

original: lta bas yid ches pa'i yan lag ni ngag go //
analyzed: lta bas yid ches pa'i yan lag ni ngag go //
translated: Right speech is the limb of conviction through view.

original: tshul khrims kyis gzhan yid ches par byed pa ni las kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis gzhan yid ches par byed pa ni las kyi mtha'o //
translated: Right action is the limb of conviction through morality.

original: yo byad bsnyungs pas gzhan yid ches par byed pa ni 'tsho ba'o //🔽nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni rtsol ba'o //🔽nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni mngon shes so //
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pas gzhan yid ches par byed pa ni 'tsho ba'o // nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni rtsol ba'o // nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ni mngon shes so //
translated: Right livelihood is the limb of conviction through fewness of wishes.🔽Right effort is the limb of the antidote to the defilements.🔽Right mindfulness is the limb of the antidote to the secondary defilements.

original: dbang gis bsgribs pa'i gnyen po ni ting nge 'dzin te //
analyzed: dbang gis bsgribs pa'i gnyen po ni ting nge 'dzin te //
translated: Right concentration is the limb of the antidote to the obscurations of the meditative development.

original: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs cig car bsgom pa bstan nas de'i snang ba lus kyi 'khor lo'i rtsa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs cig car bsgom pa bstan nas de'i snang ba lus kyi 'khor lo'i rtsa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having thus taught the simultaneous cultivation of the factors of enlightenment, the explanation of the channels of the body's cakras will be explained.

original: de ltar yang dag bshad de dag / rab tu dga' la sogs pa'i sa //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag bshad de dag / rab tu dga' la sogs pa'i sa //
translated: Thus, those who are explained correctly, in the Joyful and so forth,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsa'i rten gyi bye brag bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsa'i rten gyi bye brag bshad pa'o //
translated: and so on. This explains the specific supports of the channels.

original: dbang po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yin zer ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yin zer ro //
translated: It is said that the faculties are the qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: phung po lnga sangs rgyas yin pa dang / sogs kyis 'byung ba lnga lha mo yin pa gnas de rnams su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' shes pa rtog med 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga sangs rgyas yin pa dang / sogs kyis 'byung ba lnga lha mo yin pa gnas de rnams su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' shes pa rtog med 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The five aggregates are the buddhas, and so on, indicating that the five elements are the goddesses. The buddhas and bodhisattvas arise in those places without conceptual thought.

original: dus nam gyi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: dus nam gyi tshe zhe na /
translated: At what time, one might ask?

original: byang chub sems ni sum cu gnyis //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni sum cu gnyis //
translated: The bodhicitta is thirty-two.

original: gang tshe 'dir ni yong gang ba //
analyzed: gang tshe 'dir ni yong gang ba //
translated: When it comes here, it is full.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: lus la tshor ba sdug bsngal gyi phung po nad @10b med cing tshor ba btang snyoms kyi dbang po khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi sbyangs nas /
analyzed: lus la tshor ba sdug bsngal gyi phung po nad @10b med cing tshor ba btang snyoms kyi dbang po khams nyi shu rtsa bzhi sbyangs nas /
translated: The aggregate of feeling of suffering in the body is purified, and the faculty of neutral feeling is purified.

original: dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang / lhan cig skyes dga' khyab pa'i dus kyi tshe /
analyzed: dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang / lhan cig skyes dga' khyab pa'i dus kyi tshe /
translated: At the time of the pervasion of joy, supreme joy, and connate joy,

original: bde ba rtog pa med pa yin pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched lha'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba rtog pa med pa yin pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched lha'i rang bzhin no //
translated: since bliss is nonconceptual, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are the nature of the deity.

original: de rang gi lus la zhi gnas kyi sangs rgyas bzhugs pas gzhan du gang na'ang sangs rgyas med kyang mi shes pas sangs rgyas 'dod do //
analyzed: de rang gi lus la zhi gnas kyi sangs rgyas bzhugs pas gzhan du gang na'ang sangs rgyas med kyang mi shes pas sangs rgyas 'dod do //
translated: Since the buddhas abide in one’s body as śamatha, since there is no buddha anywhere else, and since one does not know that, one desires a buddha.

original: sems de'i stong pa nyid ni lus la gnas kyang lus las ma skyes pa yin te /🔽kun du brtags pa nub nas rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: sems de'i stong pa nyid ni lus la gnas kyang lus las ma skyes pa yin te / kun du brtags pa nub nas rtog pa thams cad spangs pa yin la /
translated: The emptiness of that mind is the emptiness of the body, but it does not arise from the body.🔽The imputed is the disappearance of all concepts.

original: gzhan gyi dbang nub nga kun du rtog pa thams cad nub pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang nub nga kun du rtog pa thams cad nub pa yin no //
translated: The dependent is the disappearance of all imagination.

original: mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas dngos po kun la khyab cing lus la gnas kyang glong bur gyi rnam par rtog pas ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas dngos po kun la khyab cing lus la gnas kyang glong bur gyi rnam par rtog pas ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: Since it is the unchanging, thoroughly established nature, it pervades all things and abides in the body, but it is not produced by adventitious thoughts.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //🔽ngo bo nyid la phyin log gi //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don // ngo bo nyid la phyin log gi //
translated: Nonviolence and the true meaning🔽are not averted even with effort

original: 'bad du zin kyang mi zlogs  shing blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //🔽zhes bshad do //🔽des na rang rig 'od gsal ba las ni phung po lnga'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen byed la glo bur gyi rtog pa phung po lngas ni sems 'od gsal ba'i rkyen mi byed do //
analyzed: 'bad du zin kyang mi zlogs  shing blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro // zhes bshad do // des na rang rig 'od gsal ba las ni phung po lnga'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen byed la glo bur gyi rtog pa phung po lngas ni sems 'od gsal ba'i rkyen mi byed do //
translated: because the mind is oriented toward them.🔽Therefore, the five aggregates are the cooperative conditions for the clear light of self-awareness, but the five aggregates that are adventitious thoughts are not the conditions for the clear light of mind.

original: des na rang rig pa 'od gsal bas ni nyams su myong ba'i rgyu rkyen las skye'i glo bur gyi rnam par rtog pa las mi skye'o //
analyzed: des na rang rig pa 'od gsal bas ni nyams su myong ba'i rgyu rkyen las skye'i glo bur gyi rnam par rtog pa las mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the clear light of self-awareness is produced from the causes and conditions of experience and is not produced from adventitious thoughts.

original: des na 'bad du zin kyang glo bur gyi rnam par rtog pa'i sgrib pas mi zlogs  pa de la bde ba chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'bad du zin kyang glo bur gyi rnam par rtog pa'i sgrib pas mi zlogs  pa de la bde ba chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even though one strives, it is not averted by the obscurations of adventitious discursive thought. That is called “great bliss.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying pos zhi gnas kyi bde ba'i rten rtsa du mchis zhes zhus pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying pos zhi gnas kyi bde ba'i rten rtsa du mchis zhes zhus pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattva Vajra Heart asked, “What are the channels that are the support for the bliss of śamatha?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsa gtso mo brgya nyi shu bstan pa dang / spyi gtsug gi byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa lus thams cad la khyab pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'khor lo bzhi'i rtsa gtso mo brgya nyi shu bstan pa dang / spyi gtsug gi byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa lus thams cad la khyab pa'i rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis bstan la /
translated: The Bhagavān taught the one hundred and twenty principal channels of the four cakras and the thirty-two channels that pervade the entire body with the bodhicitta that falls from the crown.

original: rtsa rnams kyang dbyibs kyis mtshon nas ming gi brdar btags pa ni gnyis yin te /
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyang dbyibs kyis mtshon nas ming gi brdar btags pa ni gnyis yin te /
translated: The channels are also designated with names that are indicated by their shapes. There are two:

original: bde mchog dang sbyar nas gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi /
analyzed: bde mchog dang sbyar nas gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi /
translated: When applied to Cakrasaṃvara, there are twenty-four places.

original: 'khor lo gsum dang / bu ga dgu'i rtsa dam tshig gi 'khor lo'i rten bzhad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum dang / bu ga dgu'i rtsa dam tshig gi 'khor lo'i rten bzhad pa yin no //
translated: The channels of the three cakras and the nine orifices are the support of the pledge wheel.

original: dgyes pa rdo rje dang sbyar nas ra sa n'a dang la la n'a dang / aawa dh'u t'i gsum gsum ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: dgyes pa rdo rje dang sbyar nas ra sa n'a dang la la n'a dang / aawa dh'u t'i gsum gsum ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: When applied to Hevajra, the three of rasanā, lalanā, and avadhūtī are the main ones.

original: mi phyed pa ni rdo rje bdag med ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni rdo rje bdag med ma yin zhing /
translated: The indestructible is not Vajranairātmyā.

original: de la rtsa sku gsung thugs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa yin pas na @11a * //
analyzed: de la rtsa sku gsung thugs kyi yon tan dang ldan pa yin pas na @11a * //
translated: Since she has the qualities of the body, speech, and mind of the channels,

original: rtsa bzhir snang ba yin no //
analyzed: rtsa bzhir snang ba yin no //
translated: she appears as the four channels.

original: gzhan lha mo bco lnga ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis dang ldan pa yin pas na rtsa gnyis gnyis su 'jog pa yin pa 'am yang na rgyu 'bras bu gnyis dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan lha mo bco lnga ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis dang ldan pa yin pas na rtsa gnyis gnyis su 'jog pa yin pa 'am yang na rgyu 'bras bu gnyis dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The other fifteen goddesses are posited as two channels each because they have both method and wisdom, or they have both cause and effect.

original: yang na sangs rgyas mnyam sbyor dang sbyar nas /
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas mnyam sbyor dang sbyar nas /
translated: When applied to Buddhakapāla,

original: rigs drug gi rten he ru ka dang ldan pas na rtsa drug lnga sum cu tham pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs drug gi rten he ru ka dang ldan pas na rtsa drug lnga sum cu tham pa yin la /
translated: since they have the support of the six families and Heruka, there are thirty channels, five times six.

original: ra sa n'a dang / la la n'a ni dbus kyi gtso bo he ru ka'i sku gsum dang ldan par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ra sa n'a dang / la la n'a ni dbus kyi gtso bo he ru ka'i sku gsum dang ldan par ston pa yin no //
translated: The rasanā and lalanā are taught to have the three bodies of the central Heruka.

original: bcom ldan 'das la rtsa de dag gi rang bzhin zhus pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rtsa de dag gi rang bzhin zhus pa ni /
translated: The nature of those channels is requested from the Bhagavān.

original: srid pa gsum po thams cad kyi lus rtsar snang yang bsam gtan gyi bde ba rtog med skyes pa'i dus su rang bzhin brgyad cu'i rtog pa brgyad cu po mtshan mo'i sgras bstan pa dang / 'dzin pa'i rtog pa brgyad cu'i nyin mo'i brdar bstan pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: srid pa gsum po thams cad kyi lus rtsar snang yang bsam gtan gyi bde ba rtog med skyes pa'i dus su rang bzhin brgyad cu'i rtog pa brgyad cu po mtshan mo'i sgras bstan pa dang / 'dzin pa'i rtog pa brgyad cu'i nyin mo'i brdar bstan pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Although the channels of the body appear in all three realms, when the bliss of concentration arises without conceptuality, it is free from the eighty conceptual thoughts taught by the word night and the eighty conceptual thoughts of apprehending taught by the word day.

original: bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams spangs pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i ye shes 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i ye shes kyi snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams spangs pa la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i ye shes 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: The appearance of the pristine consciousness of great bliss is the pristine consciousness free from the apprehended and the apprehender, which abandons thoughts.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las kyang /🔽ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin lus //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las kyang / ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin lus //
translated: And in the Continuation of the Guhyasamaja Tantra:🔽The body is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: 'byung ba lnga yi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga yi ngo bo nyid //
translated: It is the essence of the five elements.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: rab tu byed pa gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter.

original: // / de ltar sems snang ba dang bcas pa'i rab tu byed pa bshad nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar sems snang ba dang bcas pa'i rab tu byed pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the chapter on the mind and appearances,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong nyams su blang ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong nyams su blang ba bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the practice of śamatha and vipaśyanā:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Then, having made offerings to the Bhagavān,

original: gsang chen bde ba'i zhi gnas kyi bde ba dang / ye shes bla na med pa lhag mthong gi rang bzhin dang / bla na med pa'i snying po nyams su blang ba'i thabs gsungs pa yin no //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud thams cad kyi snying po nyams su blang bzhi gnas dang ltag mthong /
analyzed: gsang chen bde ba'i zhi gnas kyi bde ba dang / ye shes bla na med pa lhag mthong gi rang bzhin dang / bla na med pa'i snying po nyams su blang ba'i thabs gsungs pa yin no // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyud thams cad kyi snying po nyams su blang bzhi gnas dang ltag mthong /
translated: he taught the method of practicing the unsurpassed essence, the bliss of the great secret śamatha and the nature of the unsurpassed wisdom vipaśyanā.

original: rnam shes dang ye shes kyi sgron ma rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam shes dang ye shes kyi sgron ma rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, having entered into equipoise on the samādhi called “the practice of the essence of all tantras, śamatha and vipaśyanā, the lamp of consciousness and wisdom, free from all conceptuality,” taught.

original: de la dang po gleng gzhi'i don bstan pa ni gsang ba dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dang / dgyes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i 'khor byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang / ston pa'i gtso bo bdag nyid dus rtag tu bzhugs so //
analyzed: de la dang po gleng gzhi'i don bstan pa ni gsang ba dga' ba dang / mchog dga' dang / dgyes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i 'khor byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag brgyad cu dang / ston pa'i gtso bo bdag nyid dus rtag tu bzhugs so //
translated: The first of these, the meaning of the introduction, is that the secret, the supreme joy, and the joy, the innate, are always present as the principal teacher, together with a retinue of eight hundred million bodhisattvas.

original: ston pa'i gtso bo gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ston pa'i gtso bo gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the principal teacher?

original: sangs rgyas kun dngos sems dpa' ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dngos sems dpa' ste //
translated: The hero who is the actuality of all buddhas,🔽the heruka who is the nature of the five families,

original: rigs lnga'i rang @11b bzhin he ru ka / rdo rje sems dpa' longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bde mchog dang / chos skus bdud bzhi bcom zhing zung du 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor te ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / glo bur gyi rnam par rtog pas mi bskyod pas na brtan zhing mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bar du mi chod pas na rtag pa nyid de spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i rang @11b bzhin he ru ka / rdo rje sems dpa' longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i bde mchog dang / chos skus bdud bzhi bcom zhing zung du 'jug pa'i rnal 'byor te ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / glo bur gyi rnam par rtog pas mi bskyod pas na brtan zhing mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bar du mi chod pas na rtag pa nyid de spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva, the supreme joy of the body of perfect enjoyment, the yoga of union that has conquered the four demons with the body of reality, is endowed with perfect pristine consciousness, and is firm and permanent because it is unshaken by adventitious conceptual thoughts, is endowed with perfect abandonment.

original: rtag tu da ltar byung ba dang // zhes pa ni myong ba 'ba' zhig dus gsum dang bral bas na der snang ba tsam ste /
analyzed: rtag tu da ltar byung ba dang // zhes pa ni myong ba 'ba' zhig dus gsum dang bral bas na der snang ba tsam ste /
translated: means that the experience alone is free from the three times, so it is merely an appearance there.🔽He is the abandonment of the collection of causes,

original: he ni rgyu tshogs spangs pa dang // ru ni bkod pa dang bral bas //
analyzed: he ni rgyu tshogs spangs pa dang // ru ni bkod pa dang bral bas //
translated: and ru is free from arrangement.

original: ka ni gang du 'ang mi gnas pas //
analyzed: ka ni gang du 'ang mi gnas pas //
translated: Ka is not located anywhere.

original: zhes 'byung bas dus gsum gyis stong pas dngos dang rjes thams cad du chos kyi dbyings las mi bzhengs pas na rang bzhin gyis ni 'da' dka' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas dus gsum gyis stong pas dngos dang rjes thams cad du chos kyi dbyings las mi bzhengs pas na rang bzhin gyis ni 'da' dka' ba'o //
translated: Since it is empty of the three times, it is difficult for the nature to pass beyond, since it does not arise from the dharmadhatā at all times.

original: de ltar sku gsum bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sku gsum bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the three kāyas in that way,

original: da ni bshad pa'i chos phun sum tshogs pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni bshad pa'i chos phun sum tshogs pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: now, the perfect Dharma to be explained will be explained.

original: sna tshogs las kyi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sna tshogs las kyi sbyor ba yis //
translated: The union of the various actions

analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs lnga dang shes rab lnga mnyam par sbyor ba'o //

original: sna tshogs cho ga 'dod rnams la //
analyzed: sna tshogs cho ga 'dod rnams la //
translated: For those who desire the various rites,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa gang 'dod pa la /

analyzed: de lta de ltar ston cing ston pa po sangs rgyas dang rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pas gdul bya bzhin du rgyud dgu rdzogs par mdzad pa yin no //

original: de yang khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de yang khyad par ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the distinction?

original: sangs rgyas kun sogs brtan g-yo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun sogs brtan g-yo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, “the stable and the moving, and so on, of all the buddhas.”

analyzed: sangs rgyas kun ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o //
translated: All the buddhas are the appearance of the form of nirvana.

original: dngos po kun du 'di 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po kun du 'di 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the nature of all things.

original: zhes pa ni thams cad kyang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can du snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thams cad kyang bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can du snang ba'o //
translated: It is said that all things appear as the nature of great bliss.

original: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is that?

original: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: It is the union with all the buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po dang dam tshig dang chos dang las kyi phyag rgya dang / thabs rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang lus bde ba dang yid bde ba dang rnal 'byor ma rnams rang bzhin brgyad cu gzung ba mtshan mor snang ba dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po dang dam tshig dang chos dang las kyi phyag rgya dang / thabs rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes dang lus bde ba dang yid bde ba dang rnal 'byor ma rnams rang bzhin brgyad cu gzung ba mtshan mor snang ba dang /
translated: The great seal, pledge seal, doctrine seal, and action seal, and the method, nonconceptual intuition, physical bliss, mental bliss, and yoginis, are free from the eighty natural concepts that appear as the night of the object of apprehension and

original: 'dzin pa ni nyin mor snang ba'i rtog pa rnams dang bral bas na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni nyin mor snang ba'i rtog pa rnams dang bral bas na /
translated: the day of the subject of apprehension.

original: bde ba rtog pa med pa yul dang yul can ro gcig pa'i zhi gnas kyi mnyam par sbyor ba dang / bde ba sgyu ma lta bu dang stong pa nyid ro gcig pa'i lhag mthong gi mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba rtog pa med pa yul dang yul can ro gcig pa'i zhi gnas kyi mnyam par sbyor ba dang / bde ba sgyu ma lta bu dang stong pa nyid ro gcig pa'i lhag mthong gi mnyam par sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they are united in the equipoise of tranquility, the nonconceptual bliss of the single taste of subject and object, and in the equipoise of insight, the bliss that is like an illusion and is of the single taste of emptiness.

original: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma yi dra ba sdom //

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i dra ba las @12a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa'i dra ba las @12a * //
translated: means that the net of channels🔽is the binding of the dakinis' net.

original: byang chub kyi sems sdom pas dbyings dang rlung gi dra ba las sngags kyi rang bzhin dang / stong pa nyid dang sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin sdom pas sems kyi sdom pa chos kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems sdom pas dbyings dang rlung gi dra ba las sngags kyi rang bzhin dang / stong pa nyid dang sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin sdom pas sems kyi sdom pa chos kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The vow of the mind of enlightenment is the nature of the Dharma, the vow of mind, since it is the nature of mantra and emptiness and illusion through the realm and the network of winds.

original: sdom pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bde mchog la bya'o //
analyzed: sdom pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bde mchog la bya'o //

original: de ltar tshigs bcad gcig gis zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi rgyud thabs bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs bcad gcig gis zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi rgyud thabs bstan nas /

original: da ni sgyu ma bde ba'i thabs yin par ston te /
analyzed: da ni sgyu ma bde ba'i thabs yin par ston te /
translated: now, the method of bliss of illusion is taught.

original: sgyu ma bde ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: sgyu ma bde ba 'di yis ni //
translated: This bliss of illusion

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is taught.

original: sgyu ma de gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgyu ma de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that illusion?

original: mkha' 'gro ma dra ba bde ba'i mchog go //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dra ba bde ba'i mchog go //
translated: It is the dakini’s Web of Bliss.

original: rnam pa du zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa du zhe na /

analyzed: thams cad du ni sna tshogs mchog / ces bya ste /

original: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab nas yul thams cad du dngos po bde ba sna tshogs pa gzung 'dzin dang bral bas na mchog ste /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab nas yul thams cad du dngos po bde ba sna tshogs pa gzung 'dzin dang bral bas na mchog ste /
translated: Having been sealed with the four seals, it is the supreme bliss of all objects, the variety of things free from subject and object.

original: su'i zhe na /
analyzed: su'i zhe na /
translated: Whose is it?

original: sems can kun gyi don du'o //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi don du'o //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind?

original: bla na med par ro //
analyzed: bla na med par ro //
translated: Unsurpassed.

original: thabs gang gis she na /🔽sangs rgyas la sogs 'dul bas grub //
analyzed: thabs gang gis she na / sangs rgyas la sogs 'dul bas grub //
translated: By what means?

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: By means of the Buddha and so forth, the means of training.

analyzed: tshogs kyi 'khor lo byed pa'i dus su sangs rgyas lnga dang / dpa' bo thams cad dang dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i mnyam par sbyor ba'i tshul gyis bzhugs nas gdul bya 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mos pa la gzugs sdug pa dang / sgra snyan pa dang /
translated: At the time of performing the gaṇacakra, the five Buddhas and all the heroes and heroines abide in the manner of union, and by means of attractive forms, pleasant sounds,

analyzed: dri zhim pa dang / ro mngar ba dang reg bya yid du 'ong ba'i bar gyis gdul bya 'dul bar grub po //
translated: fragrant smells, sweet tastes, and agreeable touches, they accomplish the training of those to be trained who are devoted to the five sense pleasures.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: skye bo 'dod chags can don du //
analyzed: skye bo 'dod chags can don du //
translated: For the sake of passionate beings,

original: 'di yi byed pa rdo rje sems //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yi byed pa rdo rje sems // zhes gsungs so //
translated: the performance of this is Vajrasattva.

original: mnyam sbyor las kyang /
analyzed: mnyam sbyor las kyang /
translated: And also in the Samputa:

original: bskal pa bye ba grangs med snyed //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba grangs med snyed //
translated: For countless millions of eons,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ma mthong la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ma mthong la //
translated: one does not see all the Buddhas.

original: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba gang dag gis //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i sbyor ba gang dag gis //
translated: By which yoga of the seal

original: tshe 'di nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid kyis 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: one will succeed in this very life.

original: de ni bdag gis bstan par bya //
analyzed: de ni bdag gis bstan par bya //
translated: I will teach that.

original: sangs rgyas kun dngos bde ba'i mchog / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun dngos bde ba'i mchog / ces gsungs so //
translated: The supreme bliss which is the nature of all Buddhas.

original: da ni las kyi phyag rgya'i dam tshig ston te /
analyzed: da ni las kyi phyag rgya'i dam tshig ston te /
translated: Now he teaches the commitment of the karmamudra.

original: rang gi gzugs ni yongs brjes nas //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs ni yongs brjes nas //
translated: Having completely transformed one's form,

original: zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba'i gzugs spangs nas chags pa chen po'i gzugs su bsgyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chags pa dang bral ba'i gzugs spangs nas chags pa chen po'i gzugs su bsgyur te /
translated: means having abandoned the form of one who is free of passion, and having transformed into the form of one with great passion.

original: las kyi phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi'i dbye bas bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi'i dbye bas bde ba'i ting nge 'dzin shes par byed pa'o //
translated: One should understand the meditative concentration of bliss by the division of the four kinds of karmamudra.

original: de yang du zhe na /
analyzed: de yang du zhe na /
translated: And how many are there?

original: ma dang sring mo dang bu mo dang tsha mo ste bzhi dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang bram ze'i rigs dang dmangs rigs te bzhi dang / bcu gnyis ma dang / bcu drug ma dang / nyi @12b shu ma dang / nyi shu rtsa bzhi ma ste bzhi dang /
analyzed: ma dang sring mo dang bu mo dang tsha mo ste bzhi dang rgyal rigs dang rje'u rigs dang bram ze'i rigs dang dmangs rigs te bzhi dang / bcu gnyis ma dang / bcu drug ma dang / nyi @12b shu ma dang / nyi shu rtsa bzhi ma ste bzhi dang /
translated: There are four: mother, sister, daughter, and niece; four castes: kshatriya, vaisya, brahmin, and sudra; four ages: twelve years, sixteen years, twenty years, and twenty-four years;

original: sngags skyes ma dang / zhing skyes ma dang / las las skyes ma dang / ye shes las skyes ma ste /
analyzed: sngags skyes ma dang / zhing skyes ma dang / las las skyes ma dang / ye shes las skyes ma ste /
translated: The four are the mantra-born, the field-born, the action-born, and the wisdom-born.

original: bzhi dang bcu drug go //
analyzed: bzhi dang bcu drug go //
translated: These four make sixteen.

original: de dag ni bud med kyi sgyu mas grub ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni bud med kyi sgyu mas grub ces bya ste /
translated: They are called “accomplished by the illusion of woman.”

original: sgyu mar khyad par med kyang /
analyzed: sgyu mar khyad par med kyang /
translated: There is no difference in illusion.

original: bde ba'i sgyu ma ni sgyu ma rnams kyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i sgyu ma ni sgyu ma rnams kyi mchog yin te /
translated: But the illusion of bliss is the best of illusions.

analyzed: des sna tshogs sgyu ma'i phyag rgya'i brdar btags nas mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya'o //
