original: ci'i phyir de la mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called “dakinis”?

original: sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis yod de /
analyzed: sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two reasons: the reason for the etymology of the word, and the definition of the term.

original: d'a yi sgra las mkha' 'gro zhes //
analyzed: d'a yi sgra las mkha' 'gro zhes //
translated: The word “dakini” is from the root “da,”

original: 'dir ni khams la rnam par brtag / ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis de'i aa ka sa ma zhes bya ba'i sgra'i khams kyis sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni khams la rnam par brtag / ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis de'i aa ka sa ma zhes bya ba'i sgra'i khams kyis sgra bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Here, the half-verse “Here, the elements are imagined” is the reason for the etymology of the word from the element “a-ka-sa.”

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni zhi gnas rtog med kyi nam mkha' gzugs med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi rtogs na rgyu bas mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan ni zhi gnas rtog med kyi nam mkha' gzugs med pa bzhi dang / bsam gtan bzhi rtogs na rgyu bas mkha' 'gro ma bzhi'o //
translated: The reason for the engagement is that the space of nonconceptual śamatha is the four formless [absorptions], and the four conceptual concentrations are the four ḍākinīs.

original: yang sa bcu gcig gi chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid rtogs shing rgyu bas mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang sa bcu gcig gi chos kyi dbyings stong pa nyid rtogs shing rgyu bas mkha' 'gro ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since the space of the emptiness of the dharmadhātu of the eleventh stage is realized and moves, it is called a ḍākinī.

original: de ltar mkha' 'gro ma'i nges tshig bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar mkha' 'gro ma'i nges tshig bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the definition of ḍākinī,

original: da ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi rigs kyi dbye ba bshad de /
analyzed: da ni mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyi rigs kyi dbye ba bshad de /
translated: now, the classification of the types of ḍākinīs will be explained.

original: kun du sna tshogs phyag rgya ni //
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs phyag rgya ni //
translated: The universal mudra of diversity

original: kun du yid 'ong bde mchog yin //
analyzed: kun du yid 'ong bde mchog yin //
translated: is the supreme bliss of the universal mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni dag byed kyi lha mo dbang gi lha mo dang / dpa' bo'i lha mo dang / bkas gnang ba dang / de 'og ma lus kun spyod ma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dag byed kyi lha mo dbang gi lha mo dang / dpa' bo'i lha mo dang / bkas gnang ba dang / de 'og ma lus kun spyod ma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the purifying goddess, the empowerment goddess, the hero’s goddess, the goddess of permission, and the mudra of the universal conduct of the body.

original: kun du sna tshogs bde mchog ni //
analyzed: kun du sna tshogs bde mchog ni //
translated: The supreme bliss of the universal diversity

original: sems 'dzin pa'i yan lag dang / dbang bskur ba'i yan lag dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i rim pa dang / mchod pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: sems 'dzin pa'i yan lag dang / dbang bskur ba'i yan lag dang / tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i rim pa dang / mchod pa'i yan lag go //
translated: the branch of mind-fixation, the branch of initiation, the stage of the feast-circle, and the branch of worship.

original: de yang dbye na du zhe na /
analyzed: de yang dbye na du zhe na /
translated: If one asks how many divisions there are,

original: rdo rje rdo rje 'dzin nyid dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje rdo rje 'dzin nyid dang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “vajra, the very holder of the vajra,” and so on.

original: rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rigs yin la /
analyzed: rdo rje ni rdo rje'i rigs yin la /
translated: The vajra is the vajra clan,

original: de las byung ba he ru ka'i rigs ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las byung ba he ru ka'i rigs ni rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: and the clan of Heruka that arises from that is the very holder of the vajra.

original: padma ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs yin la /
analyzed: padma ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi rigs yin la /
translated: The lotus is the clan of Amitābha,

original: padma 'dzin pa ni las kyi rigs yin no //🔽nor bu'i rigs ni rin po che'i rigs yin la /
analyzed: padma 'dzin pa ni las kyi rigs yin no // nor bu'i rigs ni rin po che'i rigs yin la /
translated: and the holder of the lotus is the clan of action.🔽The jewel clan is the clan of the jewel,

original: nor bu 'dzin pa ni rin po che'i rigs yin no //
analyzed: nor bu 'dzin pa ni rin po che'i rigs yin no //
translated: and the holder of the jewel is the clan of the jewel.

original: de ltar na rigs drug ka'i rang bzhin du 'di rnams snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rigs drug ka'i rang bzhin du 'di rnams snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, these appear as the nature of all six clans.

original: yang na rdo rje padma dang nor bu chos kyi dbyings dang so sor rtog pa dang / me long lta bu yin la /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje padma dang nor bu chos kyi dbyings dang so sor rtog pa dang / me long lta bu yin la /
translated: Or else, the vajra, lotus, and jewel are the dharmadhātu, discrimination, and mirror-like [wisdoms],

original: 'dzin pa gsum ni stong pa nyid gsum dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gsum ni stong pa nyid gsum dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The three graspings are endowed with the three emptinesses.

original: de'i don 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the meaning taught here.

original: gnas dben @13a * //🔽zhing yid du 'ong bar dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i lha'i grangs dang mnyam par bsags nas bsnyen bsgrub bzhis ji lta ba bzhin du sbyang ba byas pa 'am /
analyzed: gnas dben @13a * // zhing yid du 'ong bar dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i lha'i grangs dang mnyam par bsags nas bsnyen bsgrub bzhis ji lta ba bzhin du sbyang ba byas pa 'am /
translated: The place is isolated and pleasing.

original: yang na gdong brnyan gon la lha'i cha byad bzung nas /🔽gzugs rdo rje ma dang / sgra rdo rje ma dang / dri rdo rje ma dang / ro rdo rje ma dang / reg bya rdo rje ma rnams la /
analyzed: yang na gdong brnyan gon la lha'i cha byad bzung nas / gzugs rdo rje ma dang / sgra rdo rje ma dang / dri rdo rje ma dang / ro rdo rje ma dang / reg bya rdo rje ma rnams la /
translated: Having gathered the number of heroes and heroines, one should train in the four approaches and accomplishments, or else, having put on a mask and taken on the appearance of the deity,

original: gzugs 'dzin gyi rnam par spangs nas /
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin gyi rnam par spangs nas /
translated: one should abandon the form of the apprehender🔽with regard to the goddesses of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch.

original: dga' ba bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms nas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa zhi gnas kyi sems gzung ngo //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms nas bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa zhi gnas kyi sems gzung ngo //
translated: Having cultivated the meditative concentration of the four joys, one should hold the mind of meditative serenity, such as the first meditative stabilization.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is also said:🔽With the supreme flavor of the inhaled breath,

original: dbugs dbyung bar ma ro mchog dang // dri yi chu dang bcas pas kyang //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung bar ma ro mchog dang // dri yi chu dang bcas pas kyang //
translated: and with the water of smell,

original: rnal 'byor pas dus rtag khyab par //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas dus rtag khyab par //
translated: the yogī always pervades🔽with the supreme flavor of the exhaled breath.

original: rigs ldan rnams ni mchod par bya //
analyzed: rigs ldan rnams ni mchod par bya //
translated: The noble ones should be worshipped.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / mnyam sbyor las kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / mnyam sbyor las kyang /
translated: And the Union with Buddha Tantra also says:🔽Those who visualize the deity

original: lha la dmigs par byed pa dag / rnal 'byor gzugs brnyan rang bzhin te //
analyzed: lha la dmigs par byed pa dag / rnal 'byor gzugs brnyan rang bzhin te //
translated: are the nature of the reflection yoga.

original: rang gi dam tshig dam sbyor ba //
analyzed: rang gi dam tshig dam sbyor ba //
translated: By uniting with one’s pledge,

original: mi 'gyur dam pa 'grub par 'gyur //🔽gzugs brnyan lus la sogs pa las //
analyzed: mi 'gyur dam pa 'grub par 'gyur // gzugs brnyan lus la sogs pa las //
translated: the supreme unchanging is accomplished.🔽The yoga does not arise

original: rnal 'byor 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: from the reflection of the body and so forth.

original: byang chub sems la rab brtson na //
analyzed: byang chub sems la rab brtson na //
translated: If one strives at the spirit of enlightenment,

original: de las rnal 'byor lhar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las rnal 'byor lhar 'gyur ro //
translated: the yoga becomes the deity.

original: zhes gsungs pa rgyu rkyen tshogs kyi 'khor lo las bsam gtan dang po lta bu'i bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa rgyu rkyen tshogs kyi 'khor lo las bsam gtan dang po lta bu'i bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the bliss of the first concentration and so forth arises from the gaṇacakra of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: de ltar zhi gnas kyi thabs bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhi gnas kyi thabs bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the method of śamatha in that way,

original: da ni lhag mthong bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni lhag mthong bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the vipaśyanā will be explained.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'khor zil gyis gnon cing rnam par rtog pa'i rdul dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'khor zil gyis gnon cing rnam par rtog pa'i rdul dang bral ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavān is the one who overwhelms the retinue and is free from the dust of conceptuality.

original: bde ba chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thugs rtse gcig tu mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is one-pointedly focused on the inconceivable great bliss.

original: byang chub sems 'di gsungs zhes bya ba ni don dam byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems 'di gsungs zhes bya ba ni don dam byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: This is the teaching of the thought of awakening, which is the ultimate thought of awakening.

original: de'i rnam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is its aspect?

original: stong pa ma yin mi stong min //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin mi stong min //
translated: It is not empty, not non-empty,

original: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and is not apprehended as a middle.

original: stong pa ni kun du brtags pas stong pas kun brtags mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa ni kun du brtags pas stong pas kun brtags mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Here, “not empty” is the imagined, which is empty of the imagined characteristic.

original: mi stong ni gzhan dbang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mi stong ni gzhan dbang skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: “Not non-empty” is the relative, which is the reality of the nature of arising.

original: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs pa ni yongs su grub pa don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs pa ni yongs su grub pa don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa dbang po rnon po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: “Not apprehended as a middle” is the perfect, which is the ultimate reality of the nature of non-arising, from the perspective of those of sharp faculties.

original: stong pa ma yin pa ni gong bu'i gzugs las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin pa ni gong bu'i gzugs las 'das pa'o //
translated: “Not empty” is beyond the form of a mass.

original: mi stong min ni dngos po med pa'i sems nyid yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi stong min ni dngos po med pa'i sems nyid yin zhes bya'o //
translated: “Not non-empty” is the mind that is not a non-entity.

original: yang na chags dang chags bral ba //
analyzed: yang na chags dang chags bral ba //
translated: Or, attachment and non-attachment

original: lhan cig skyes dga' mi dmigs te //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes dga' mi dmigs te //
translated: are not apprehended as the innate bliss.

original: de skad du yang mnyam sbyor @13b las //
analyzed: de skad du yang mnyam sbyor @13b las //
translated: Thus, the union tantra says:

original: chags med chags dang bral ba med //
analyzed: chags med chags dang bral ba med //
translated: There is no attachment and no non-attachment.

original: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dbu mar yang ni mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not perceived in the middle.

original: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma'i rgya //
analyzed: bud med kun gyi sgyu ma'i rgya //
translated: This is the seal of illusion of all women.

original: 'di ni gnyis med theg pa'ang mchog / ces bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis med theg pa'ang mchog / ces bshad do //
translated: This is the supreme vehicle of nonduality.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: This is the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid thabs sbyor bas //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid thabs sbyor bas //
translated: The compassionate nature is the union of means.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: This is the illusion-like.

original: snying rje'i thabs kyis mdzes pa ni //
analyzed: snying rje'i thabs kyis mdzes pa ni //
translated: The beauty of compassionate means

original: zhes bya ba ni bde ba sgyu ma lta bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba sgyu ma lta bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: is the uninterrupted illusion-like bliss.

original: shes rab pha rol phyin gsal 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab pha rol phyin gsal 'gyur //
translated: The clarity of the perfection of wisdom

original: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la dmigs pa ste /
translated: is the observation of emptiness.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i don yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of union.

original: rnam par mi rtog chos rnams la //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog chos rnams la //
translated: In the nonconceptual dharmas

original: dngos po med cing bsgom pa med //
analyzed: dngos po med cing bsgom pa med //
translated: there is no entity and no meditation.

original: ces bya ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med cing bsgom bya dang sgom byed dang bral bas sems gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med cing bsgom bya dang sgom byed dang bral bas sems gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the placement of the mind free from the duality of object and subject and free from the meditator and meditation.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de las che mchog gzhan med pas //
analyzed: de las che mchog gzhan med pas //
translated: There is nothing greater than that.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: The lord of yogins, the great bliss,

original: rnal 'byor dbang phyug bde chen des //🔽chos 'di nyid la mi 'grub med //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dbang phyug bde chen des // chos 'di nyid la mi 'grub med //
translated: has united with all the Buddhas.🔽There is nothing that is not accomplished

original: ces gsungs so //🔽mi rtog lhag par mos par bya //
analyzed: ces gsungs so // mi rtog lhag par mos par bya //
translated: in this very Dharma.🔽One should have a special interest in non-conceptuality.

original: rtog pa kun gyis lhag par brtag / ces bya ba ni seng ge'i phru gu lta bu'am /
analyzed: rtog pa kun gyis lhag par brtag / ces bya ba ni seng ge'i phru gu lta bu'am /
translated: One should imagine the special [object] with all concepts.🔽This is the direct meditation on the emptiness of one part, like a lion cub,

original: zla ba tshes gcig pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: zla ba tshes gcig pa lta bu'am /
translated: like the first day of the moon,

original: skar khung gi gsang lta bur phyogs gcig gi stong pa nyid la mngon sum gyis bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: skar khung gi gsang lta bur phyogs gcig gi stong pa nyid la mngon sum gyis bsgom pa'o //
translated: like a crack in a window.

original: de lta bu'i thabs sus mdzad ce na bde bar gshegs pas mngon sum gyi lam 'di /🔽rnam par mi rtog chos rnams la //
analyzed: de lta bu'i thabs sus mdzad ce na bde bar gshegs pas mngon sum gyi lam 'di / rnam par mi rtog chos rnams la //
translated: Who is the one who performs such a method? The Sugata, this path of direct [perception],🔽is fully imagined for the sake of sentient beings

original: sems can don du rab tu brtags //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can don du rab tu brtags // zhes bya ste /
translated: in non-conceptual phenomena.

original: phyag rgya bzhi'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bdag byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bdag byin gyis brlabs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa yin te /
translated: This is the meditation on the stage of self-consecration through the consecration of the four seals.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur snang ba'o //
translated: It is the appearance as the enjoyment body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun bdag mchog / chos can med cing chos nyid med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun bdag mchog / chos can med cing chos nyid med //
translated: without dharmin, without dharmata.

original: ces bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid do //
translated: This is the nature of the Dharma Body.

original: chos dang chos can dang chos nyid dang rnam pa gsum med par bde ba chen por ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dang chos nyid dang rnam pa gsum med par bde ba chen por ro gcig pa'o //
translated: It is the one taste of great bliss, without the three: dharmin, dharmata, and dharma.

original: de ltar yin na ni ji ltar chos gsung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin na ni ji ltar chos gsung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, how can the Dharma be taught?

original: brag ca sgra dang mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: brag ca sgra dang mtshungs pa yi //
translated: Like an echo,

original: de nas chos kyi gsung 'di 'byung //
analyzed: de nas chos kyi gsung 'di 'byung //
translated: this Dharma speech arises.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis sprul pa'i sku 'byung ba bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis sprul pa'i sku 'byung ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, with one verse, the arising of the Emanation Body is taught.

original: de ltar sku gsum gyi don shes pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgoms pas sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba'i yon tan rgyas par 'grub par @14a * //
analyzed: de ltar sku gsum gyi don shes pa'i rnal 'byor pas bsgoms pas sangs rgyas dang 'dra ba'i yon tan rgyas par 'grub par @14a * //
translated: Thus, the yogin who knows the meaning of the three bodies, by meditating, will accomplish the qualities that are like the Buddha.

original: 'gyur ro // de ltar lhag mthong bshad nas nyams su blang ba'i don bstan pa ni bstod cing phyag byas nas gsol ba btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de ltar lhag mthong bshad nas nyams su blang ba'i don bstan pa ni bstod cing phyag byas nas gsol ba btab pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having explained insight, the teaching on the meaning of practice is the praise, prostration, and supplication.

original: 'gro ba sgrol byed sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba sgrol byed sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The emanation body is the liberator of beings.

original: sems can bdag skyes ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sems can bdag skyes ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i sgo nas so //
translated: The self-arisen sentient being is in terms of the enjoyment body.

original: rmongs pa gcod byed ni chos kyi sku'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rmongs pa gcod byed ni chos kyi sku'i sgo nas so //
translated: The cutter of delusion is in terms of the dharma body.

original: de nyid gcig pu ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de nyid gcig pu ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku'i sgo nas so //
translated: The sole reality is in terms of the essential body.

original: chos kun gcig pa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi don no //
analyzed: chos kun gcig pa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi don no //
translated: The essence of the oneness of all phenomena is the meaning of nondual wisdom.

original: dbang po drug gi lam gyur pa //
analyzed: dbang po drug gi lam gyur pa //
translated: The path of the six sense faculties

original: zhes bya ba ni mchan bcas kyi yul lnga la dga' bzhi de dang de'i rang bzhin du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mchan bcas kyi yul lnga la dga' bzhi de dang de'i rang bzhin du 'gro ba'o //
translated: is the four joys in the five objects with their respective natures.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rjes kyi rnal 'byor la /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rjes kyi rnal 'byor la /
translated: In the post-equipoise yoga of non-equipoise,

original: dngos gzhi bzhin du mnyam par bzhag pa dang ro mnyam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi bzhin du mnyam par bzhag pa dang ro mnyam par 'gyur ro //
translated: like the main subject, there is equipoise and the experience of equal taste.

original: yang na dbang po gang gi lam sems kyi bde ba chen po stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du rgyas btab pas /
analyzed: yang na dbang po gang gi lam sems kyi bde ba chen po stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du rgyas btab pas /
translated: Alternatively, the path of whichever sense faculty is the great bliss of the mind, which is sealed with the nature of emptiness,

original: bde ba chen po de dang de'i rang bzhin du 'gro ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po de dang de'i rang bzhin du 'gro ste /
translated: becomes the nature of that great bliss.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa gnyis khyad par med pas dngos rjes bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du ro mnyam par bsgom pa dang mi bsgom pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa gnyis khyad par med pas dngos rjes bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du ro mnyam par bsgom pa dang mi bsgom pa med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no difference between the equipoise and nonequipoise states, there is no meditation or nonmeditation on the great bliss nature of the actual and subsequent [moments of the fourth empowerment].🔽Therefore,🔽it is said:

original: des na / gang phyir dngos kun bdag nyid ni //🔽rnam shes phung por bstan pa yin //
analyzed: des na / gang phyir dngos kun bdag nyid ni // rnam shes phung por bstan pa yin //
translated: “Because all things

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: are taught to be the nature of the aggregate of consciousness.”

original: dbang bzhi yi ni sems kyi chos nyid shes pas chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang bzhi yi ni sems kyi chos nyid shes pas chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: By knowing the mind’s dharmatā through the four empowerments, one will know the concise and extensive topics of all Dharma.

original: de skyes bu blun po tha shal gyis shes par ma nus so //
analyzed: de skyes bu blun po tha shal gyis shes par ma nus so //
translated: This cannot be known by a stupid, inferior person.

original: thams cad kyis rtogs par mi nus sam zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kyis rtogs par mi nus sam zhe na /
translated: If it is asked whether it cannot be realized by everyone,

original: phyogs gzhan 'ga' dang 'ga' gzhan gyi yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan 'ga' dang 'ga' gzhan gyi yin te /
translated: it is the domain of some and not the domain of others.

original: thams cad kyang bde ba chen po 'dod pa la gzhol ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: thams cad kyang bde ba chen po 'dod pa la gzhol ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: However, all are solely devoted to the desire for great bliss.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what that is,

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ste sems rnam par shes pa drug gam brgyad kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong ste sems rnam par shes pa drug gam brgyad kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: it is the eighty-four thousand bundles of Dharma, which are the nature of the six or eight consciousnesses.

original: khams gsum pa de'i rang bzhin du shes pas grol bar 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: khams gsum pa de'i rang bzhin du shes pas grol bar 'dod pa'am /
translated: They are liberated by knowing the nature of the three realms.

original: sems las byung ba dad pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i sgo nas grol bar 'dod pa'i sems rnam bcas dang rnam med kyi sgo nas /
analyzed: sems las byung ba dad pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa'i sgo nas grol bar 'dod pa'i sems rnam bcas dang rnam med kyi sgo nas /
translated: They are liberated by means of faith, shame, and embarrassment that arise from the mind, and by means of the mind with and without form.

original: shes bya bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: shes bya bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: They are liberated by means of the Abhidharma and the sūtras.

original: rgyu ni rjes su dpag pa dang / 'bras bu ni spyod pa dang bya ba dang / gnyis ka'i rgyud kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rgyu ni rjes su dpag pa dang / 'bras bu ni spyod pa dang bya ba dang / gnyis ka'i rgyud kyi sgo nas so //
translated: They are liberated by means of inference as the cause, conduct as the result, and the continuum of both.🔽They are liberated by means of the ultimate, which is like an illusion, and by means of the ultimate nature, which is nonabiding.

original: chos can ni don dam sgyu ma lta bu'i sgo nas dang / @14b chos nyid ni rab tu mi gnas pa'i sgo nas thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis bsgom par 'dod pa yang chu bo chen po rnam pa bzhi ru chu bran lnga brgya'i 'khor gyis bskor nas rgya mtsho chen po'i lan tshva'i ror gcig tu gyur ba bzhin du
analyzed: chos can ni don dam sgyu ma lta bu'i sgo nas dang / @14b chos nyid ni rab tu mi gnas pa'i sgo nas thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis bsgom par 'dod pa yang chu bo chen po rnam pa bzhi ru chu bran lnga brgya'i 'khor gyis bskor nas rgya mtsho chen po'i lan tshva'i ror gcig tu gyur ba bzhin du
translated: Just as the four great rivers, each surrounded by five hundred tributaries, become of one taste in the great ocean, the salt water ocean,

original: grub pa'i mtha' du ma de dag kyang don dam par bde ba chen po la du ma nyid du mi dmigs pa'i phyir thar pa ni gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' du ma de dag kyang don dam par bde ba chen po la du ma nyid du mi dmigs pa'i phyir thar pa ni gcig kho na yin no //
translated: And those many philosophical systems are only one liberation, because in the ultimate truth, the multiplicity of great bliss is not observed.

original: ji ltar gang gis sems kyi stong nyid shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gang gis sems kyi stong nyid shes she na /
translated: How is the emptiness of mind known?

original: kha nang du bltas pa'i tha ma'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: kha nang du bltas pa'i tha ma'i lam gyis so //
translated: By the path of looking inward.

original: rab tu byed pa gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the third chapter, having thirty-two verses, called “the examination of the self.”

original: // / de ltar bde mchog la sogs pa'i mnyam sbyor gyi gleng gzhi bstan nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar bde mchog la sogs pa'i mnyam sbyor gyi gleng gzhi bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the nidāna of the union with the supreme, etc.,

original: da ni 'dus pa la sogs pa'i gleng gzhi bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'dus pa la sogs pa'i gleng gzhi bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the nidāna of the Guhyasamāja, etc., should be explained.

original: rgyud rnams kun gyis nges pa ste //
analyzed: rgyud rnams kun gyis nges pa ste //
translated: The ascertainment of all tantras

original: gru gsum shin tu yangs pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: gru gsum shin tu yangs pa'i gzugs //
translated: is the form of the very vast triangle.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig rtogs pas zhi gnas kyi rtogs pa bde ba med pa'am phyogs gcig gi gang zag gi bdag 'gags sam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyogs gcig rtogs pas zhi gnas kyi rtogs pa bde ba med pa'am phyogs gcig gi gang zag gi bdag 'gags sam /
translated: This is the realization of śamatha through the realization of one part, the cessation of the self of the person of one part,

original: nyan thos sam rang rgyal ba'i bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos sam rang rgyal ba'i bdag med pa'am /
translated: or the selflessness of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: phyogs gcig gi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas byang chub sems dpa'i stong nyid mtha' dag dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi stong nyid ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong yin la /🔽kun rdzob tu ae gru gsum gzhal yas khang ngam zla ba'am padma'am /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gi nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang bral bas byang chub sems dpa'i stong nyid mtha' dag dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi stong nyid ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong yin la / kun rdzob tu ae gru gsum gzhal yas khang ngam zla ba'am padma'am /
translated: The emptiness of the buddhas, which is free of all the obscurations of defilement related and cognitive obscurations of bodhisattvas, is shared by all sentient beings.

original: btsun mo'i gru gsum bha ga'i gzugs su kun rdzob tu snang ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bzhugs gnas su gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: btsun mo'i gru gsum bha ga'i gzugs su kun rdzob tu snang ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bzhugs gnas su gyur pa yin la /
translated: On the relative level, the three corners of the e are the celestial palace, the moon, the lotus or the three corners of the queen's bhaga, the form of the bhaga, which appears on the relative level and is the abode of the tathagatas.

original: don dam par de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: On the ultimate level, it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzung ba'i yul las 'das shing 'dzin pa med pas na srog chags thams cad kyi dbus na bzhugs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mtshon pa'i thabs kun rdzob ston pa phun sum tshogs par snang ba ste /
analyzed: gzung ba'i yul las 'das shing 'dzin pa med pas na srog chags thams cad kyi dbus na bzhugs pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mtshon pa'i thabs kun rdzob ston pa phun sum tshogs par snang ba ste /
translated: Since it is beyond the object of the apprehended and without an apprehending subject, it is the perfect display of the relative, the means of illustrating nonconceptual gnosis, which is present in the midst of all living beings.

original: mdor na thabs dang shes rab kyi don rtogs pas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bas na thabs dang shes rab ston pa'i phyir gleng gzhi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor na thabs dang shes rab kyi don rtogs pas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur bas na thabs dang shes rab ston pa'i phyir gleng gzhi bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, since one becomes a buddha by realizing the meaning of method and wisdom, the nidāna is taught in order to demonstrate method and wisdom.

original: de yang mngon sum du ma rtogs pas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang mngon sum du ma rtogs pas bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du goms pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, since one does not realize that directly, one becomes familiar with it for three incalculable aeons.

original: mngon sum gyi lam gyis tshe 'di nyid la rdo rje 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi lam gyis tshe 'di nyid la rdo rje 'dzin pa'am /
translated: By means of the direct path, one becomes a vajra holder in this lifetime.

original: lha'i 'khor los sgyur ba'am /
analyzed: lha'i 'khor los sgyur ba'am /
translated: Or one becomes a divine cakravartin

original: dngos grub bzhi thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar gleng gzhi mdor @15a * //
analyzed: dngos grub bzhi thob par 'gyur ro // de ltar gleng gzhi mdor @15a * //
translated: or one obtains the four feats.

original: bsdus pa bstan nas sems 'od gsal ba yin yang glo bur gyi dri ma 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'khor bar 'ching zhing /
analyzed: bsdus pa bstan nas sems 'od gsal ba yin yang glo bur gyi dri ma 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbang gis 'khor bar 'ching zhing /
translated: Having explained the concise nidāna in that way, although the mind is luminous, it is bound in saṃsāra by the power of the temporary stains of desire and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gyis 'joms par byed cing sems de'i las dge mi dges bcings nas dmigs pa dang ldan pa de srid du slar yang sdig pa sna tshogs pas khams gsum du 'khor zhing skyes bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis 'joms par byed cing sems de'i las dge mi dges bcings nas dmigs pa dang ldan pa de srid du slar yang sdig pa sna tshogs pas khams gsum du 'khor zhing skyes bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the mind is bound by virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, it is endowed with an object. As long as that is the case, one will again be bound by various sins and be born in the three realms.

original: de ltar dang po'i 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid bshad nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas dpa' bo ni zhes bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba'i lam rjes su mthun pa'i stobs ston te ji lta bu zhe na 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ltung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dang po'i 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid bshad nas de'i tshe sangs rgyas dpa' bo ni zhes bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba'i lam rjes su mthun pa'i stobs ston te ji lta bu zhe na 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor ltung ba'o //
translated: Having thus explained the characteristics of the first, samsara, he shows the power of the path of exhalation that is in accord with it. What is it like? It is the falling into the ocean of samsara.

original: dgos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dgos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: For the sake of freedom from suffering.

original: thabs gang gis she na /
analyzed: thabs gang gis she na /
translated: By what means?

original: sprul pa'i sku byin rlabs kyi lam dang / rig pa'i mngon sum gyi lam gyis so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku byin rlabs kyi lam dang / rig pa'i mngon sum gyi lam gyis so //
translated: By the path of the blessing of the nirmanakaya and the path of the direct perception of vidya.

original: thabs kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: thabs kyi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of the method?

original: thabs dang thabs kyi sbyor bas so //
analyzed: thabs dang thabs kyi sbyor bas so //
translated: It is the method and the application of the method.

original: shes rab ni mtshon byed de la ci zhig rtogs she na /
analyzed: shes rab ni mtshon byed de la ci zhig rtogs she na /
translated: What is the wisdom that is to be realized?

original: khams gsum pa mtshon bya dri ma med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa mtshon bya dri ma med pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The three realms are to be realized as the nature of stainlessness.

original: gang dang gang gi gnas gyur pas //
analyzed: gang dang gang gi gnas gyur pas //
translated: By the transformation of each one,

original: de dang de yi ngo bor 'gyur //
analyzed: de dang de yi ngo bor 'gyur //
translated: each one becomes its own nature.

original: dper na bud shing mer 'gyur ba bzhin du bskyed pa'i rim pa lha'i gar gyi 'khor los phung po dang khams dang skye mched sbyangs te /
analyzed: dper na bud shing mer 'gyur ba bzhin du bskyed pa'i rim pa lha'i gar gyi 'khor los phung po dang khams dang skye mched sbyangs te /
translated: Just as fuel becomes fire, so the stage of generation, the circle of dance of the deity, purifies the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan pos sgyu ma mkhan po pham par byas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i mkhan pos sgyu ma mkhan po pham par byas pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as a magician defeats a magician, so the stage of completion, the circle of dance of emptiness, defeats the stage of generation.

original: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa dang sbyar na nyon mongs pa lnga'i gnyen por sangs rgyas lnga bsgom pa'am mi zab pa'i rdzogs rim la rtsa lnga'i rlung la bde ba bsgom pa 'am nyon mongs pa lnga po de nyid kho na stong pa nyid kyis gseng brtol ba'o
analyzed: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa dang sbyar na nyon mongs pa lnga'i gnyen por sangs rgyas lnga bsgom pa'am mi zab pa'i rdzogs rim la rtsa lnga'i rlung la bde ba bsgom pa 'am nyon mongs pa lnga po de nyid kho na stong pa nyid kyis gseng brtol ba'o
translated: In the stage of generation, one meditates on the five Buddhas as antidotes to the five passions, or one meditates on bliss in the five energy-winds of the five channels, or one pierces the five passions themselves with emptiness.

original: // de ltar re re'i sbyor ba bshad nas /
analyzed: // de ltar re re'i sbyor ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the application of each of the five passions,

original: thun mong du sbyor ba /
analyzed: thun mong du sbyor ba /
translated: the common application is explained.

original: rdo rje 'dzin bcas thams cad sbyong //🔽zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin bcas thams cad sbyong // zhes 'byung ste /
translated: All is purified, together with the vajra-holder.

original: 'od gsal bas thams cad bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal bas thams cad bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: This means that by clearlight all is made to have the nature of great bliss.

original: nyon mongs pa lnga ji ltar sbyong du rung zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lnga ji ltar sbyong du rung zhe na /
translated: How is it possible to purify the five passions?

original: sems 'od gsal ba brten pa'i glo bur gyi dri ma nam mkha' la sprin sna tshogs byung nas de nyid du thim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems 'od gsal ba brten pa'i glo bur gyi dri ma nam mkha' la sprin sna tshogs byung nas de nyid du thim pa bzhin no //
translated: The luminous mind is like the sky, and the adventitious defilements are like the various clouds that arise in the sky and dissolve back into it.

original: nang gi bye brag 'di lta bu gang gis shes she na /
analyzed: nang gi bye brag 'di lta bu gang gis shes she na /
translated: Who knows this inner distinction?

original: bla ma'i man ngag la brten pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag la brten pa'o //
translated: It is known through the guru's instructions.

original: de ltar rjes su mthun pa'i thabs gnyis bstan nas da ni brtag pa'i gleng gzhi @15b bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su mthun pa'i thabs gnyis bstan nas da ni brtag pa'i gleng gzhi @15b bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having thus taught the two concordant methods, now the nidana of the investigation will be explained.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling ni gru gsum la btsun mo'i bha ga zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling ni gru gsum la btsun mo'i bha ga zhes bya ste /
translated: The bhaga of the queen is the triangular Jambudvipa.

original: ae yi cha byad bzang po yi //
analyzed: ae yi cha byad bzang po yi //
translated: The excellent shape of E

original: dbus su wam gyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: dbus su wam gyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: is in the center, adorned with VAM.

original: zhes so // gnas 'di'i dbus na bzhugs pa'i gleng gzhis ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bsgom bya ci mtshon zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // gnas 'di'i dbus na bzhugs pa'i gleng gzhis ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bsgom bya ci mtshon zhe na /
translated: What is the object of meditation in the future indicated by the nidana of the place that exists in the center of this place?

original: btsun mo yum gyi bha ga gru gsum mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun mo yum gyi bha ga gru gsum mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The triangular bhaga of the mother, the queen, is indicated.

original: chags pa'i lam dang sbyar na dkyil 'khor bha ga zhes bya la /
analyzed: chags pa'i lam dang sbyar na dkyil 'khor bha ga zhes bya la /
translated: When applied to the path of passion, the bhaga is called the mandala.

original: grol ba'i lam dang sbyar na dkyil 'khor lus yin la /
analyzed: grol ba'i lam dang sbyar na dkyil 'khor lus yin la /
translated: When applied to the path of liberation, the mandala is the body.

original: rang lhag par gnas pa'i lam pa la dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings yin no //
analyzed: rang lhag par gnas pa'i lam pa la dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings yin no //
translated: The path of the individual is the dharmadhatu mandala.

original: de la rlung gi dkyil 'khor bde mchog dang sbyar na lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo bcu drug dang aa wa dh'u t'i dang 'brel pa rlung rgyu ba dang / g-yas pa ra sa n'a dang 'brel pa bcu drug khrag rgyu ba dang / g-yon pa la la n'a dang 'brel pa bcu drug byang chub kyi sems rgyu ba dang /
analyzed: de la rlung gi dkyil 'khor bde mchog dang sbyar na lte ba sprul pa'i 'khor lo bcu drug dang aa wa dh'u t'i dang 'brel pa rlung rgyu ba dang / g-yas pa ra sa n'a dang 'brel pa bcu drug khrag rgyu ba dang / g-yon pa la la n'a dang 'brel pa bcu drug byang chub kyi sems rgyu ba dang /
translated: In the case of the wind mandala in relation to Cakrasaṃvara, the navel chakra has sixteen spokes and is connected to the avadhūti, where the winds move; the right channel, rasanā, has sixteen spokes and is connected to the blood; and the left channel, lalanā, has sixteen spokes and is connected to the bodhicitta.

original: dbus ma dang g-yas nas g-yon du 'brel pa sgom bzhi'i rtsa dang / g-yas g-yon 'brel pa mtshams ma bzhi'i rtsa dang / 'byung ba bzhi'i rlung dang / bdud rtsi bzhi dang drug cu rtsa bzhi rten 'brel gyi gnas lugs yin la de'i dbus na gnas pa'i rlung la sems bzung nas phyi rol gyi rlung 'gags nas shes pa rtog med bskyed nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: dbus ma dang g-yas nas g-yon du 'brel pa sgom bzhi'i rtsa dang / g-yas g-yon 'brel pa mtshams ma bzhi'i rtsa dang / 'byung ba bzhi'i rlung dang / bdud rtsi bzhi dang drug cu rtsa bzhi rten 'brel gyi gnas lugs yin la de'i dbus na gnas pa'i rlung la sems bzung nas phyi rol gyi rlung 'gags nas shes pa rtog med bskyed nas bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The intrinsic mode of being of the vāyu and mind is that the vāyu in the center of those naḍīs is held by the mind, the external vāyu is arrested, and the nature of nonconceptual consciousness becomes great bliss.

original: de ltar gleng gzhi'i don gsum bshad nas de yang mos pa'i bye brag gis mu dra bzhi'i snang ba ni 'byung ba bzhi la mos pa la 'byung bzhi'i dkyil 'khor du snang ba 'am /
analyzed: de ltar gleng gzhi'i don gsum bshad nas de yang mos pa'i bye brag gis mu dra bzhi'i snang ba ni 'byung ba bzhi la mos pa la 'byung bzhi'i dkyil 'khor du snang ba 'am /
translated: Having explained the three topics of the nidāna, the appearances of the four mudras are the appearances of the maṇḍala of the four elements for those with the particular interest in the four elements.

original: lha mo bzhir mos pa la de ltar snang ba 'am /
analyzed: lha mo bzhir mos pa la de ltar snang ba 'am /
translated: For those with the interest in the four goddesses, they appear as such.

original: tshad med pa bzhir mos pa la tshad med pa bzhir snang ba 'am /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhir mos pa la tshad med pa bzhir snang ba 'am /
translated: For those with the interest in the four immeasurables, they appear as the four immeasurables.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhir mos pa la de ltar du snang ba'am /🔽ye shes bzhir mos pa la de ltar du snang ba'am /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bzhir mos pa la de ltar du snang ba'am / ye shes bzhir mos pa la de ltar du snang ba'am /
translated: It appears thus to one who is devoted to the four perfections.🔽Or it appears thus to one who is devoted to the four intuitions.

original: ae wam ma y'a yi ge bzhir mos pa la de ltar snang ba ste /
analyzed: ae wam ma y'a yi ge bzhir mos pa la de ltar snang ba ste /
translated: Or it appears thus to one who is devoted to the four syllables, e, vaṃ, ma, ya.

original: bdag byin gyis rlob par mos pa la glo bur gyi dri ma bsrabs pas stong pa mthong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes yan lag med pa'i rdo rje 'dod do //
analyzed: bdag byin gyis rlob par mos pa la glo bur gyi dri ma bsrabs pas stong pa mthong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes yan lag med pa'i rdo rje 'dod do //
translated: The Vajra Without Parts asserts that it is the cause of seeing emptiness through the thinning of adventitious defilements, for one who is devoted to the self consecration.

original: yang na sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba sprul pa'i sku dang mtshungs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba nyon mongs pa med pa'o zhes dpal mchog dang po las gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zag pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba sprul pa'i sku dang mtshungs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba nyon mongs pa med pa'o zhes dpal mchog dang po las gsungs so //
translated: Or else, the Glorious First Buddha states that it is the intuition manifestation similar to the emanation body, and the intuition manifestation without affliction, through the Buddha’s blessing.

original: de ltar snang ba med pa'i bye brag bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba med pa'i bye brag bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the differences in the non-appearance,

original: ae wam gyi @16a * //
analyzed: ae wam gyi @16a * //
translated: the differences in e and vaṃ

original: bye brag bshad par bya ste /🔽spyi bo dang lte ba ni ae yin la /
analyzed: bye brag bshad par bya ste / spyi bo dang lte ba ni ae yin la /
translated: will now be explained.🔽The crown and navel are e,

original: mgrin pa dang snying ga wam yin te /
analyzed: mgrin pa dang snying ga wam yin te /
translated: and the throat and heart are vaṃ.

original: steng 'og gi bye brag gis thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: steng 'og gi bye brag gis thabs dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the distinctions of above and below, they become the nature of method and wisdom.

original: ae wam gyi sgra de las sdud pa po'i gleng gzhi dang sbyar na mdo sde dang mthun pa'i yi ge'i don du bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: ae wam gyi sgra de las sdud pa po'i gleng gzhi dang sbyar na mdo sde dang mthun pa'i yi ge'i don du bshad par bya ste /
translated: If the sound EVAM is applied to the nidana of the compiler, it should be explained as the meaning of the syllables that accord with the sutras.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rjes su yi rang zhing bstod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gleng gzhi dang tshig gi mtshams sbyar nas /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rjes su yi rang zhing bstod do zhes bya ba'i bar du gleng gzhi dang tshig gi mtshams sbyar nas /
translated: Having connected the nidana from Thus have I heard up to I rejoice and praise,

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi bka' nyid du gnas pa yin pas bkar ba sgrub pa de la bshad pa'i rgyud kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi bka' nyid du gnas pa yin pas bkar ba sgrub pa de la bshad pa'i rgyud kyis 'chad par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: since it abides as the speech of the Bhagavan himself, the explanation of the tantra will be established.

original: yang na sprul pa'i skus 'dul ba'i ngor bde bar gshegs pas bshad la sdud pa pos gdul bya'i ngor sangs rgyas nyid du sdud pa por sprul pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sprul pa'i skus 'dul ba'i ngor bde bar gshegs pas bshad la sdud pa pos gdul bya'i ngor sangs rgyas nyid du sdud pa por sprul pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, from the perspective of those to be tamed by the nirmanakaya, the sugata explains [the tantra], and from the perspective of those to be tamed by the compiler, the compiler emanates as the Buddha.

original: de gnyis kyi don bshad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gzhan gyi tshe /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi don bshad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dus gzhan gyi tshe /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of those two, at another time the Bhagavan

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas gsol ba btab nas bshad pa'i rgyud gsungs kyang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas gsol ba btab nas bshad pa'i rgyud gsungs kyang 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though the tantra was taught by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas after they were requested to do so, there is no contradiction.

original: de skad du yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de skad du yang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo las /
translated: Thus, in the Nirvana Sutra,

original: sdud pa po nyid kyis gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: sdud pa po nyid kyis gsungs pa yin la /
translated: it is said that the compiler himself spoke,

original: de'i don rtogs par dka' ba yang mdo sde gzhan du nga nyid 'chad pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i don rtogs par dka' ba yang mdo sde gzhan du nga nyid 'chad pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: and that the meaning of that is difficult to understand, and that in other sutras he himself will explain it.

original: de ltar 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to teach the meaning of “thus have I heard,”

original: spyan ras gzigs kyis rtogs pa'i chags pa'i lam dus dang / sa'i snying pos rtogs pa'i dus ngan pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis rtogs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus so //
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyis rtogs pa'i chags pa'i lam dus dang / sa'i snying pos rtogs pa'i dus ngan pa dang / 'jam dpal gyis rtogs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dus so //
translated: there is the time of the path of passion realized by Avalokita, the time of the bad age realized by Ksitigarbha, and the time of the inconceivable realized by Manjusri.

original: de la bzang po ni bha ga'i dkyil 'khor bde ba'i rgyun 'jug pa'i dus so //
analyzed: de la bzang po ni bha ga'i dkyil 'khor bde ba'i rgyun 'jug pa'i dus so //
translated: Therein, the good is the time of the flow of the stream of bliss of the bhaga mandala.

original: ngan pa ni lus kyi dkyil 'khor rlung me'i drod can gyi srog aa wa dh'u t'ir 'jug pa'i dus so //
analyzed: ngan pa ni lus kyi dkyil 'khor rlung me'i drod can gyi srog aa wa dh'u t'ir 'jug pa'i dus so //
translated: The bad is the time of the body mandala, when the life-force wind enters the avadhuti with the heat of fire.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni sgyu ma dang stong pa ro gcig pa'i dus te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni sgyu ma dang stong pa ro gcig pa'i dus te /
translated: The inconceivable is the time of the single taste of illusion and emptiness.

original: chags pa ni dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba'i dus yin la /
analyzed: chags pa ni dga' ba dang mchog tu dga' ba'i dus yin la /
translated: Attachment is the time of joy and supreme joy.

original: chags bral ni dga' bral yin la /
analyzed: chags bral ni dga' bral yin la /
translated: Freedom from attachment is the separation from joy.

original: dbu ma ni lhan cig pa'i dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: dbu ma ni lhan cig pa'i dga' ba yin te /
translated: The middle is the joy of union.

original: de gsum mi dmigs pa ni bde ba chen po 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de gsum mi dmigs pa ni bde ba chen po 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of those three is the great bliss of clear light.

original: chags pa dang chags bral 'dres pa ni kun rdzob tu tha dad pa yin yang /
analyzed: chags pa dang chags bral 'dres pa ni kun rdzob tu tha dad pa yin yang /
translated: Although attachment and freedom from attachment are mixed, they are different on the conventional level.

original: don dam par ro gcig pa des na dngos dang dngos med ro gcig pa'i don ston pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par ro gcig pa des na dngos dang dngos med ro gcig pa'i don ston pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But since they are of one taste on the ultimate level, how is it that the meaning of the single taste of entity and non-entity is taught?

original: yon tan drug dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: yon tan drug dang ldan pa'am /
translated: It is taught by the one who possesses the six qualities,

original: nyon mongs pa dang @16b shes bya'i sgrib pa bcom pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang @16b shes bya'i sgrib pa bcom pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: or by the one who possesses the destruction of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, and is thus a “bhagavat.”

original: gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the abode?

original: sku dang gsung ni chos can yin la de yi chos nyid ni snying po yin no //
analyzed: sku dang gsung ni chos can yin la de yi chos nyid ni snying po yin no //
translated: The body and speech are the phenomena, and their reality is the essence.

original: de nyid sgrib pa gnyis kyis mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de nyid sgrib pa gnyis kyis mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste /
translated: That itself is the vajra because it is not divided by the two obstructions.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sgras btsun mo zhes grags so //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sgras btsun mo zhes grags so //
translated: In this regard, the word “tathāgatas” is known as “queen.”

original: de'i bha ga ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi stong pa nyid do //🔽kye bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi bha ga la rnam par mi rtog par ro gcig pa na bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i /
analyzed: de'i bha ga ni mi slob pa'i lam gyi stong pa nyid do // kye bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi bha ga la rnam par mi rtog par ro gcig pa na bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i /
translated: Her bhaga is the emptiness of the path of no more learning.

original: tha snyad ji ltar rung zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad ji ltar rung zhe na /
translated: “ Hey! How can it be proper to say that the Bhagavān dwells in the bhaga of the dharmadhātu, where there is one taste without conceptualization?”

original: lan du bka' stsal pa don dam par stong pa nyid dang ye shes ro gcig pa yin yang gdul bya'i skye bo mos pa'i dbang gis de rnams kyi yid 'phrog pa'i rgyud kyi gleng gzhi'i gnas padma dang zla ba dang gzhal yas khang dang / ro'i gdan dang /
analyzed: lan du bka' stsal pa don dam par stong pa nyid dang ye shes ro gcig pa yin yang gdul bya'i skye bo mos pa'i dbang gis de rnams kyi yid 'phrog pa'i rgyud kyi gleng gzhi'i gnas padma dang zla ba dang gzhal yas khang dang / ro'i gdan dang /
translated: In response, it is said that ultimately, emptiness and wisdom are of one taste, but due to the power of the inclinations of the beings to be tamed, the nidāna of the tantra that captivates their minds is the place of the lotus, moon, celestial mansion, seat of corpses,

original: btsun mo'i bha ga la bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun mo'i bha ga la bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: and the queen’s bhaga.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs kyi rnam pa der bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa la bdag gis thos so zhes mtshams sbyor ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs kyi rnam pa der bcom ldan 'das bzhugs pa la bdag gis thos so zhes mtshams sbyor ro //
translated: The Bhagavān dwells in that aspect of the dharma system, and I heard it.

original: de la ci'i phyir bha ga zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ci'i phyir bha ga zhes bya zhe na /
translated: In that regard, why is it called bhaga?

original: nyon mongs pa dag / shes rab stong pa nyid kyis 'joms pas na bha ga ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag / shes rab stong pa nyid kyis 'joms pas na bha ga ste /
translated: The bhaga is the destruction of the afflictions by the wisdom of emptiness.

original: de nyid snang ba med pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gdul bya nams kyis stong pa nyid la gseng brtol ba'i phyir bha ga'i gzugs su sprul cing bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid snang ba med pa'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes gdul bya nams kyis stong pa nyid la gseng brtol ba'i phyir bha ga'i gzugs su sprul cing bstan pa yin no //
translated: That very [wisdom] is the gnosis of omniscience, which is devoid of appearances. In order to reveal emptiness to disciples, it manifests in the form of a bhaga.

original: 'di rjod par byed pa'i chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di rjod par byed pa'i chos gang zhe na /
translated: What are the phenomena that express that?

original: gleng gzhi'i don de nyid kyis rjod par byed pa ni ae wam ma y'a zhes bya ba'i yi ge bzhi yin la rjod byed des rgyud dgu'i thabs dang shes rab kyi don ston pas na /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i don de nyid kyis rjod par byed pa ni ae wam ma y'a zhes bya ba'i yi ge bzhi yin la rjod byed des rgyud dgu'i thabs dang shes rab kyi don ston pas na /
translated: The four syllables e, vaṃ, ma, ya express that very meaning of the nidāna. Since that expression teaches the meaning of the method and wisdom of the nine tantras,

original: rgyud dgu'i chos kyi thog mar ae wam ma y'a bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyud dgu'i chos kyi thog mar ae wam ma y'a bstan pa yin no //
translated: the four syllables e vaṃ ma ya are taught at the beginning of the Dharma of the nine tantras.

original: dgos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dgos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that necessary?

original: sangs rgyas dag pa'i dngos grub skyed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dag pa'i dngos grub skyed //
translated: It generates the pure spiritual powers of the buddhas.

original: ces bya'o // mdo sde thams cad kyang ae wam ma y'a'i sgra brjod par bya ba yin na lan du lag na rdo rje zhes bya ba nas brjod du med pa'i don /
analyzed: ces bya'o // mdo sde thams cad kyang ae wam ma y'a'i sgra brjod par bya ba yin na lan du lag na rdo rje zhes bya ba nas brjod du med pa'i don /
translated: If all the sūtras are to be expressed by the sounds of e, vaṃ, and ma, then in response, Vajrapāṇi, the meaning of the inexpressible

original: nga yis sems can la bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: nga yis sems can la bstan pa yin la /
translated: is taught to sentient beings by me.

original: yi ge des phyag rgya bzhi shes rab la thabs bzhugs so zhes bya bar khong du chud pas 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las ring du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge des phyag rgya bzhi shes rab la thabs bzhugs so zhes bya bar khong du chud pas 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las ring du 'gro ba'o //
translated: By understanding that the four seals are present in wisdom through method by that syllable, one goes far from the ocean of saṃsāra.

original: sems de'i chos nyid rtogs pa ltar chos thams cad kyi chos nyid rtogs na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems de'i chos nyid rtogs pa ltar chos thams cad kyi chos nyid rtogs na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If, as it is realized in the nature of mind, the nature of all phenomena is realized, what will happen?

original: brgya lam zhig na /
analyzed: brgya lam zhig na /
translated: It is said:

original: thams cad las ni sems bsdus nas //
analyzed: thams cad las ni sems bsdus nas //
translated: Having gathered everything into the mind,

original: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo med par //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo med par //
translated: the inner nature,

original: dul ba'i sems kyi mtshon @17a * //
analyzed: dul ba'i sems kyi mtshon @17a * //
translated: with the weapon of the disciplined mind,

original: byed kyis // chos thams cad kyi mtshon bya mngon sum du byas nas tshe 'di nyid la rdo rje 'dzin pa thob bo //
analyzed: byed kyis // chos thams cad kyi mtshon bya mngon sum du byas nas tshe 'di nyid la rdo rje 'dzin pa thob bo //
translated: having manifested the object of all phenomena, one attains Vajradhara in this very life.

original: gang gis sems kyi stong nyid ma shes pa de srid kyi bar du bsam gtan dang / gzugs med kyi lha'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis sems kyi stong nyid ma shes pa de srid kyi bar du bsam gtan dang / gzugs med kyi lha'i bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as one does not understand the emptiness of mind, one will experience the bliss of the meditative concentrations and the formless realm.

original: gang gi tshe mngon sum gyi lam de las ma yin no zhes spangs na mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngon sum gyi lam de las ma yin no zhes spangs na mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when one rejects the path of direct perception, saying, “It is not,” one will be reborn in the Avīci hell.

original: dpal ldan gang zhig gis mngon sum gyi lam dag pa'i sems kyi phyag rgya bzhi'i shes rab ji ltar rnyed pa bzhin du thams cad kyi bsgoms na rang rig pa'i glo bur gyi dri ma dag pa'i mtshon bya rtogs nas khams gsum pa'i chos nyid nam mkha' dang
analyzed: dpal ldan gang zhig gis mngon sum gyi lam dag pa'i sems kyi phyag rgya bzhi'i shes rab ji ltar rnyed pa bzhin du thams cad kyi bsgoms na rang rig pa'i glo bur gyi dri ma dag pa'i mtshon bya rtogs nas khams gsum pa'i chos nyid nam mkha' dang
translated: The glorious one who, in accordance with the way of direct perception, realizes the wisdom of the four mudras of the pure mind and meditates on all of them will realize the object of self-awareness, the pure essence, and the reality of the three realms will be seen to be like space.

original: mnyam par gzigs pa chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod dang / sprul sku'i gzugs yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bus sems can gyi don mdzad pa de yang mngon sum gyi rgyu rkyen dang bral na ni chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab par mtshon par mi nus so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzigs pa chos kyi sku dang / longs spyod dang / sprul sku'i gzugs yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bus sems can gyi don mdzad pa de yang mngon sum gyi rgyu rkyen dang bral na ni chos kyi dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab par mtshon par mi nus so //
translated: The Dharma Body, which is the equality of the three Bodies, and the Form Bodies of Enjoyment and Emanation, which are like wish-fulfilling gems, are the means for accomplishing the aims of sentient beings. If they were separated from the direct cause and conditions, they would not be able to illustrate the inconceivable Dharma Sphere.

original: rab tu byed pa bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the fourth chapter.

original: // / de ltar le'u dang pos zab pa'i rdzogs rim gyi shes bya bshad nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar le'u dang pos zab pa'i rdzogs rim gyi shes bya bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the knowledge of the profound completion stage in the first chapter,

original: da ni nyams su blangs pa dbang bskur ba'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni nyams su blangs pa dbang bskur ba'i rim pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the practice of the stages of empowerment will be explained.

original: thog mar dkyil 'khor dang bar du tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang tha mar dbang bskur ba'i don bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: thog mar dkyil 'khor dang bar du tshogs kyi 'khor lo dang tha mar dbang bskur ba'i don bshad par bya'o //
translated: First, the mandala, in the middle the ganacakra, and finally the empowerment will be explained.

original: de ltar sgrub pa po la phan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa po la phan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, for the benefit of the practitioner,

original: dbang bskur ba'i tshigs bcad gcig gis mdor bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i tshigs bcad gcig gis mdor bstan pa yin la /
translated: the empowerment is briefly explained in one verse.

original: de rgyas par bshad pa ni dang por bdag nyid lha'i dngos por byas la /
analyzed: de rgyas par bshad pa ni dang por bdag nyid lha'i dngos por byas la /
translated: The extensive explanation is as follows: First, having made oneself into the deity,

original: rdo rjes sa sbyang ba'i phyir yi ge h'um las rdo rje 'bar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rjes sa sbyang ba'i phyir yi ge h'um las rdo rje 'bar bar bya'o //
translated: In order to purify the ground with the vajra, one should visualize a blazing vajra from the syllable hūṃ.

original: de ltar sa sbyang ba dang bslang ba dang brtag pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar sa sbyang ba dang bslang ba dang brtag pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the purification, consecration, and examination of the ground,

original: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bshad pa yin no //
translated: now, in one verse, [the author] explains the examination of the colors.

original: tshon brtag pa ni 'byor pa'i dbang gis rin po che las byas pa'am /
analyzed: tshon brtag pa ni 'byor pa'i dbang gis rin po che las byas pa'am /
translated: The examination of the colors is as follows: according to one's wealth, one should prepare the colors with precious substances,

original: 'bring gis bsres pa'am /
analyzed: 'bring gis bsres pa'am /
translated: with the middling, with mixed [substances],

original: tha mas 'bras kyi phye mas tshon rtsi bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: tha mas 'bras kyi phye mas tshon rtsi bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and with the least, with rice flour.

original: chung tshad gru gsum pa'i dkyil 'khor la /
analyzed: chung tshad gru gsum pa'i dkyil 'khor la /
translated: The small measure is a triangular maṇḍala,

original: sor gsum gyi mtha' skor lhag pa ni tshon brtag pa'o //
analyzed: sor gsum gyi mtha' skor lhag pa ni tshon brtag pa'o //
translated: with a perimeter of three finger breadths, with an excess. This is the examination of the colors.

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag brtag pa ni sngags kyi lam gyi bsnyen bsgrub bzhis sbyang ba byas nas dbang bskur ba thob pa'i rigs lnga'am /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag brtag pa ni sngags kyi lam gyi bsnyen bsgrub bzhis sbyang ba byas nas dbang bskur ba thob pa'i rigs lnga'am /
translated: The examination of the branches of accomplishment is as follows: having purified oneself with the four [stages of] approach and accomplishment of the path of mantra, having obtained the empowerment, one should enter the maṇḍala of the five families,

original: yang na gar mkhan la sogs pa'i rigs bzhi'i dkyil 'khor der gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gar mkhan la sogs pa'i rigs bzhi'i dkyil 'khor der gzhug par bya'o //
translated: or else, of the four families of the dancer and so forth.

original: ji ltar sgrub pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa brtag pa ni mngon sum gyi lam mam /
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub pa'i yan lag tu gyur pa brtag pa ni mngon sum gyi lam mam /
translated: The branch of how to accomplish is the analysis of the path of direct perception.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad @17b kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i gzugs kyi sku'i pho brang na gnas pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pas zlos gar byas nas 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa'i bud med kyi dbang phyug dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad @17b kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i gzugs kyi sku'i pho brang na gnas pa bzhin du rnal 'byor pas zlos gar byas nas 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa'i bud med kyi dbang phyug dang /
translated: Just as all buddhas abide in the maṇḍala of the dharmadhātu, the saṃbhogakāya, and the palace of the nirmāṇakāya, the yogin should perform the dance and take the power of the women of the limitless world systems

original: las kyi phyag rgya la sems gzung bar bya zhing longs spyod du blangs na gdon mi za bar sems can rnams dam tshig nyams par gyur pa'i 'jigs pa thugs la bzhag nas /
analyzed: las kyi phyag rgya la sems gzung bar bya zhing longs spyod du blangs na gdon mi za bar sems can rnams dam tshig nyams par gyur pa'i 'jigs pa thugs la bzhag nas /
translated: and the karmamudra as the object of the mind. If one takes them as objects of enjoyment, one should definitely keep in mind the fear of the samaya being impaired by sentient beings.

original: byin rlabs kyi go 'phang dga' ba gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi don dam pa'i bden pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral ba /
analyzed: byin rlabs kyi go 'phang dga' ba gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi don dam pa'i bden pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bral ba /
translated: The stage of the blessing is the three joys and the ultimate truth of the buddhas, free from the eighty natural concepts.

original: sngags pa'i lam yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngags pa'i lam yang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' bzhin du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The path of mantra is also realized like the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar dbang bskur ba'i gnas dang sa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang bskur ba'i gnas dang sa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the stages and grounds of empowerment in this way,

original: da ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni tshogs kyi 'khor lo bshad par bya ste /
translated: now the gaṇacakra will be explained.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi dam tshig 'da' bar dka' ba dang / rgyal ba nyid las skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mngon sum du dbang nod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' dang de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi dam tshig 'da' bar dka' ba dang / rgyal ba nyid las skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mngon sum du dbang nod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the difficult-to-cross samaya of the deities such as Vajrasattva and the tathāgatas, and because the bodhisattvas born from the victors themselves are empowered in the presence of the maṇḍala.

original: de ltar dgos pa bshad nas de'i rten slob dpon bshad pa ni /🔽zab pa dang rgya che ba'i yon tan rgya mtsho dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: de ltar dgos pa bshad nas de'i rten slob dpon bshad pa ni / zab pa dang rgya che ba'i yon tan rgya mtsho dang ldan pa la /
translated: Having explained the purpose in that way, the master who is the support of that is explained.

original: chags lam grol lam gyi tshogs 'khor dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: chags lam grol lam gyi tshogs 'khor dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should offer the gaṇacakra of the path of desire and the path of liberation to the ocean of qualities of the profound and vast.

original: rten slob dpon bshad nas /
analyzed: rten slob dpon bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the master who is the support,

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag rnal 'byor ma bshad pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag rnal 'byor ma bshad pa ni /
translated: the yoginīs of the branches of practice are explained.

original: ma dang sring mo la sogs pa'i sngags skyes dbang thob pa'am /
analyzed: ma dang sring mo la sogs pa'i sngags skyes dbang thob pa'am /
translated: The empowerment is obtained from the mantra-born mother, sister, and so on.

original: de med na kun spyod ma la sogs pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: de med na kun spyod ma la sogs pa'ang rung ste /
translated: If that is not available, then any woman is suitable, such as a prostitute.

original: 'di ni bde mchog gi rtsa ba'i rgyud du rnal 'byor 'khyil ma dang / khu byug lta bur skad snyan pa dang / rdo rje lta bur skad gsal ba rnams la /
analyzed: 'di ni bde mchog gi rtsa ba'i rgyud du rnal 'byor 'khyil ma dang / khu byug lta bur skad snyan pa dang / rdo rje lta bur skad gsal ba rnams la /
translated: This is praised by the Buddha in the Heruka Root Tantra, in the section on the yoginī, in the passage beginning “She is sweet-voiced like a cuckoo, clear-voiced like a vajra.”

original: sangs rgyas kyis bstod pas de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis bstod pas de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should take her.

original: yang na zhing skyes kyi dbye ba ni bram ze mo la sogs pa rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: yang na zhing skyes kyi dbye ba ni bram ze mo la sogs pa rnam pa bdun te /
translated: Alternatively, the classification of field-born is sevenfold, such as the brahmin woman.

original: de la bzo byed pa'i rigs ngan smyig ma mkhan la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni smyig ma mkhan dang lha ma mkhan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzo byed pa'i rigs ngan smyig ma mkhan la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni smyig ma mkhan dang lha ma mkhan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The low-caste woman who is a craftswoman is a weaver, a cobbler, and so on.

original: sems kyi mtshan nyid ni dam tshig bsrung ba dang / lha'i sku'i spyod lam bsgom pa las 'grub pa dang / chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid shes pa dang / dbyibs kyi de kho na nyid shes pas ni sgrub pa po'i sdig pa zad par byed pa dang /
analyzed: sems kyi mtshan nyid ni dam tshig bsrung ba dang / lha'i sku'i spyod lam bsgom pa las 'grub pa dang / chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid shes pa dang / dbyibs kyi de kho na nyid shes pas ni sgrub pa po'i sdig pa zad par byed pa dang /
translated: The characteristics of the mind are accomplished by protecting the commitments, meditating on the deity’s body, and the conduct, knowing the reality of phenomena, knowing the reality of mantra, and knowing the reality of shape.

original: btsan phyug ni ldang ba yang ba dang / zo mdog bde ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos @18a * //
analyzed: btsan phyug ni ldang ba yang ba dang / zo mdog bde ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos @18a * //
translated: One will also attain the mundane accomplishments such as lightness, good complexion, and so forth,

original: grub dang / bsam gtan bzhi'i thun mong gi dngos grub dang / mchog gi dngos grub kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub dang / bsam gtan bzhi'i thun mong gi dngos grub dang / mchog gi dngos grub kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the common accomplishments of the four meditative concentrations, and the supreme accomplishment.

original: yang na ji ltar rnyed pa'i lo tshogs kyi rang bzhin gzugs dang lang tsho la sogs pas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar rnyed pa'i lo tshogs kyi rang bzhin gzugs dang lang tsho la sogs pas brgyan pa'o //
translated: Or else, one should visualize the form of the goddess adorned with youthfulness and so forth, as one finds her.

original: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gang gis rtogs par byed ce na /🔽du ba las ni mer shes shing //
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gang gis rtogs par byed ce na / du ba las ni mer shes shing //
translated: By what specific characteristics is she to be known?🔽From smoke one knows fire,

original: chu skyar las ni chu yin te //
analyzed: chu skyar las ni chu yin te //
translated: and from the osprey one knows water.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan gyis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo ldan gyis //
translated: In the same way, the wise bodhisattva

original: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams kyis shes //
analyzed: rigs ni mtshan ma rnams kyis shes //
translated: knows the family by its signs.

original: zhes gsungs pas de gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bsnyen sgrub bzhis sbyangs nas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas de gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa bsnyen sgrub bzhis sbyangs nas /
translated: Thus, having trained in the four means of gathering disciples such as going for refuge and so forth,

original: sngags dang rgyud dang de kho na nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud dang de kho na nyid shes pa'o //
translated: one should know the mantra, the tantra, and reality.

original: de la sngags ni bsgom bzlas so //
analyzed: de la sngags ni bsgom bzlas so //
translated: Here, the mantra is meditation and recitation.

original: rgyud ni sman no //
analyzed: rgyud ni sman no //
translated: The tantra is the medicine.

original: de nyid ni ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni ye shes lnga'o //
translated: That is the five intuitions.

original: gsang chen de ltar sbyangs nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gsang chen de ltar sbyangs nas zhes pa ni /
translated: Having thus purified the great secret,

original: lus dang ngag gi bya bas sbyangs nas so //🔽de skad du yang /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi bya bas sbyangs nas so // de skad du yang /
translated: having purified by the actions of body and speech.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: And thus it is said in the Root Tantra:

original: gzhi ni sa gzhir byas nas su //
analyzed: gzhi ni sa gzhir byas nas su //
translated: Having made the ground the basis,

original: rnal 'byor pas ni longs spyod bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni longs spyod bya // zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the yogi should enjoy it.

original: mnyam sbyor las kyang /
analyzed: mnyam sbyor las kyang /
translated: And in the Sampuṭa Tantra:

original: de nas khrus bya dri zhim lus //
analyzed: de nas khrus bya dri zhim lus //
translated: Then, having bathed, with a fragrant body,

original: ci 'byor pa yi gos dang rgyan //
analyzed: ci 'byor pa yi gos dang rgyan //
translated: with whatever clothes and ornaments,

original: sna tshogs gos ni thogs nas kyang //
analyzed: sna tshogs gos ni thogs nas kyang //
translated: having put on various clothes,
