translated: Then, having generated the eight goddesses in the manner of womb birth from the union of method and wisdom, they should be placed in their respective places.

original: de nas rgyu'i he ru ka zhu ba dang / phyogs bzhi'i lha mo ma gtogs pa sa'i lha mo pukka sv'i dang / chu'i lha mo ri khrod ma dang / me'i tsanda l'i dang / rlung gi dom bi n'i bzhis glus bskul ba dang / 'bras bu'i he ru ka bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas rgyu'i he ru ka zhu ba dang / phyogs bzhi'i lha mo ma gtogs pa sa'i lha mo pukka sv'i dang / chu'i lha mo ri khrod ma dang / me'i tsanda l'i dang / rlung gi dom bi n'i bzhis glus bskul ba dang / 'bras bu'i he ru ka bskyed pa yin no //
translated: Then, after the causal Heruka melts, the resultant Heruka is generated by the urging song of the four goddesses, except for the goddesses of the four directions: Pukkasi, the goddess of earth; Śavarī, the goddess of water; Caṇḍālī, the goddess of fire; and Ḍombinī, the goddess of wind.

original: de'i don 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is explained as follows.

original: rgyu'i he ru ka mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lngas bskyed nas /
analyzed: rgyu'i he ru ka mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lngas bskyed nas /
translated: The causal Heruka is generated by the five manifest enlightenments.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhal nas zhugs te /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhal nas zhugs te /
translated: The buddhas of the ten directions enter through his mouth.

original: btsun mo yum gyi bha gar lha mo brgyad kyi yig 'brur gyur pa dang lha mo brgyad mngal skyes kyi rim pas phyogs skyong brgyad kyi thog tu bzhag la /
analyzed: btsun mo yum gyi bha gar lha mo brgyad kyi yig 'brur gyur pa dang lha mo brgyad mngal skyes kyi rim pas phyogs skyong brgyad kyi thog tu bzhag la /
translated: The seed syllables of the eight goddesses in the bhaga of the queen mother and the eight goddesses in the womb-born stage are placed on the eight direction protectors.

original: de nas rgyu'i he ru ka chos kyi skur zhu ba dang / de las mtshams kyi 'byung ba bzhi'i rlung gi rang bzhin 'od kyi thig le dkar dmar bskul bas thig le gnyis nyi zla'i rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / aam h'um yig 'bru gnyis dang thod pa dang phyag mtshan gri gug gnyis dang /
analyzed: de nas rgyu'i he ru ka chos kyi skur zhu ba dang / de las mtshams kyi 'byung ba bzhi'i rlung gi rang bzhin 'od kyi thig le dkar dmar bskul bas thig le gnyis nyi zla'i rang bzhin du gyur pa dang / aam h'um yig 'bru gnyis dang thod pa dang phyag mtshan gri gug gnyis dang /
translated: Then the causal Heruka melts into the dharmakaya, and from that the four intermediate elements are activated by the nature of the wind, the white and red light bindus. The two bindus become the nature of the sun and moon, the two seed syllables aṃ and hūṃ, the skull cup, and the two flaying knives.

original: 'od zer spro bsdu gnyis dang rgyu brgyad las /
analyzed: 'od zer spro bsdu gnyis dang rgyu brgyad las /
translated: The two emanations and reabsorptions of light rays and the eight causes

original: 'bras bu he ru ka sprul pa'i sku rdo rje can ni chen por bzhengs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu he ru ka sprul pa'i sku rdo rje can ni chen por bzhengs zhes pa'o //
translated: are the emanation body of the resultant Heruka, the great one with the vajra.

original: zhabs ni sa la bsnun ba yis //
analyzed: zhabs ni sa la bsnun ba yis //
translated: The feet stamp on the earth.

original: zhes pa ni bdud bzhi'i steng na gar dang bcas pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdud bzhi'i steng na gar dang bcas pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse: “He stands in the midst of the four Maras, dancing.

original: gam tsam la sogs pa ni lha mo'i sa bon no //
analyzed: gam tsam la sogs pa ni lha mo'i sa bon no //
translated: “ Gam, etc., are the seed syllables of the goddesses.

original: dga' ba'i bdag po'i sa bon dang // zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dga' ba'i bdag po'i sa bon dang // zhes pa ni /
translated: “ The seed syllable of the Lord of Joy, etc.,

original: 'bras bu he ru ka yab yum gyi sa bon no //
analyzed: 'bras bu he ru ka yab yum gyi sa bon no //
translated: refers to the seed syllables of the resultant Heruka Father and Mother.

original: sa bon de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those seed syllables?

original: h'um dang aam ni 'bar ba las //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: h'um dang aam ni 'bar ba las // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “ Hum and Am, blazing, etc.

original: ma mo'i grong khyer zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: ma mo'i grong khyer zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: “ The city of the Mothers, etc., is easy to understand.

original: sgeg pa'i nyams ni 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: sgeg pa'i nyams ni 'khyud pa'o //
translated: The mood of grace is the embrace.

original: dpa' ba ni bdud bzhi gnon pa'o //
analyzed: dpa' ba ni bdud bzhi gnon pa'o //
translated: The mood of heroism is the suppression of the four Maras.

original: @32b 'jigs pa ni spyan gsum khro gnyer phyag bcu drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: @32b 'jigs pa ni spyan gsum khro gnyer phyag bcu drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The mood of terror is the three eyes and the sixteen arms.

original: brjid pa ni zhal dbus ma'o //🔽drag po ni zhal g-yas pa'o //
analyzed: brjid pa ni zhal dbus ma'o // drag po ni zhal g-yas pa'o //
translated: The mood of majesty is the central face.🔽The mood of violence is the right face.

original: 'jigs su rung ba ni zhal g-yon pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba ni zhal g-yon pa'o //
translated: The mood of fearfulness is the left face.

original: snying rje ni spyan dmar ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni spyan dmar ba'o //
translated: The mood of compassion is the red eyes.

original: rngam pa ni zhal gdongs pa'o //
analyzed: rngam pa ni zhal gdongs pa'o //
translated: The mood of wrath is the gaping mouth.

original: zhi ba ni thal bas byugs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni thal bas byugs pa'o //
translated: The mood of peace is the ashes.

original: mgo bo'i do shal mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: mgo bo'i do shal mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The phrase wearing a necklace of heads and so forth is easy to understand.🔽The four doors are the four goddesses who tame humans and non-humans.

original: sgo bzhi ni mi 'am cis 'dul bar byed pas na shar du rta'i gdong can /🔽byang du phag gi gdong can /
analyzed: sgo bzhi ni mi 'am cis 'dul bar byed pas na shar du rta'i gdong can / byang du phag gi gdong can /
translated: In the east is the horse-faced one;🔽in the north is the pig-faced one;

original: nub tu khyi'i gdong can /
analyzed: nub tu khyi'i gdong can /
translated: in the west is the dog-faced one;

original: lhor seng ge'i gdong can no //
analyzed: lhor seng ge'i gdong can no //
translated: and in the south is the lion-faced one.

original: mtshams kyi lha mo bzhi ni phyag gnyis kyis gling bu 'bud pa sngo ba dang / pi wang brdung ba ser ba dang / rnga bo che brdung ba dmar ba dang / rdza rnga brdung ba ni ljang ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi lha mo bzhi ni phyag gnyis kyis gling bu 'bud pa sngo ba dang / pi wang brdung ba ser ba dang / rnga bo che brdung ba dmar ba dang / rdza rnga brdung ba ni ljang ba'o //
translated: The four goddesses in the intermediate directions have two arms, play flutes, and are blue; play vīṇās, and are yellow; play bherī drums, and are red; and play clay drums, and are green.

original: sdo ser dkar po zhes bya ba ni sgo ba bzhil  zhal gsum gsum yod pa zhal gnyis ni tha mal pa'i gdong la gcig ni dud 'gro'i gdong yin no //
analyzed: sdo ser dkar po zhes bya ba ni sgo ba bzhil  zhal gsum gsum yod pa zhal gnyis ni tha mal pa'i gdong la gcig ni dud 'gro'i gdong yin no //
translated: The phrase blue, yellow, white, and so forth refers to the four door goddesses, each of whom has three faces. Two of the faces are normal human faces, and one is the face of an animal.

original: des na sgob rnams kyi sku mdog dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: des na sgob rnams kyi sku mdog dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the colors of the goddesses correspond to the colors of the door faces.

original: de rnams la yig 'bru dgod pa dang / go cha bskon pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / bdud rtsi myang ba dang / bsgom pa dang / bzlas pa dang / mchod pa dang / bstod pa bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la yig 'bru dgod pa dang / go cha bskon pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / bdud rtsi myang ba dang / bsgom pa dang / bzlas pa dang / mchod pa dang / bstod pa bya'o //
translated: One should place the seed syllable, put on the armor, introduce the gnosis being, confer initiation, taste the elixir, meditate, recite, make offerings, and praise.

original: ldang ba'i tshe na dkyil 'khor bsdus la /
analyzed: ldang ba'i tshe na dkyil 'khor bsdus la /
translated: When rising, one should dissolve the maṇḍala,

original: rigs drug gi yi ge bkod la ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs drug gi yi ge bkod la ldang bar bya'o //
translated: and rise after arranging the syllables of the six families.

original: brtag pa gsum pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: brtag pa gsum pa'i rab tu byed pa dang po'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the first chapter of the third section.

original: // / de ltar zhal brgyad pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs bshad nas /
analyzed: // / de ltar zhal brgyad pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the method of achieving the eight-faced one,

original: da ni ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sgrub thabs bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i sgrub thabs bshad par bya ste /
translated: now, the method of achieving the Gnosis Ḍākinī will be explained.

original: nyon cig ces pa ni rdo rje snying po la bod pa'o //
analyzed: nyon cig ces pa ni rdo rje snying po la bod pa'o //
translated: Listen! is addressed to Vajragarbha.

original: gnyis po spangs nas su zhes pa ni thabs dor ba'i dpa' mo 'ba' zhig bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis po spangs nas su zhes pa ni thabs dor ba'i dpa' mo 'ba' zhig bsgom pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned the two, one should meditate only on the heroine who has abandoned the method.

original: gnyis med chos kyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: gnyis med chos kyi ye shes ni //
translated: The gnosis of nondual Dharma

original: zhes pa lha mo gcig pus dbyings dang ye shes ro gcig par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lha mo gcig pus dbyings dang ye shes ro gcig par bsgom pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the single goddess as the single taste of the realm and pristine consciousness.

original: mkha' 'gro ma'i sgrub thabs zhes pa ni rdo rje rigs kyi lha mo'i sgrub pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma'i sgrub thabs zhes pa ni rdo rje rigs kyi lha mo'i sgrub pa'i thabs so //
translated: The means of accomplishment of the dakini is the means of accomplishing the dakini of the vajra family.

original: de ltar mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa ni rnal 'byor kun gyi dang po zhes pa ni lha'i sku bskyed pa'i thog mar stod pa'i byang chub bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan nas rgyas par bshad pa ni rnal 'byor kun gyi dang po zhes pa ni lha'i sku bskyed pa'i thog mar stod pa'i byang chub bsgom pa'o //
translated: Having explained that in brief, the extensive explanation is “the beginning of all yogas” is meditating on the bodhicitta that is explained at the beginning of generating the deity’s body.

original: de la sngags dang pa ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: de la sngags dang pa ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: The first mantra is the utterly pure dharmatā by nature.

original: sngags gnyis pa ni lus ngag yid gsum rdo rje rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sngags gnyis pa ni lus ngag yid gsum rdo rje rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The second mantra is the utterly pure body, voice, and mind.

original: sngags gsum pa ni sgyu ma dang stong pa'i rnal 'byor dag pa'o //
analyzed: sngags gsum pa ni sgyu ma dang stong pa'i rnal 'byor dag pa'o //
translated: The third mantra is the utterly pure yoga of illusion and emptiness.

original: de brjod pas @33a * //
analyzed: de brjod pas @33a * //
translated: By expressing that,

original: de'i don stong pa nyid kyang bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i don stong pa nyid kyang bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: the meaning of that, emptiness, is also meditated.

original: de ltar stong pa'i byang chub bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa'i byang chub bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the bodhicitta of emptiness in that way,

original: de'i gnas bshad pa ni yid du 'ong ba'i gnas su zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i gnas bshad pa ni yid du 'ong ba'i gnas su zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the explanation of the place of that is “in a pleasing place.”

original: gnas der bla re bre ba dang / ba dan dang rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba dang / dri'i thig le dang / me tog gis dgram pa yang bya'o //
analyzed: gnas der bla re bre ba dang / ba dan dang rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba dang / dri'i thig le dang / me tog gis dgram pa yang bya'o //
translated: In that place, one should also hang canopies, hoist banners and flags, make circles of perfume, and scatter flowers.

original: gnas der ci zhig bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: gnas der ci zhig bsgom zhe na /
translated: What should one meditate on in that place?

original: blo ldan mchod pas sngon 'gro bas //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: blo ldan mchod pas sngon 'gro bas // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The wise one, having first made offerings,

original: skad cig tsam gyi rnal 'byor gyis ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i skur bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig tsam gyi rnal 'byor gyis ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i skur bsgom par bya'o //
translated: should meditate on the instant yoga.

original: de skad du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de skad du ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: tshogs sogs pa'i dus dang / tshad med pa bzhi bzhis sems can gyi don byed pa'i dus dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo'i dus dang / ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa stong pa'i byang chub kyi dus su skad cig mas ye shes mkha' 'gro ma bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs sogs pa'i dus dang / tshad med pa bzhi bzhis sems can gyi don byed pa'i dus dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo'i dus dang / ye shes kyi tshogs sogs pa stong pa'i byang chub kyi dus su skad cig mas ye shes mkha' 'gro ma bsgom par bya'o //
translated: At the time of gathering the accumulations, at the time of benefiting sentient beings with the four immeasurables, at the time of the protection wheel, and at the time of the emptiness of enlightenment, which is the accumulation of wisdom, one should meditate on the instant yoga of the wisdom dakini.

original: de ltar sngon du 'gro ba'i rnal 'byor byas nas stong pa'i byang chub bsgom pa'i rjes la rdo rje'i sa sbyang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sngon du 'gro ba'i rnal 'byor byas nas stong pa'i byang chub bsgom pa'i rjes la rdo rje'i sa sbyang bar bya ste /
translated: Having performed the preliminary yoga in that way, after meditating on emptiness, one should purify the vajra ground.

original: bya ba'i cho ga de nyid kyis //
analyzed: bya ba'i cho ga de nyid kyis //
translated: By that very rite of action,

original: ye shes mkha' 'gro bsgom par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ye shes mkha' 'gro bsgom par bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: one should meditate on the knowledge dakini.

original: bya ba'i cho ga ni /
analyzed: bya ba'i cho ga ni /
translated: As for the rite of action,

original: yam las rlung /🔽ram las me /
analyzed: yam las rlung / ram las me /
translated: from yām arises wind,🔽from raṃ arises fire,

original: bam las chu /
analyzed: bam las chu /
translated: from vaṃ arises water,

original: lam las gser gyis gzhi /
analyzed: lam las gser gyis gzhi /
translated: and from laṃ arises a golden ground.

original: ye shes kyi snang ba bsgom pa ni ye shes rgya mtsho bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba bsgom pa ni ye shes rgya mtsho bsgom pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the appearance of pristine consciousness is the meditation on the ocean of pristine consciousness.

original: de'i steng du sum las ri'i rgyal po ri rab bskyed par bya ba ni phyogs bzhi kha dog bzhir gnas pa'i /
analyzed: de'i steng du sum las ri'i rgyal po ri rab bskyed par bya ba ni phyogs bzhi kha dog bzhir gnas pa'i /
translated: On top of that, one should generate Mount Meru, the king of mountains, from suṃ, which is the four directions with four colors.

original: lhun po'i gzugs su bsams nas ni //🔽zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: lhun po'i gzugs su bsams nas ni // zhes pa yin no //
translated: Having visualized the form of Meru,

original: de'i steng du bhr'um las gser las byas pa'i grong khyer ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i steng du bhr'um las gser las byas pa'i grong khyer ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: on top of that, one should meditate on the city made of gold, which arises from bhrūṃ.

original: sgo bzhi sgo khyud dang bcas pa dang / rta babs dang dra ba dang dra ba phyed pas brgyan pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi sgo khyud dang bcas pa dang / rta babs dang dra ba dang dra ba phyed pas brgyan pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the four gates with gate arches, adorned with archways and half-archways.

original: de'i dbus su aa sim aa las seng ge'i gdan lnga bskyed la /
analyzed: de'i dbus su aa sim aa las seng ge'i gdan lnga bskyed la /
translated: In the center of that, one should generate five lion seats from a siṃ and a laṃ.

original: de'i steng du gdugs dkar po dang nyi ma'i gdan yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du gdugs dkar po dang nyi ma'i gdan yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: On top of that, one should imagine a white parasol and a sun seat.

original: de ltar rten gyi dang po'i sbyor ba bskyed nas /
analyzed: de ltar rten gyi dang po'i sbyor ba bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the first yoga of the support in that way,

original: brten pa lha'i dang po'i sbyor ba bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: brten pa lha'i dang po'i sbyor ba bskyed pa ni /
translated: the first yoga of the deity, the supported, is generated.

original: rang gi dbugs ni yi ge h'um //
analyzed: rang gi dbugs ni yi ge h'um //
translated: One’s breath is the syllable hūṃ.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is stated.

original: rang gi dbugs ni yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: rang gi dbugs ni yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: One’s breath is the syllable hūṃ.

original: ye shes mkha' 'gro dbus su bsam //
analyzed: ye shes mkha' 'gro dbus su bsam //
translated: The gnosis dakini is imagined in the center.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'o //
translated: This is the vajra dakini.

original: zhal gnyis pa la sogs pa ni go lha'o //
analyzed: zhal gnyis pa la sogs pa ni go lha'o //
translated: The two faces and so on are understood.

original: shar du yang yi ge h'um las byung ba'o //🔽de bzhin du byang dang / nub dang / lho dang / dbang ldan dang / me dang / bden bral dang / @33b rlung ga gnas rnams su mkha' 'gro ma dang / 'dzag ma dang / ro langs mo dang / gtum mo dang / seng ge ma dang /
analyzed: shar du yang yi ge h'um las byung ba'o // de bzhin du byang dang / nub dang / lho dang / dbang ldan dang / me dang / bden bral dang / @33b rlung ga gnas rnams su mkha' 'gro ma dang / 'dzag ma dang / ro langs mo dang / gtum mo dang / seng ge ma dang /
translated: In the east, she arises from the syllable hūṃ.

original: rta rna mo dang / ce spyang mo dang / 'ug pa mo la sogs pa brgyad ni dkyil 'khor la bkod nas /
analyzed: rta rna mo dang / ce spyang mo dang / 'ug pa mo la sogs pa brgyad ni dkyil 'khor la bkod nas /
translated: In the same way, in the north, west, south, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, and in the center, the eight dakinis—the dakini, Lāmā, Khaṇḍarohā, Rūpiṇī, Īṣāṇī, Mahānāsā, Hākinī, and Ulūkā—and so on, are arranged in the maṇḍala.

original: de'i phyi rol gyi rim pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol gyi rim pa la /
translated: Outside of that, in the eastern direction, one should meditate on Hasā, in the northern direction on Dīpa, in the western direction on Bhaya, and in the southern direction on Kaṃpoche.

original: shar du bzhad ma dang / byang du mar me ma dang / nub tu 'jigs ma dang / lhor kam po tse bsgoms la phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang /
analyzed: shar du bzhad ma dang / byang du mar me ma dang / nub tu 'jigs ma dang / lhor kam po tse bsgoms la phung po dang khams dang skye mched byin gyis brlab pa dang / ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang /
translated: One should consecrate the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, introduce the gnosis being, confer initiation,

original: bdud rtsi myang ba dang / bsgom pa dang / bzlas pa dang / mchod pa dang / gtor ma bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi myang ba dang / bsgom pa dang / bzlas pa dang / mchod pa dang / gtor ma bya'o //
translated: taste the elixir, meditate, recite, make offerings, and offer bali.

original: de la bdud rtsi myong ba ni dang po lha mo ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i mdun du thod pa'i dbus su bdud rtsi lnga bzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la bdud rtsi myong ba ni dang po lha mo ye shes kyi mkha' 'gro ma'i mdun du thod pa'i dbus su bdud rtsi lnga bzhag pa ni /
translated: In the tasting of the elixir, first in front of the goddess Jñānadākinī, one should place the five elixirs in the center of the skull.🔽The quote continues:

original: dam tshig dag ni bstan par bya //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig dag ni bstan par bya // zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The pure commitments are taught.

original: rlung dang me zhes pa ni yum dang kshu mo //
analyzed: rlung dang me zhes pa ni yum dang kshu mo //
translated: Wind and fire are the mother and kṣa.

original: bdun pa la zhes pa ni bdud rtsi lnga'i steng du rigs lnga'i sa bon h'um aom tr'am hr'i: aa zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: shes pa ji ltar 'dod ce na //

translated: The fifteen causes are posited in dependence on the fifteen results, but they are not posited in dependence on difference.🔽Thus, in the inner maṇḍala, Nairātmya is in front, Vajrī is in the east, Gaurī is in the south, Jalayoginī is in the west, and Dākini is in the north. analyzed: lhor tsoo r'i ma dang / nub tu ro langs ma dang / byang du za phod ma dang / shar lhor @35a * //
translated: Candālī is in the southwest, Ḍombinī is in the northwest, and Śavarī is in the northeast.

analyzed: sbos me dang / lho nub tu ri khrod ma dang / nub byang du gtum mo dang / byang shar du g-yung mo dgod par bya'o //
